content:
Posted: November 29, 2016
												There will be no objectivity in this review, just my opinion on THIS stuff.First question for now is "what the hell?" I preordered this game in 2014 with season pass, I was waiting for it, it was something new to me, just whoah, look, you can drive through all the USA(okay, almost all). After release I played about 60 hrs and then gave up, because I bought and upgraded all the cars I wanted to 1299, after this it was nothing to do anymore. Between this time and WR release I entered The Crew couple of times just to check new cars(imho there are not so good to buy season pass).Wild Run. Okay, when I was watching all these trailers, reading news I thought "okay, this can be really interesting", but after WR release I understood, that all my thoughts were... wrong. Three new useless types of cars? Really, anyone used them anywhere except summit challenges? I haven't ever seen someone was driving through on drift or dragster or monster truck. I played in WR, participated in summit, even won something but I was still asking myself: "really, i paid for this??" Maybe I didn't know about some features?Calling All Units. I thought I won't have to pay for it *sigh* And I will NOT buy this, because it's just stupid. I preordered The Crew+SP, bought WR and now I need to buy CAU. And also I'm offered to buy Ultimate version which is much cheaper than buying The Crew+SP, then WR and then CAU. Nice job, well done, good game :/ Okay, we got it. But it's not all. Where's my lambo Huracan? I can't see her in my garage. Is it so hard just to add one car to "veteran" players? And why the hell I can be arrested when cop is driving near me with the same speed? Some guy arrested me on 200+ km/h... Just what? It's not funny, even if you are a cop.So, we got(imho) useless Season Pass, useless WIld Run and Calling All Units, not useless, but though I'm not sure after what happened. I am very dissapointed. The Crew had great potential, but Ivory Tower(or maybe its Ubi fault, don't know) think in another way. Yes, it was fun to travel around the USA, but without these DLCs game feels incomplete. That's not the way how it should work.P.S. optimization on PC isn't good at all too.

content:
Posted: September 28, 2016
												The Idea is neat, but the execution could have been better.The Crew expects you to grind, with more of the racing part feeling uninspiring and disconnected , But the FreeRoam is what  makes it Damn Good. You can Drive Cross-country and like in reality, You'd actually stop and take pictures. Not sure what other game makes people do this.+ Huge World to explore.+ Free Roam mode.++++Cockpit View.+++++ Photo mode+ Plenty of Cars/ Bikes with different specs.+ Weather system.+ Events/modes.+ NOW FREE ON UBISTORE [ Limited time, although i bought it on steam]+ Dev Support, after all these years, new content coming.+- An MMO ??!! PvP matches need better matchmaking(or needs to force a common level of cars for all players), oh and kids, learn to drive without pushing other people. This pushing is 90% of PvP. +- Controls need tweaking, a bit of manual modding and it's a lotta fun. +- A texture update would do wonders [fully maxed and some areas are just flat, but i guess its showing its age]- Story- Disconected Racing experience- DLCs [guess the new cops and robbers dlc might change that]- Grind for upgrades.- AIDont be thrown off by the negative reviews, most are from people who dont know to activate the steam bought version in Uplay. And i've never had any issues with Uplay whatsoever or these supposed glitches everyone keeps saying about the game. Some reviews are just plain mundane and pointless, and others disliking it after playing a good deal of hours. Real mature, people. I play this game mostly for fun and relaxation, and sometimes the races, Most times exploring the map in freeroam listening to trance music. Driving at daybreak(in cockpit view ofc) on the interstate in a Lamborghini and seeing the sun rise between the mountains or drifting up an icy mountain off road and reaching the top is just a great feeling. I honestly expect the game to be revived next year as a good  racing   Driving sim title in steam.i give it a 7/10 now and an 8/10 after the new dlc releases. More stuff to do. Hopefully.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
Driving and diving / Ecco the GolfinI've grown to love The Crew.I play it like an underwater diving game, only on land. Turn on the soapy ingame ambient radio. Dial down the engine sounds. Switch off the player tag cloud that shows which people are nearby. Mark a place on the map I want to go to.And then it's just peaceful gliding through landscapes of varying quality. Some are blander than others, sometimes the trees look like big matches stuck in the ground. I mostly enjoy the different kitschy light situations. Sunrise, sundown, The Crew's sun always finds new ways to surprise me and to colour everything in different ways.The MMO part, or let's say, the social component, seems like a total failure to me. I never saw anybody use the chat, unlike in TDU2, where people would often park their cars somewhere and have little group conversations that made it clear there were actual people in these cars. The only human contact I had during my 30 hours with The Crew was players trying to ram me into oblivion.Maybe it's my fault, but whilst TDU2 was The Sims on wheels,  The Crew seems to attract a crowd that's more into, well, driving, not chatting. That's okay, I guess.I enjoy driving. I wish more of my friends on Steam would take the plunge, but then again, driving around together could be very boring, I don't know? I suppose one has to be a proper bore to find diving-driving interesting.I play The Crew to relax and the game is successful at that.

												I don't think this game deserves that much negative criticism, I really like it, it's one of the only games of this type. The problem is Ubisoft's dodgy practice. The game has 1 expansion pack (at time of writing) and a few more DLCs. I own the very basic version, no expansion, no DLC and I can say that the after-game content is pretty lacking, all that is left to do is re-do some story missions to get better parts, do faction missions, PvP and that's about it without the expansion.Update: So as you may know, the Calling All Units expansion has been released and everyone gets something. Level cap has been increased to 60, performance cap has been increased to 1497, there are now more events to do, specifically crate runs. A nice addition is the fragment system, you need to get 10 fragments to unlock a car, you can get them from doing the crate runs. Platinum crates have a 100% chance of dropping a fragment.

content:
Posted: July 3, 2016
 This game will annoy you and hit every single nerve. You have been warned. For easily driving around with all freedom in the world, this is it. For a realistic game get NFS.What I just said I did not just say lightly. I like this game, I do. But in the 5 hours I have played this game so far (In one sitting) I have been so insanely upset and happy at the same time, I still don't know what to feel.You might ask now: What? How's that possible? Should I buy this now or na?Well, let me get to that for you now:If the game is on sale, YES. Get it. Own it. If not, then don't waste your money. (I paid 30€ for the Complete Edition and I do not regret it.)The first thing I can tell you is the handling is something you will HAVE to get used to. I played Need For Speed 2016 before this, so I was used to something more accurate. But the Handling in this game feels so heavy. Too heavy. But taking curves is fairiyl easy and makes fun.Offroad it is really easy to slide around corner and get overtaken by AI in every single race, but on the street it's much more difficult to steer. Irony, right?The handling in this game isn't great, that's obvious. But it's not the worst, either. After 5h I have gotten used to it and no longer get upset because of it. I'm sure if you get into the game even more you won't even notice it. It sure as hell doesn't make the whole game bad though.Depending on what vehicle you use, the handling should change, but it doesn't really. Even lighter cars still feel heavy. Bikes on the other hand feel much more comfortable and I actually prefer riding them.The drifting is great though, offroad and on the street. No arguments.Like I said, I played NFS2016 before this, and I can tell you something now.If you want a realistic racing game, that challenges you in every turn, is accurate with every car and requires skill and thought, get NFS. It's not just the realistic graphics and models, but the insanely good handling and difference with every car. It requires you to sit down and study it. It's Need for Speed. There's not much more to say, I loved it. The Crew on the other hand is different.It's not as realistic, the graphics are lower and the handling is a lot different. So, why should I even consider The Crew over NFS? Both MP and SP and both racing games.Well, no. NFS is good, really good. But like I said, it needs time and liking and skill. It's not something for everyone.While with The Crew you don't need to worry about your Computer Specs or low framerate. No need to study the game and learn how to drive every corner. Also; you can specialize on off-Road or Dragrace or whatever.In NFS, you can't. I like the Crew because it's a game for everyone. You can costumize your cars to whatever your prefered style is:Dragrace, Drifting, Performance, Street, Offroad, Monster Trucks, etc. In NFS, it's just street racing. But it's perfect. You see?Need for Speed is the ultimate Racing game because all you do is Race.In The Crew you do much more. You can specialize your vehicles and try different kinds of races, different spcialized enemies and upgrade them accordingly.The little challenges on your way help you improve your Parts and even get your amazing stuff for finishing it. Whenever you ride a road with a challenge twice, you always do the challenge. No matter what.NFS's tuning is detailed and thought through. You gotta see what parts fit and earn them.In The Crew you literally get them thrown in behind you. They fit your vehicle.And this is great. You can level easily and get good parts without having to win any races. Now, Pro's and Con's:Pro:- Huge World- Specialized Vehicle Costumization- A lot of Vehicles- Bikes- Easy to get into- A lot of small & big things to do- The sounds are actually good and don't cause earcancerCon's:- Not too good graphics- The god damn handling- AI- AI- AI- Did I mention AI?Now, AI. Yes, yes, yes. I HATE IT. Why? let me explain to you, my friend.So, in the beginning I chose wisely what veicle I chose and what parts, coming from NFS and all. I was always high in points than my opponents. My car was much more advanced. I did so to win easily, of course.But the AI didn't care. My car: 210 Street level. Theirs: 150. AND YET I ATE THEIR DUST. Seriously, at level 20 you can have the best gear, the AI can be low, you will have to play multiple times a single god damn race because the AI just takes off, and you start with no Nitro and they do.Plus, the traffic AI seems to be out for you, always stopping for the enemy AI, but never for you.There is this one Offroad race that I had to play 7 times, because the Mini copper had infinite Nitro and just blasted away. Had to hit him into a tree to win. #Tactics. And that shouldn't happen. The game can be so frustrating, it's annoying. It doesn't happen often, but when it does, it really gets on your nerve.Oh, you need to hunt down a car? Here, let me change lanes from the left to the right without indicators, so I drive right into you. Aw, that car is almost down with 20sec to go? Let me give it infinite nitro so you won't be able to catch up.Yes, the "ram this vehicle to kill it" missions are unfair as ♥♥♥♥, because they are always faster than you A lot. I had to learn their route to get them. #TacticsNr.2But despite all of that, I worked through it and I have to say: This game is good.Not the "YOU GOTTA GET THEM ALL"-kinda good, but it's good. You can play it.Getting the entire game, plus Season Pass + ALL DLC' for 30€ was a really good deal. But I wouldn't pay more for this game.Ending:This is a good racing game with specialized cars and certain terrainracing for everyone. It's simple to mod and easy to get parts. The graphics are alright, but at least it works smooth on medium PC's. MultiPlayer is great, but no worries, Singleplayer is a lot of fun, too. For a -once-in-a-while-online-racing-game where you don't have to put a lot of time in, it is amazing.For a NFS-like racing game, it's not. If you see something challenging and realistic, not annoying, buy NFS 2016.If you just wanna drive around, offroad, drag, drifting, get this. The Crew.  8.7/10And watch out for that grey van. It's always standing around corners or on streets. It doesn't move. It will find you and kill you.

number of helpful: 112 of 190 people (59%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												If you are looking for a solid multiplayer experience with your friends, do not buy this game. At the moment, the multiplayer aspect of the game barely works, and ironically, forming a crew with your friends is nigh on impossible. The singleplayer is solid enough, though gathering enough cash to buy new cars is a bit tedious. Edit: As of now, the multiplayer does seem functional enough for me to edit this review. While I cannot speak for the crew aspect (since none of my friends are interested in reinstalling the game so I can test it), PvP does seem to work fairly well for the moment. However, I was disappointed in the lack of variety in some PvP races; most notably in the Perf spec races. There is only one viable car to race with, the LaFerrari, forget trying to race with anything else because you will with most certainty lose.In the Street spec the Skyline is heavily favored, though it hardly matters what car you pick since most are fairly competitive. Sadly it is a spec that people rarely want to race with.As for Dirt spec races the Skyline is again favored by most players, though a skilled player should be able to stay with the pack in pretty much any car, granted it has all platinum parts installed.Raid is my favorite spec, but only because most cars in that class appear to be relatively balanced. What car you choose to race with appears to matter the least in this specific spec. As long as the car you choose has all platinum parts, you should be just fine with pretty much anything.And finally we come to the Circuit spec, and here the car does matter. From what I have seen you have three options in this spec. The Circuit Hotrod, the DLC Cadillac Escalade (I wish that was a joke) and finally the Alfa Romeo Competizione. The Hotrod is free, so that is what I recommend you get. When in a PvP lobby, expect to play a lot of Circuit and Perf spec races since these appear to be the most popular. And maybe once in a blue moon, you'll get to play a Street spec race.

number of helpful: 43 of 67 people (64%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												I was surprised at some of the car choices they had available, and then some of the cars they left out, but overall, this is truely a petrol head's MMO. I suspect they will be releasing DLC for more cars, considering they left out anything from Hennesy, Ferrari, Maserati, Bugatti and some legendary classics such as the Lambo Contach and Diablo.The late and great Mr. Shelby is represented well as his last creation is probably one of the meanest cars available for it's specialization.There's is a little something for every type of racer, Rally(Dirt), Street, Circuit(Traditional Races), Baja(Raid), then your borderline street legals (Perf). And all customizable according to the cars specs.Cars range from the 67 Mustangs, 69 Camaros and 70's Chargers to your top end cars like Pagani, Lamborghini, Luxury Sports such as the Mercedes SLS AMGs and BMW M series even the Bentley S along with a little everything in between.The driving simulation leaves a little to be desired, but with so much to do in the game you will barely notice it.The Downfall to this game... Ford Explorers. They are everywhere and ready to screw you over on the turns that matter, the skills that you need gold or plat completion on for that car part you need, or in general they're just brake checking you while you're going 300 miles in your Dodge Viper SRT 10 fit for circuit racing and when you adjust to avoid, they'll be sure to change lanes into oncomming traffic so you rear end them. Also, the game unnaturally pulls you from your direction of travel at times and you need to compensate for that, which can mean over compensation and ruining your run. Public enemy #1 is still those damn Explorers.Overall 9/10

content:
Posted: March 16, 2015
												So, The Crew:Basically they took the idea of NFS Rivals and improved it, added a storyline, and optimized it better. The idea is that the game is always online. Any time you play it you will be able to see other people and even CO-OP with them. So is it better than NFS Rivals? Two words: Hell yes! It is better optimized for the PC, more customzation, and it has an actual story line. Some people are complaining that the map is not big enough. Well think about it - Fitting thousnds of miles/kilometers of roads and hundreds of cities into a game is pretty damn hard. Not to mention that if they did so, you'll probably get a game that will weigh over 100 GB's, and probably won't run on most PC's. So they took the best of what there is, and put it in the game. My only complain is that the game lacks some cars, for exmaple: Subaru Impreza WRX STI, or Toyota Supra. I expected to have those cars in a street racing game. I truely hope they add these cars sometime.And another thing, and this is aimed towards people, not the game itself: You complain about unrealistic physics in an ARCADE RACING game?! Are you serious?! An Arcade Racing game is supposed to have unrealstic physics. If you're looking for sims: Go for something like Assetto Corsa. Because this is not a Sim. This is an ARCADE RACING game.

number of helpful: 79 of 134 people (59%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Positives and negatives listed below for your convinence.   The crew is a racing game that is fun to play with or against random players or friends of up to 8 players. The game offers the map of the united states in a miniscale version with open world driving of races from street cars, performance, circuits, or dirt. This isn't Test drive unlimited 3 so I will not compare it to 2 and there are certain strengths this game has and certain things it needs to work on so don't pass up on it since it is fun to play. (working on review video) and the list is a work in progress as I play the game since I am not done with this list. By the way if you're one of the♥♥♥♥♥that is messaging your friend to downvote the review for your own obnoxious trolling and agenda, I will let you know now that since this is a work in progress you're wasting your time with the thumbs down and I know who you are  since you've made it blatantly obvious and  I delete and reput up every update I make as I play the game and I am sick of steam not taking action against thisAlso my reviews are final form done in video format from now on, thanks. My reviews are done about the game, not to tell you to buy it, or even that its the best game in the world nor am I payed to do this or to forcing you to buy it. I gave it a thumbs up because I had fun playing it for over 50 hours with friends and players online alike. Its to give you an insight to see if you want to buy it and play it or not.This review system needs a better moderation seriously. Pros+ Better off racing with a pad or a wheel(needs adjustment)and not keyboard, it is possible but best on either these 2 though the wheel will require a bit of adjusting in the options.+ This game is far more optimized than Assassin's creed unity and Farcry 4 + Decently good  graphics with Msaa settings cranked up if you can handle it, not the best but good.+ The story was decent, about 10+ hours, Revenge story what else can they do.+ 60 FPS gameplay is fast and furious+ Certain cars can be customized with kits. Street, Dirt, Performance, raid, and circuit spec for racing which is the type of spec you race at for specific regions of the united states, they seperated it into 5 different sections.+ The world map environment is  detailed there is so many things happening if you park your car and look around, Animals running by, Airplanes soaring past, and people walking along the streets. The immersive environment is fantastic.+ The skybox looks great as night and day cycle and depending on where you are located you'll see stars, the moon etc that looks aesthetically pleasing.+ Every car has its own interior and looks very nice and authentic though some parts aren't too great such as the dash widgets itself.+ Miniscale version of the u.s to drive and explore Many landmarks, events trials throughout the united states to compete in and rank the leaderboards and statistics.+ Handling choices such as sport, all assist, and hardcore, choose your own handling style and level.+ Cars upgrades as you do the trials and story mode to get the parts.+ You can buy the cars with CC if you don't feel like earning game cash to unlock it or you can earn game cash to unlock it,  You still have to earn the parts for the car via skills Trials etc. So your car is worthless without these trials done to earn the gear for it for it to drive faster and handle better etc.+ Drive all over the place using fast travel or just drive for your own entertainment, Day and night cycle occurs.+ Most importantly, with friends or even a crew of people to race around with this game is FUN+ MASSIVE CROSS COUNTRY RACE,JUST RACED FOR 2 hours in ONE race WOW!+ PVP and Coop Mode.+ Very competitive leaderboard system and trials. cons- The racing rules in this game is basically, if you lead first for a few hundred yds and do really well, noone can really beat you. The only way to win is to make a mistake at traffic or a collision turn, No matter how clean and how well you drive you'll just get outranked. There should be a system in place for those that drive clean instead of being the overpowered cars.- Not really a social mmo- Factions war online is pointless noone plays it- Car balance needs work- Online only game, Meaning your saves are online and everything else, when servers are down so is your game which sucks no offline mode at ALL!- The coop is lonely and not everyone accepts to help out the storyline, you can only invite friends but when it comes to randoms invite noone wants to really accept it and the chatbox feels lonely. Restricted to 8 players.- Engines in this game sounds bad.- Its a miniscale u.s many towns and city missing still as they add in more, so can be inaccurate and some people might not see things they want.- Limited Cars- No rear view mirror and side mirrors working. They really need to implement this- Need a better system in knowing who is racing in certain pvp lobbies across the u.s cities since its pretty massive and queing is all over the place, also finding the right quest for the pieces you need could be quite a mess- Lack of dynamic weather effects, Only snow in mountain.- Nice damage on car physics but it heals itself up like magic, ruins immersion- Hitting animals or people and they'll instantly dodge you like magic, some people may see this as very immersion breaking.- The game is about cars + parts, the better the car + parts the better you are at pvping other people basically racing against them. If you don't have a top gear car in races with level, then you will most likely get beaten. Topping out car specs and level is important to winning this makes the balance in pvp a bit unfair especially when a 500 level car will vs a 1200 rank car etc.- The radio music is very limited and just isn't great, I shut off the radio and play my own track the s, The soundtrack for the story though is great- Microtransactions to unlock cars defeats the purpose of challenge.- Cross country Ai are horrible. Others and or changes via patch+-- Constantly repeating the same trial just to get the best + parts can get really daunting. The good news is you can BUY THEM once you unlock them at the garage+- Server situations is more stable now+- If you are impatient you can pay for in game cars and aesthetics but rest assured, THIS IS NOT A PAY TO WIN GAME AND EVERYTHING CAN BE EARNED EASILY just pvping and doing trials etc for cash.+- Once again this game is created by IVORY TOWER and PUBLISHED by UBISOFT. Get the facts straight please and stop hating.+- Your money your cash, buy the game now or wait for price drop.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2014
												My experience so far is that while still a fun game it seems that everything done with the cars is done wrong. When I played the beta I just kept telling myself "it's just a beta." Boy was I wrong. Let tell you of my frustrations as well as what needs to be updated. -The car selection seems like someone obsessed with American muscle as well as DuPont catalogs. I don't want to street race in Ferrari and koinsegg (spelling). While I understand a few of these cars in the game it seems stupid for half the roster of a street racing game to be these kinds of cars. And there are 2-3 versions of old and new muscle. We have about 3-4 actual tuners to play with. Who made this car selection?-Pre-order bonus. Well I pre ordered the game for the Mini Cooper personally. Because I own one in real life. Was horrified to see that the pre order cars can only be used in street spec. Making them utterly useless. -The specs oh oh the specs. Advertised your game to be able to switch out specs on our cars on the fly for different race types. Reality sets in when you realize only a handful of starter cars can do every spec as well as only 1 truck having dirt spec. I'll say that last part again, only ONE truck in the game has dirt spec. Even the Hummer doesn't have a dirt spec. Once again WHAT WERE YOU THINKING. Is this a bug?!!!!! -Customization. If you thought the crew was gonna have the best customization since need for speed underground, then you better go back to your ps2. Customization is nonexistant. Besides a decent variety of paint and rims that's about it. Roughly 4 bumpers which are really just variations of the first 2, no trim paint options, no sticker color options, no painting of rims, no underglow, no ride height, no anything really. Watching your car be pulled apart while you customize it is merely a visual to make you think you have options. When in reality it needs some major work. Once again I will say this isn't a terrible game as the map was done really well and the game play is fun. But this is a story line based on street racing games and there isn't much street racing in the vehicles. Failed to capture that culture making it sub par in the end. So many details missed and little to no focus on the cars. Already the season pass promising more half million dollar cars instead of cars we asked for that are commonly found in street racing. I would rather see generic copy cats like the rx7, honda civic, Subaru sti and so on then have named car brands of crap nobody wants to use. You only need 1 mustang in a game not 15 versions of it.

content:
Posted: January 16
												First thing I have to say before I write this review is : NO, it's not that annoying as everybody says about DLC's. It's not true, it never bothered me while playing the game. This game, is one of the best racing experiencies I've ever had. It's very, but very realistic when talking about driving behaviour, drifting, skidding on snow, driving on dirt and so on. I have to say, crashing into something isn't that realistic, but still gives you a pretty nice looking damage to car (but won't influence the behaviour of a car).Pros: This is the biggest open map game I have ever played. I mean, I spent around 17 hours driving and racing, and yet, not even 40% of map is discovered. Driving is just a pleasure, it's a lovely thing to do. What I enjoyed the most was driving on snow with a performance car. I mean, seriously, there isn't a better thing to do. This game gives you driving experience on dirt, snow, roads, off-roads, mountains and I mean everywhere where you possibly can be driving. Cons: Like I said, it doesn't really support any crash-hitboxes or anything like that. It's not a race simulator like Asetto Corsa or Project Cars. I don't put here as a con thing about DLC's, it's not that annoying at all, didn't bother me for a second.To sum it up:If you're looking for a car game with huge open-world map, possibility to tune and customize your cars and having fun just by driving from point A to point B, get this game! You won't regret a single dollar you spent on this game. 9,5/10

content:
Posted: December 29, 2014
												Keep in mind: I rarely, very rarely, ever dislike a game. I don't even think bad rats is that bad, even with all of it's weird 2d-but-with-z-axis-inconsistent-physics. All I wanted was an open world racing game, much like Burnout Paradise. I can't even fathom why they published this. • The ground is made of ice• The cars are made of styrofoam• Every little bit of audio is muffled• Hitting anything or even trying to turn the car slightly turns you into a ♥♥♥♥ing tornado• Cars going in a straight line is physically impossible• You'll spend half of your play time fiddling with the handling options• Cars act as though they just have one, gyroscopical wheel in the center, instead of one regular wheel on all four corners• The pedestrians, which serve no purpose to begin with, are made out of wax, and teleport out of the way• Instead of crashes tearing your car apart, particles that could make up an entire other car are emited out of thin air• The people online are either five-year-old-glue-sniffers, or they see no reason to play this game other than to ram into the front of my car while I'm in the options menu. If it's the latter, I don't blame themIt's like this is a college student's game design thesis made in unity. I paid $50 for this ON SALE from giftcards, selling trading cards, and going through the headache that is Paypal to Steam. I could have spent that money on getting 10 really good games that I would have never played. Most of Ubisoft's games get flack for being unoptimised, yet I still enjoy it. This is the complete opposite: It's fairly optimised, but my god do I cringe when trying to even remotely enjoy it.I'll probably still play through this just because of how much I spent on it. Even Supra Mayro Kratt controls better http://www.kongregate.com/games/ericthecooldude/supra-mayro-kratt

Posted: March 28
												As a causal driver not a big racing game fan, the Crew suits me well.The game engine seems not advanced, even a little bit outdated at your first look, but I'm just in love with this good old classic atmosphere, because the view, the building, the land describing are actually realistic. Beside, the CREW dev TEAM have made a big improvement on this game after the wild run and the call all units pack, the game's view is really getting better and better like the lighting, now there are huge differences compares to the original release version, which really seems dark and dull, but now I feel like it could catch up with the Horizon 3, which I don't feel like to play anymore, because the CREW has better atmosphere for casual drive.I really recommend you guys try to run it in 1440P,32 inch screen, you will feel much MUCH immersed and much detailed than in 1080P. For 1440P you just need a RX480 4G and a desktop i5 CPU, you will get 60fps at high settings most of the time. If have connecting issue, a VPN is recommended.This game is quite unique, you cant find any other game that cover the whole america. I could drive or wonder as far as I like, just to see the view, feeling relaxed. Once I all most cry in the the snow-covered mountain land cause the view is so breath-taking. At last I really hope Ubisoft can make a Chinese Version like those newly released Ubisoft games, excellent game like this should be known and enjoyed by more people.

number of helpful: 20 of 28 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 6
												Как всегда – будем честными. И скажу сразу… для меня «The Crew» один из наиболее спорных проектов UbiSoft. Я не помню, чтобы мне хотелось одновременно крыть игру всеми тяжкими, борясь с желанием из неё выйти и вернуть обратно деньги, потраченные на покупку, и одновременно хвалить игру, восхищаясь тем, чего в других играх ещё нет. Здесь на любой плюс гарантировано есть минус, если не три. Так что же заставляет меня рекомендовать эту игру? И кому её рекомендовать? Давайте разбираться. Во-первых, я рекомендую игру только таким же психам как я. То есть тем людям, которые готовы ехать вперёд. Долго и беспощадно. Не размениваясь на гонки, на лиги и дивизионы, на сотни безликих улучшений характерных для рогалика, но не для симулятора. Не застревая в дебрях худших интерфейсов игровой индустрии, но наслаждаясь спидометром, часами асфальта и порой удивительно красивыми видами. Не прося у игры быть игрой с большой буквой «И». Последнее умение большая редкость.Во-вторых. Я не рекомендую эту игру тем, кто ожидает от неё детализации GTAV, детализированных машин, корректного поведения их на дороге, хорошей физики, в том числе и физики разрушения последних упомянутых. В этой игре нереально многое. Гладкое полотно мира, где редко срабатывает подвеска, потому что колдобин, ухабов и других особенностей рельефа просто нет. Это мир призраков, где вы никогда не задавите перебегающее дорогу животное, потому что оно неосязаемо.  Это мир кирпичей, где вы никогда не разобьете машину, потому что это невозможно и где разбитая машина никогда не будет влиять на манеру езды. Это мир клонированных построек, где одну и туже закусочную вы увидите не один десяток раз. Это мир клонов, ибо машины трафика вокруг - копии друг друга. Они не имеют разных цветов, половых отличий и признаков. Это мир где ударившись о другую машину вы как ни в чём не бывало продолжаете ехать дальше. И это мир где будучи в одной сессии с другом вы можете его и не увидеть. Просто потому, что это игра про гонки с друзьями. Смекаете? Так какого же черта обзор «пальцем вверх деланный»?Эта история началась в Нью-Йорке, когда два раздолбая достигли 10 уровня. Это было уже после двух часов игры и продирания через дебри интерфейса, слёз и непонимания. На наших внутри игровых счетах образовалась круглая сумма в размере 100К. В отдельной спец-валюте. И вот здесь и началось что-то непонятное. Здесь игра вдруг стала другой. У дилеров оказались разные ассортименты. Я смог купить Dodge 1969 года, а он… и я тогда ещё не знал об этом (а ассортимент для каждого игрока в один момент времени - разный) Chevy Impala. Два масл-кара, которые встретившись вместе собрались пересечь Америку от восточного побережья до западного. Чтобы это случилось так, как случилось - мы послали к дьяволу игру отключив все возможные интерфейсы и клятвенно пообещали не открывать карту, руководствуясь лишь собственными географическими познаниями. Четыре часа мы не могли достичь желанной точки. Останавливаясь в отелях и заправляясь на бензоколонках (понарошку конечно). Приключение заняло три дня и две ночи по местному времени. Мы выехали из Нью-Йорка и описав петлю попали в него же. Проскочив Сент-Луис чуть не задели Канзас и «рухнули» в Большой Каньон. Его я вспоминаю с ужасом. Ещё ни в одной игре, кроме я не ехал столь долго. Он действительно велик. Не заезжая в Лас-Вегас (а зря!) мы забурились в Скалистые Горы и они полностью сломали нам ощущение ориентации в пространстве. Дорожный серпантин, определенно, меняет восприятие реальности. В совокупности с ночью это помогло нам проскочить Лос-Анджелес и потом полчаса гнать рядом со стеной… и, слава богу, что мозг таки сработал (что характерно не мой) и мы наконец осознали, что это великая мексиканская стена. Порой картинка была уныла, но чаще она подкидывала весьма красивые пейзажи, поражая размером. Его хотелось бы заполнить многим. Необходимостью заправляться есть и выполнять курьерские миссии, разумеется выходить из машины и бить живых мертвецов по башке разными подручными средствами. Спасать прекрасных дам и пить за здоровье спасенных за игрой в покер или кости, прожигая кровно заработанные в клубах сигаретного дыма и запахе старого дерева. Всё это было бы очень здорово… и очень хочется... но не в нашей жизни ребят. Вероятно детки наши такое увидят. Чтобы и размер был ого-го, и качество сервиса. Будь это GTAV, да с таким, мать его, причиндалом... но нет. Увы. Проработать "по рокстаровски" мир такого масштаба на данный момент невозможно. Если ничего из перечисленного нет, то почему рекомендация к покупке?Аркадная игра от подарила нам удивительный рпг опыт. Такой мне не давала ещё ни одна игра на этой планете. И должен сказать вам – иногда размер имеет значение. Вряд ли подобное повторится. Но я благодарен уже за то, что это было. И я очень люблю игры, которые позволяют мне там играть так как я хочу. По-своему. Я с трудом могу рекомендовать эту игру нормальными игрокам, но психам… ребятки – добро пожаловать. Всем остальным – в сад. Не потому что тут царство эстетов. Нет. Игра действительно спорная. И я никому её не хочу рекомендовать. Просто делюсь впечатлениями. И рассказываю, как всё происходило. Выбор всегда за вами за вами. Но… если вдруг сделаете это, не приходите и не кройте меня на чём свет стоит. Вас за выхлопную никто не тянул.P.S.Карта которая покажет наш путь куда лучше чем слова.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												In General The Crew is a baby of Test Drive and Driver : San Francisco with a little touch of NFS seriesThe game have all the Digital Petrol Head wants fast cars stunning views and twisty mountain roads and ofc. Bonneville flats, the game world feels crowded and alive from bison packs running across the roads wolfs and bears lurking in the woods. One of the strong points of the game is the freedom and open world saw something interesting at the horizon you actually can go there. you can drive there on the road in you Street spec car or switch to something off rowdy and go in straight line trough woods and over the mountains. Every car got its own feel to it they all handle differently, from straight line muscles to agile japan tuner cars, and the crew brigs it back you love a car A here take it drive it, your car A is short on power and cant outrun a faster cars here put some power in it, oh you don't like the stock looks no problem in that compartment either.Not like allot of other driving series oh you Hate car X! Here drive it!!!! , Oh you love your car A sure drive it but only until you progress and then you will have to drive car X!game puts decision back in gamer hands i love car A i drive it, not like the other games you have to drive cars XYZthe Handling model cant say is brilliant but its fun, its somewhere in between arcade and simulator.From me Game gets solid 8,4/10 but its score for the beta. But definitely see you on the road.

content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												I bought this game on release (no pre-order) and played it for a week and had to stop because my laptop couldn't handle the detail in the game. It let me play it but fps would drop frequently. Fast foward to 2016 and a used gaming pc running GTX 550I and i got NO ISSUES with the game.Ever since I began playing it on a desktop computer with a real graphics card i haven't had time to play anything else let alone watch some anime. Ended up completing the campeign within 2 weeks durring my free time and i must say i love it! I even bought a xbox one controller with usb cord to play the game--and it plays superb with the controller. The wheel has mixed reviews but its not for everyone, i know that sometime this year i will for sure buy a wheel/peddle combo for this game.The custimization of the cars is handled well withe the fact that when you make it to level 50, you gain the opportunity to earn more custimzation such as more front bumpers or more rims.PVP is fun as well however if one player has bad internet connection it will interupt the game for a few seconds only as the match reconnects everyone.I do not ( i have googlefiber) so I always hope that whenever i enter pvp lobby that everyone has decent internet.Now that my storyline is done i had a day where i wasn't sure what to do but then i remembered the wild run expansion and the endless possiblities (until this time i had focused on campeign) and now im pumped again!The updated graphics were a must for the game and now that they have done that  i do say all the landscape looks amazing! I'm getting the Wild run expansion and i can't wait to drive a monster trick up the side of a mountain or thru las vegas :PEver since i finished the campeign i have been planning on what story to write as i continue to play 'The Crew'. Whatever story i choose to write and drive thru i will sure as hell have hours upon hours of fun!Who knows maybe if i end up driving and writing the story i might publish it as a fanfic :P but thats months away i bet!Conclusion:The crew was good at release but since the Wild Run Expansion and upgradted graphics mainly, it has gotten far better than I could have imagined. Granted there are still some hiccups such as the pvp lobby intrupting gameplay (pausing it for 5 seconds) if a player has pretty bad internet connection. Otherwise they have worked hard on improving the game since release. An Xbox One Controller works great with the game and i can't imagine myself playing it on a keybored ever again! (unless i didn't have access to a controller!)Even though on steam this game has alot of mixed reviews i hope we as a gaming community can give this game the support it could use to really inspire the developers to greater hights with this game. The potential of it is without limits. Let's hope they never stop adding to this wonderful game.oh yeah, and its fun!

number of helpful: 30 of 48 people (63%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 16, 2016
												Can not recommend this game to any new players at all. There are so many issues, bugs and crash problems with this game that Ubisoft has acknowledged and refuses to fix. For more than a year these issues have persisted, you can even youtube these problems with keywords as " The Crew terrain bug ".Ubisoft has not shown any support in fixing these problems for the duration of the year despite the community having upwards of 40+ pages on both the Steam forum and the Ubisoft The Crew forum. There support consists of " Please give us more information about the crash so we can help fix it " while doing nothing.The Crew has some of the worst finicky hardware related issues I have seen in a game in my time, you can deck yourself out with the greatest hardware and still have problems, or you can have average to low and have little problems and then vice versa again.The Crew is a beautiful looking game for it's release date, platforms and multiplayer capacity, I have enjoyed many hours driving around the " virtual usa " map which is not 100% accurate, probably not even 60%, but it has it's moments driving passed landmarks, or through new york city for example. On ultra settings the game will definitely impress for visuals and excitement. Plently of entertainment driving around completing missions or cruising with friends, performing co-op missions, on that note though, you must be aware that anyone in the world can and will affect your gameplay experience. You are not really 'locked' behind a security blanket in The Crew, your missions can be interupted by other players which will effect your personal experience, due to a lack of any form of moderation or adminship in the game, trolling others is not at all against the rules. Blocking entrances, ends of races, race markers, anything goes.The Crew's over all performance for game play is a fun and enjoyable experience, if you can enjoy it that is. With constant crashes and terrain issues, or game freezes it becomes a frustrating mess at times. If you're willing to give the game patience and grit your teeth through all it's cancer, you might be able to sit down and have a pretty good time, and godspeed to you.However, I must conclude with, the price of the game vs it's overall problems, is not worth the buy. Ubisoft shows no support or help / compensation for players so the price will never cover the frustration of it's downfalls. With a 2nd expansion in the works and issues still unresolved and full pricing for the expansion with no compensation for the previous owners who are not able to even load the game due to " The Crew has stopped responding " at startup, I can not give this game a passing score. It is a flop, a fail, a miserable purchase and a game that gets shelfed quickly soon after your bad experiences become more infuriating then attempting to load the game time and time again.TLDR:  Ubisoft doesn't support it, it's priced heavily for a broken game.2/10, do not recommend. Find another game.

number of helpful: 10 of 11 people (91%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 8, 2015
												The game really isnt worth buying. At first the game was really fun and seem to have a lot of potential. once you hit the max level you can  pvp, do 1hour+ long faction missions and free roam. The faction missions aren't that fun to do and are basicly made pointless when you can easily send friends out to (not actual friends they send and ai) to do the faction mission for you. Pvp is ok but needs to have a lot more game modes. The free roam is fun but I end up driving in the same areas seeing as how most of the map is either highways or ai filled citys. The offroading is a lot more fun than the on road seeing as how you can either go onto the dirt roads or make your own "roads" with the raids spec. One issue with the game is that getting any car in the game is as easy as just farming a few pvp missions or sending friends on faction missions, even getting the hidden cars isn't satisfying at all.  Another issue is that the so called fixes they have implemented into the game dont seem to fix much, a lot of the performance improvements to some of the rear wheel drive cars dont actually improve anything. Car customization is great and all but what I would rather have is a system more like forza horizon 2 where I can swap engines, buy diffrent parts for the car, body parts that actually affect the performance instead of just looking cool. The games car progression system compared to horizons is very dull, all you do is find a few jump challenges that are easy to do with the car you are using and just sit there farming for a few hours till you have a max level car. I am going to end here, there is a lot more I could talk about but this review is already long.tl;dr: The game is fun but lacks in certain game mechanics. Its also very boring once you realise how easy it is to get the most expensive car. patchs dont fix much.If you want something better save your money and buy something more along the lines of project cars or if you own an xbox buy horizon 2 there is a larger car selection and you can properly tune cars. Although I did have fun with the game I would much rather have horizon 2 where I can basicly tune the tyres, gearing, springs, damping and all that good stuff. Again there are more things I could talk about but I dont want to make this any longer than it is.Edit: Another issue that I really wanted to mention is the car variety is very little and the dlcs only add 3 cars each.

												If you enjoy racing games and not just racing Sims and you ever played MCO from EA and have always been looking for a replacement this is as close as there has been.The driving still needs some work cars float too much but overall the game will be a nice change from every other online game currently available.1/1/15 UpdateAfter spending quite a few hours learning and fine tuning a number of cars I've dicovered that the handling isn't as bad as I had previously assumed. number of helpful: 15 of 21 people (71%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: May 7, 2016
												Hmm, The Crew.This game received a lot of criticism at launch, and its not like it didn't deserve it; the game was lacking in a lot of aspects and had so much potential to be more than what it was.Fast forward to now when the Wild Run expansion has released and brought a slew of changes to the game visually and gameplay wise. I would actually recommend this game to anyone who enjoyed the Test Drive Unlimited series which were also made by some of the developers of this game! If a huge map, exotic vehicles + customisation, and the freedom to drive around is what you want then this game has it all and plenty.I mostly played The Crew prior to the Wild Run update. It was actually a lot of fun going through the to be honest meh storyline, but that isn't what anyone bought this game for. The selling point was obviously the fact that the map is a scaled version of the United States, and good grief is it amazing.For what it is, it has plenty of detail (and now looks stunning as well thanks to the update) and nothing will beat the road trips you take solo or with friends, perhaps strangers on the road also playing their own game (so to speak because its a quick drop in/out lobby system for lack of a better phrase) between the various states. Putting my phone on a speaker dock next to me, setting up my Logitech DFGT, turning off the HUD, going to cockpit view and cruising along the freeways at night is just so wonderful I can't even describe it. And it's not short road trips either, getting across the states will take an actual hour or 2, maybe more, depending on the route. Super easy to lose time in this game like that.Speaking of, car physics. It's pretty arcadey, but everyone expected that (right?). They've definitely improved it since launch and its fine to play now for the most part IMHO.Customization is handled pretty well. The UI could with quality-of-life tweaks but the modding of each vehicle it self is pretty well fleshed out (looking at you, NFS 2015). Should be noted, that all the vehicles do not have all the specs available to them. You can imagine my disappointment to the lack of a raid Murcielago :( still, Fiat 500 Monster Truck.Music selection in this game is nice, didn't agree with a few songs but hey, I just play my own while playing now so. Car selection is also pretty good.I cannot speak much for the events and the Wild Run exclusive "Summit", but I hear good things. PVP races are prone to being glitchy occasionally (maybe they fixed this now, can't tell for sure) but they have definitely balanced the vehicles you can use for the races now as compared to pre-Wild Run (the LaFerrari was the go to car if you wanted any chance at winning for example in the Perf-spec), so thank you devs!So there you go, my thoughts on The Crew. Would 100% recommend if you love cruising around the USA.

												Welp here is my kinda quick who gives a damn about spelling review on the crew, Even though everyone gave this game♥♥♥♥♥♥before it had even come out due to ubisoft and how they are but This is coming from someone who is max level and finished the story,Pros- The game looks really nice,cars are very nice to look at and sound very nice, the map feels very large and has lots of different terrain and weather which does effect the handling which is good. The whole name of the game is the crew, which is funny conisdering me and my friends cant join each others crews, and the fact most of the time you are playing you never see anyone else driving around, and teleporting to friends to see them doesnt help because they never show up on your screen. number of helpful: 10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2015
												The Crew is an okay game, it offers such a wide variety of feats. Skill challenges, Races in PvE and PvP and now including The Summit with stunts and freedrive challenges in it's latest expansion. In return however, the game has so many pet peeves that can bother a player to stop playing forever. Like a finish line delay that could lose you some seconds while playing with people outside your region, the ability to exploit some obstacles to gain seconds and a slightly messed up balance between vehicles. People hope for the best experience in every little aspect of the game, but The Crew is so massive that it can not offer this. As a result, The Crew does just about average in everything. You're not supposed to like The Crew because of sounds, amount of cars, customization, graphics or handling specifically. It expects you to like the wide selection of literally everything it has. Would it do better for players liking specific feats if the game chooses to minimize it's offers? Yes. You'll leave other people disappointed however. It's up to the developers to offer the best experience out of everything it has. You can see they 'slowly' improve on some stuff, but with each pro comes it's cons.I like The Crew because of it's variety and I try to look through the well-known pet peeves to enjoy an actual fun game. So far I think I'm doing a good job at it. I'm coming back to the game from time to time to see if anything new happened.Should you buy The Crew, the Season Pass, the Wild Run expansion or anything named together for the full price? No. Wait for a 50% discount. This will cause you less annoyance, but still have a jolly good time in a fun open-world racing game.

content:
Posted: October 10, 2015
												The Crew features an open and persistent world for racing and free-roaming across a scaled-down recreation of the contiguous United States. The map is split into five regions: The Midwest, East Coast, Mountain States, West Coast, and The South. Each region has its own unique geographical features. Six main cities (one in each region, two in The Midwest) are featured in the game: Detroit and Chicago in the Midwest, New York City on the East Coast, Miami in The South, Las Vegas in the Mountain States, and Los Angeles on the West Coast. Various other cities, such as San Francisco, Seattle, Salt Lake City, Dallas, New Orleans, Washington D.C., and St. Louis, are also featured in the game. Over thirty smaller cities and towns line the countryside like Nashville, Norfolk and others. It takes approximately 45 minutes in real time to drive from coast to coast in-game. The single-player campaign is 20 hours long, and entails infiltrating criminal groups with protagonist Alex Taylor (Troy Baker). Players can also participate in mini-games called skills challenges that are peppered across the world. They are triggered when a player drives through them and it involves completing challenges such as weaving through gates and staying as close to a racing line as possible for a period of time. Players' scores are automatically saved so friends can try and beat their scores, in similar fashion to how Autolog works in games of the Need for Speed franchise. Missions can be played alone, with friends, or with online co-op matchmaking. The multiplayer mode lets a maximum of eight players to compete in races and other gametypes. There are no in-game loading screens or pauses.

content:
Posted: March 5
												One of very few games I've returned/had $ refunded for.  Graphics are pretty good (8/10), from the single player storyline/plot/character interaction I experienced, I enjoyed it (not going to give a numeral rating as I experienced very little of this due to quickly refunding the game).  Unfortunately, the driving physics and controller (wheel) support is garbage.  I have a G27, I'm quite familiar with *it's* issues (such as the ~18-20% hardware deadzone on the wheel), but I've managed to get it working properly in all driving games I've played that can natively support the wheel.  Having said that, I spent ~2 hours tweaking the controls in this game, as well as pouring over forums about the 'best' setups for the G27 in the game, and I could never get these two aspects of the wheel behavior correct; steering 'weight' (any amount of weight on the wheel, just from your hands, is enough to move it around without turning up the force feedback, which then *kind* of gives it a proper feel.  its not just a 'centering' issue, i couldn't find a way to sustain 'weight' to the wheel, i'd constantly and seemingly randomly go 'slack' and not when the front wheels were off the ground or anything like that).  the other aspect is the 'arcadey' feel many other reviews here and posts online have detailed; it is just very hard to 'organically' control cars in this game with a wheel, its more of a 'black or white' 'left or right' 'straight or smashing into a wall' control.On top of the control issues, which definitely ruin what could be a phenomenal game, to me; there is the issue of the amazingly overaggressive and cheating AI - going ~180 in a 'street' upgraded mustang and the *normal* cop cars aren't having trouble catching up at all, in fact, they're so fast they'll actually surround you and start body slamming your vehicle.I should probably just stop buying any ubisoft games, they seem to all have a common theme; pretty good gfx + decent concept + horrifically ruined by not polishing the gameplay properly. = ubisoft games.If they ever fix the controls in the game, I'd *definitely* buy it; however, I doubt this will ever happen, I bought this in 2017, and these same exact complaints have existed in the community since its release at the end of 2014.

content:
Posted: January 21, 2015
												First of all I would like to start off by saying that I have played approximately 20 hours of the game.  This has basically put my most of the way through the campaign.  My background with the game started earlier this summer when I got invited into the closed beta.  (Played about 6-8 hours)  The very first problem with this game is that you can't just use steam, on top of steam you have to use UPlay(Only works about half the time and takes forever to get into the game)  The next problem is that once you get into the game (assuming you have an internet connection) it tends to be rather buggy.  There seems to be an issue with optimization because my computer is rather capable and more than meets the minimum and recommended specs.  As with most AAA titles lately if you have AMD hardware you definitely need to beware  (my laptop with Nvidia hardware runs the game much better)  The main problem seems to be around the cities(Lots of buildings and poor optimization).  All in all this fits together to be a rather poor title but the one thing that keeps nagging me is the physics of the game itself.  I could probably get past the online all the time (Wasn't explicitly stated that you have to be) or even the sometimes poor framerates.  But the poor and might I add inconsistent physics and handling between cars is terrible.  Now I can personally say that I have never driven most of the vehicles in-game, but last time I checked a 600-900 horse Ferrari should be able to drift much better than an off-road Chevy Silverado(Actually have driven this).  However this is not the case all the muscle cars that people have been sliding around for years and years are impossible to drift.  The only game mode that seems remotely realistic is that of circuit racing.  I wasn't expecting this to be Forza Motorsport realistic but I at least expected it to feel something like Dirt 3 or Grid (Something sim-cadeish).  Finnally about the physics we are looking at the terrible bug where sometimes you will be cruising along and hit the same curb or patch of dirt you have hit 100 times with no consequence and now all of a sudden you are tossed into the air and are placed miles behind your competitor.  All in all I am extremely dissapointed with the crew as I have been waiting for a U.S. playground for cars for years.  Guess I am still waiting.

content:
Posted: August 28, 2014
												This is an amazing racing game. Huge open world, tons of races and hidden events to find, and an awesome customization system for your cars. The handling is a little weird and takes some time to get used to, but isn't bad at all. Imagine Burnout Paradise but with customization of cars. The map is so much fun to explore just beacause of the simple fact that you can just drive right off the road at any point and blaze your own path to the next goal/start point/car dealership/whatever you may be wanting to drive to. I feel this game will get a bad rap just because of the use of uPlay, but I will put up with uPlay anyday of the week to play this game, it's that good. I find myself forgetting what I am suppose to be driving to, and just driving around looking at the world change. It is also nice that it runs well (note that at this time I am writing this during the beta and the game is capped at 30fps. But no crashes or game breaking bugs). All in all, this game is really awesome. I have had a ton of fun in my first 10 hours and I can't wait to keep playing.

content:
Posted: January 23, 2015
												After clocking in 36.1 hrs in this game. i have come to the conclusion that this is the first and LAST time i EVER buy a game from Ubisoft. This was a huge let down in many aspects. While i try my best to focus on the good of the game ( will be stated lower down), from time to time i find my self regretting the fact that i went against my instincts to not buy the game ( reason being deep down i felt like this game would be a total let down after ACU: Assasin creed Unity reviews).Pros( may or may not state all)-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------+Huge map+driving never really feels repetitive unless doing specific races+open world+fun skill challenges, races, and faction races+being able to make crews between friends and or people you don't know ( Chance to make friends online).+Earning money is not a struggle therefore buying cars aren't a headache-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Cons ( to many to list)-Crew are limited to only 4 people-very low car selection from since launch-Car modeling is sub par for a next gen game-Street cars and circuit cars have a fetish for driving offroad-when turning corners in any class of car, it feels like you're slamming the vehicle to the left/right-driving dirt cars feel like you're constantly drifiting on ice-not much to do with friends besides races, missions and more races just pvp this time-Story line is a little to predictable ( not a deal breaker)-driving against AI constantly feels like the game is trying to recreate a movie scene where the race ends in NECK&NECK-IF MY CAR HAS A RATING OF 900+ THERE IS NO REASON OR SENSE FOR AI CARS RATED AS 600 AND BELOW TO HAVE THE ABILITY TO KEEP UP WITH ME.-Cop chases feel like you're car weighs 5 lbs and the cop cars have the wieght of an Airbus A380 jumbo Jet. when they hit you, you're car gains the speed of a bullet and goeing into the direction you're hit too, how ever when you hit the cop car that looks like it can be taken down easily, u still gain the speed of a bullet and fly into the opposite direction you hit the car into.-Cop cars that aren't exotic or have have the potential to go past 200MPH should NOT be keeping up with my Lambo. thats is Blazing by on the highway @ 245MPH. I swear, this game makes police chases feel as if some of the cop vehicles have magnetic propulsion systmes in them.-Graphics needs to be boosted up ( a bit apauling for a next gen game)i also felt like more effort were placed into using shaders and other techniques to mask the bad graphics.-For a game that has such a huge scale map, the entire world feels empty to some extent; eg: the only place civilians are prevalant are in medium to large cities in states such as like NY, LA and Illanois. And despite their presence in these locations, their numbers are outstandingly low leaving a feeling of deserted city with just civilian vehicles going in and out of.-THE DRIVING PHYSICS, HANDLING & everything else involved with the movement of cars are ABSOLUTLY APPAULING. ( driving games like NFS underground feels alot more bearable than this in my honest opinion. countless times while driving circuit cars, i begin to get the feeling like im driving my car on ice when moving at high speeds (it feels like im moving a lamborghini at rocket speeds on ice while trying to stare).-Accident situations are just wacky. by that i mean if i get careless while racing and make a mistake, and go offcourse i just have to hold B on the controller and i will respawn OR sometimes when im 150 mph+ & i am about to hit a tree or a car i sometimes just slide to the side like nothing was there. If im not lucky that happnes then i must endure a mandetory cutscene of my crash that sometimes happens in the wierdest ways. (cutscene can be skipped once 1 or 2 seconds have passed its bearable).-The speed of the cars are just all over the place. exotic cars can have the tendancy to bearly feel different ater leveling them up to 1299 ( max level ) in their respective classes ie street, dirt, raid & Circuit. for example. i bought a lamborghini Mercealago after spending some time doing races, the car top speed in full stock was 219MPH , currently i have leveled the car up to 1230, the max speed i have reached with this car is 249 MPH with NOZ blowing out the exhaust pipes like the mouth of a dragon.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------There are much more CONS, however you the reader should get an idea by now. In conclusion i felt completly let down by this game. i haven't bought a racing game since the new NFS most wanted was released in 2012. I Thought Ubisoft was going to really dilever on this game but i was WAY out of the ball park with my expectations. I was fooled by the CG Trailors of the game they were releasing to hype this game up. To me there is limited fun to have in this game so therefore i will not recommend this game to anyone as of this moment unless this game undergoes heavy amounts of fixing.

number of helpful: 16 of 24 people (67%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 4
												Welp, since I have nothing to do today, might as well speak my mind on The Crew, which is something I have been intending to do for a while.This would also be my first serious and semi-long review, so enjoy.Ah, The Crew. I remember how hyped I was for it when I saw the first E3 announcement back in 2013. I thought "Wow, this game looks perfect for me. Nice cars, huge map that is the entire U.S.A, seamless multiplayer, etc." Long story short, by the time the game released in 2014, I had forgotten completely about it due to my addiction at the time called Team Fortress 2.Well, in early 2016, I bought The Crew, since I had nothing else to play and didn't want an Xbox One just to play Forza Horizon. I thought it could be a decent alternative, which, surprisingly, was a pretty okay alternative at the time. I actually had fun in The Crew, doing story missions and meeting new people to do them with was a nice experience. Building cars and leveling them up was also a much better experience than I thought it would be. Then why is it a bad game?The thing with The Crew is that it's not necessarily a bad game with a bad concept. Infact it had a TON of potential. A racing MMO is a cool concept, and The Crew was a good attempt at it (keyword: "was"). I genuinely enjoyed playing through the story. But the thing is, once you beat it you realize there's nothing left, well, except for one thing. PvP. You try PvP races with your, uh... what's the performance measure called again? I don't know. Forgot. Let's just call it "level" for convenience's sake. You try PvP races with your level 900 Perf spec RUF, and realize that you are getting completely crushed by cars that are level 1299 (I think the new cap is 1399 though). You wonder what to do, and decide to look up some guides on the community hub. You find the car levelling guide, which tells you that you must farm late game skills (which are in the western side of the map) and eventually level your car to a competitive 1299 (or 1399). Once you get your car to the max level, you race, you win, and you repeat until you are swimming in cash. Once this happens, you suddenly realize that you are at the absolute end game, with literally nothing else to do, and you quit the game for good. But wait, what's this? An expansion pack? Maybe your journey actually isn't fi... HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥HOW MUCH FOR THAT EXPANSION?The absolute main problem with the game is that it is a HUGE COCKTEASE if you do not buy DLC. The game pushes to buy DLC, namely the expansion pack. Back when I was actively playing this game, the Wild Run expansion was its own thing, which the game advertised me to get nonstop (which I didn't, thankfully). The game constantly teases you with trials with loan cars that you can't own without the proper expansion pack. You will be inclined to get it, but don't, really. This is a Ubisoft game, people. They WANT you to buy as much DLC as you can. The DLCs usually hold very nice content locked behind a paywall, a big paywall that is. A paywall that is never worth it, not even on sale. I mean really? 40 bucks? Really not worth it. Not to mention microtransaction currencies too.By the way Ubi REALLY ♥♥♥♥ed people with the new Calling All Units expansion, but you can read other reviews on why that is, as I do not own the DLC.And to add more salt to the wound, in addition to the horrid DLC pricing, the game is plagued with metric ♥♥♥♥tons of bugs and issues, it's actually insane. For example, The digital displays in cars' interiors don't work, only the gauges do. That might be a small detail, but when you realize even games that aren't racing games, like GTA, have working digital displays, it comes as a real disappointment, and shows how lazy the devs are. They did this on the new cars too. Neither the GT-R nor Huracan have proper working displays. And that's just a basic issue with the game. There are so many game breaking bugs that I can't even start to mention, or else this review would be longer than the entire code of The Crew. Like really, would it have taken that much time to make it so there are more than 10 people at a time in a huge open world and that they don't constantly disconnect and lose each other?And after all that, they still gouge you till your wallet is completely empty?So what are you saying, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ guy who cares too much about car displays?What I'm saying is, is that The Crew, neither the base game or DLC are worth it anymore, not even on sale price. You'll end up disappointed, trust me. And if you don't trust me, trust the 7600 other negative reviews about this abomination of a once decent game.Thanks for reading.

												This game can be very fun, and it definitely has a lot of options, both for single/campaign mode, as well as online mode. I'm definitely not a big fan of online gaming, but I did give it a try on this game and I will admit that I did enjoy it. What PISSES me off about this game is the fact that for certain challenges (in story mode) they computer AI CHEATS LIKE A MOTHER F*@#ER and it drove my blood to boil a lot of times, to the point that I almost threw my controller at the computer monitor. I wish they would 1, allow for different difficulty modes, especially for those people that are more about story line than gameplay, and 2, that they would allow for the use of trainers/cheats for the campaign only part of the game. I thought the visuals were pretty stunning, particularly the settings. I really loved the whole continental US map which you can freely drive to your heart's content. I wish they would have an update that would allow for a road trip to Alaska, that would just be AWESOME! Anyway, I do recommmend the game, however be warned you will lose your cool at some point... If you're that type of gamer that hates it when the computer AI cheats both the physics, and the fact that the other drivers are always faster than you, despite having a higher levle car than the suggested level on screen.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Alright, with quite a bit of beta play and about 20 hours of release version play (despite steam's counter reading 14 at the time of writing), I think I'm able to give some preliminary opinions on this game. First off, this game is not perfect. There are little graphical and gameplay quirks that happen here or there, such as the cockpit view getting a little glitchy past 200mph, and annoying car resets after what should have been seamless, on the fly missions that place you exactly where you were, but stopped. Not to mention, the server system seems a little flaky.  One second, I am online with a dozen players, and after completing a mission, I am completely alone. However, this is a brand new release, and with Ubi marketing this as more of an MMO, I'm holding out hope that those things will be taken care of in the future.Those hangups aside, the game has proven to be quite enjoyable. Physics wise, on road car handling almost reminds me of the good old days of the 1st Need For Speed: Most Wanted. Perhaps, just a little grittier, but fun nonetheless. In my honest opinion, off the road is where this game really shines, though. For anyone who's played the game FUEL, off road vehicle handling should feel awfully familiar to you. I was excited to hear that a few devs from the FUEL team worked on this game, and you can certainly notice the influence they had.As far as gameplay? Missions aren't all that much to talk about, none are particularly outstanding, but they pace them well, and I've yet to get bored. Car customization was not nearly as in-depth as I had hoped, which is dissapointing. Certain cars can't even be modded in ways that would seem to make sense. For example, you cannot take a Ford Raptor truck, and convert it into the rally car / prerunner - esque "Raid" type. Meanwhile, feel free to do that to your Nissan Z! The whole MMO aspect, I'm not so sure of yet... mainly because it doesn't seem to be working correctly yet. In short, the game has a LOT of potential, and I'm enjoying it so far despite it's quirks. However, there are some improvements that are needed to make this game really shine.

content:
Posted: December 11, 2014
												Jacko Rating 7/10The Crew is the first MMO to do something different and use cars and driving instead of the usual aray of fantasy characters.It is an enjoyable mix of arcade/sim style racing with the added online benefits - namely being able to join and crew up with as many as 4 of your mates to race and cruise all over the USA.Strengths are definately the enjoyment you get out of messing about with your friends whilst in your hotted up car, the graphics are good for next gen but for the PC it could be better, 60 FPS on PC runs smooth enough, the sound effects from the cars are nice and beefy and last but not least the size of the map and drivable area is absolutely massive.The weaknesses are - its gets a bit laggy from time to time, there are not nearly enough visable players online making it not really feel like a MMO (at least not yet), not enough races on offer and the button mapping system is frustraiting when trying to really customize it.The final verdict after 42 hours of playing time is despite its flaws it is an addictive driving game especially when cruising around with mates but no substitute for a real racer (wait for Project Cars).  This is well worth your money if you intend to play with friends online and like a massive map of the USA to drive around but if you want a hardcore racer to post times and compete against mates then this will only annoy you.Pretty Good Game but could have been much better.

content:
Posted: December 14, 2014
												So, here we go.I can see alot bad recommendations about it, but in my opinion its a great game. Lets start with a big map, i dont have seen so big map without loading points before, map is minilized version of real life Michigan, New York, Florida and California. There are also alot of cars with awesome classes and tuning, from stock to circuit, 5 classes in total. There are cars, pickup trucks and so on. (Season pass gives even more) Map is quite living, with citizens walking in cities and animals living in wild, trains move, aircraft, alot of traffic vehicles, emergency vehicles on duty and so on. Story is quite interesting, but little, but after finishing it, there are also alot of skills to do... and then awards (Each class of awards done gives you special nr plate). There are also landmarks, what locate an historical building or place with quick review of it from real life, i really liked to do these. (242 on total)  Cars have standalone levels to 1299, you unlock parts doing missions or skills, and then there is player level, up to 50. Snow mountains, where it gives your car more slippery, and fun to drift... also alot of racetracks and interesting places from real life US states, Salt lake drag strip and so on...  Cop chases are quite hard. Also each state has its own 20 car wrecks to collect, to get an hidden car for free.So... bad things about this game, you might meet some players in your session at each state.Crew invitation is still glitching around sometime, wont let somebody join... and PVP takes forever load, so... basically you drive alone... also friends i have in uplay, i never dont have seen them in my session, if only joined my crew.8 / 10.
