The only possible downsides is that upgrading the cars can feeling like endless grinding to get the part you want, BUT it really isn't bad, also that the cop chases are pretty sub-par and lastly you need uplay.Closing note about the negative reviews:Most seem to be about the difficulty of the game and how some missions might need multiple people. Honestly all I have to say about the difficulty is git gud :p I had no problem with the game at all (not to mention a little challenge is always fun!)  and in terms of the missions that may need multiple people, there is an option before the mission inviting all people that you can see to help you, so finding multiple people is easy!Please do not let the negative reviews put you off from this game and remember to read them carefully!

number of helpful: 6 of 8 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												The Crew. A game that I'd followed for a fair few months before its BETA release, and then jumped off the train to "buyingit-ville" very shortly before release. For another 8 months I fondled with the idea of buying it, but never did. I didn't really know why... until now.Now, before I start, I should clarify that no, I didn't "thumbs it up" by mistake. I bought this game on sale for £12 and I feel it's worth that. But a penny more? No.An open world, multi-purpose racing game with vast amounts of custimization that is also an MMO. Sounds great, right? Let me further clarify those for you.Open World...and then some. Oh boy, the map's huge! I always thought GTA V's map was big, but this must be at least 4x the size of Los Santos. Not only is it big, based around the entirety of the USA and time-consuming to travel across, but it's also incredibly detailed. The sale price was worth it for the gametime on that map alone. Even without missions, it would still be enjoyable for me. You might want to get a plane if you're going from NY to LA though.Multi Purpose Racing/CustomizationYou betcha! Dirt, Raid, Perf(ormance), Street and Circuit specs will make sure that you definitely have the right tool for the job (or the race, in this case)! The car detailing with these specs is very nice. Cars look crisp, although some more than others, for some reason, and there's a lot to do in the customization front (bumpers, fenders etc.).The A.I. however is a joke. It would seem that Ubisoft believe that you should have to hard brake around track corners in a specially circuit-tuned race car that should turn on a dime, only to fall off track and lose your first place position to the guy in last 1 mile back. But, the guy behind you in a Chevy V8, with tyres the size of a standard London road-lane and the turning circle of a cruise ship? Oh, no trouble there! In fact, they don't have to even brake! Their car has high-performance, rubberised glue... apparently. Oh, and if you can actually manage to pull off a first place medal against the sling-shotting A.I., don't expect it to be gold. You're going to need a harrier jet for that. Available in the new DLC , which you'll be able to grab in your nearest showroom for the low, low price of £25.M.M.OHa! Yeah right. I haven't played W.O.W in a few years, but unless their servers have changed to allowing a whopping 8 players in one match(!), then it is an insult to even put this into the same category.ConclusionIt's a fun game. Has a lot of bugs but a lot of them are rarely noticable. It's a great time-waster and the cars look good, especially when you put a big ol' body kit on 'em. Buy it, but don't pay full price for it, even if that is only £25. Also, be prepared for a ton of in-game currency being thrown in your face. Seriously, it's like hitting a wasps nest with a baseball bat; overwhelming and really, really stupid.

(it's cool i think) Perks,   Police chases   Many real places, racing tracks, GPS  Drag in the desert  Infinite garage space  Mobile garage/tuner  Leagues/rank/Fractions  Montly big challenges/1 2 hour long missions (without stop)  Manual transmission  If you unlock, or buy the part(Rims etc), you going to have it forever. Bad   Visual tuning, bad rice vinyls, expensive  Graphics (I wouldn't say bad but to compare to other games it's not the best, but I love it, low loading time, smooth play  Few glitches, everybody cries about these, have you tried NFS 15? When u are fallig through the map, in the longest race, sometimes you have to stop not fall through and wait for the map load... Yea these glitches are nothing, stop crying!   Physics are bad, Fast n Furious 4ever!   Not enough cars (  missing JDM  and M3 GTR :D) Few small missions are really hard, I mean just unfair sometimes.  DLC's little bit overpriced, have to wait for sale.   Boring music, you can fix it with old NFS tracks! :D   Silent engine sound (maybe fixed in dlc, i don't know yet)  RUF , what's the matter with Porches? I mean the same just sport ed... Lot of people crying about they are going for money with all the DLC's, you know what, I rather pay extra money for extra stuff than, 3 dlc's and the game is thrown away... Fine they are overpriced a little bit, but they are spending time to make it I don't mind, I don't have the Wild Run dlc yet, waiting for summer sale! :)At the beginning I was negative about the game, not it Turned to love, If you  were an old NFS World player I can offer the game for you, it's pretty good, RIP NFS W! Worth to BUY it ON SALE,Overall score 7.5/10

content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												I really like this game, and i see people comparing The Crew with TDU2 (Test Drive Unlimited 2) and these are not compareble because they are very, very different. The Crew is about your crew, its about exploring the world, its about driving your fully tuned circuit spec through the desert at 400+ km/h. Its about the community, beating records, driving together and completing insane faction races. But it is sertainly not without flaws, the AI is either the best driver ever completely ignoring the laws of physics like not needing to brake and drive 300+km/h through a 90 degree corner, or it will drive into every car and object available.Cons and prosCons:- Bad/unpredictable/unreliable AI- Few cars and brands- Bugs causing the game to crash (example: while browsing your collection theres a high chance of crashing)- Uplay (Let us choose between steam or Uplay)- Can be extremely difficult due to AI- And some minor stuff like: no big rewardsPros:- Great handling cars (trucks vs muscle vs sport cars etc feel very different)- Great graphics (though there's a bit too much lensflare sometimes)- Amazing attention to detail, lots of npc's and wildlife- Massive world to explore- Lots of stuff to do when you're not running through the campain- Different types of vehicle specs- Random moments which make you laugh your♥♥♥♥♥of with your friendsIf i were to rate it i'd give it 8/10.Even though there are bugs and the AI is a bit weird, its a great and fun game to play with your friendsHint: Ubiflop, if you delive anything less than 6+ cars when you release the dlc, i will nuke your♥♥♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												If you liked TDU or TDU2, you'll like this. It's essentially TDU2.5; i.e. flawed, but still the most ambitious open world racing available. It's just plain fun.GOOD. The world alone makes this game easily worth the asking price. The open world is AAA, the best in a racer to date, capturing a lot of diversity and the feeling of cruising in a big open-world. You might expect cities, highways, beaches, snow covered mountains, forrest trails, canyons, and (sadly only a few) in-world racetracks. But you're still likely to be surprised by the diversity here; swamps, dunes, salt flats, etc. The Crew's world is just a fun place to drive.NOTSOMUCH. It's always online, which I might like just to reduce cheating, but requiring always online and not providing dedicated servers seems janky. One poorly connected player can effectively pause a race on and off through the whole race. Running into random players in the world is a core concept that I like, but again, poor implementation means the open world is VERY sparsley populated. I'm hoping they can fix this, but as it is, one of the biggest features in the game feels half-arsed.Handling is on par with the TDU series - a better feel than full on cartoony arcade stuff like Burnout, but still very much (too much) cartoon racing. Also, the story is pretty cliche. But seriously, who cares about that in a racer?Some things fall short of what this team pulled off in the TDU series. The great weather and bouncy baja-esque mountain roads from TDU2 are gone. No motorcycles. The car selection is mediocre at best. And the ability to instantly challenge other players is missing.BOTTOM LINE. I'm still hoping for a talented developer with a serious budget to release a racing world like this with proper handling and a more polished take on seemlessly-integrated multiplayer. Until that happens, I guess this is as good as open world racing gets for now.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												So after reading some of the top reviews for this game I want to throw in my 2 cents.IS DIS A SIM RACUR?No, the driving mechanic is very realistic, but it is very much an arcade racer, don't knock it for not being a sim when it's not trying to be.AMURICAN UGLEH MUSCLE CARZZ!!!!!211211!!!!The game is kinda based in America though.DA MAP IS SO TINEY!!!1!It took me over two hours in real life to drive across it, and that was the fastest route I could take, no detours.DA STORYLINE IZ bAD!!!!It's a racing game, has any racing game ever had a decent story?I KANT KUSTUMIZE ME CHARACTRYeah, because you can customize the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of your carTDU2>CREWLol are you kidding me? And TDU2 had such a GREEEAAAT story. And such a GREEEAT physics engine/handling model. That game was a joke, I'm starting to wonder if people launched that on accident.UBI$OFT MICROTRANSACTIONS HURRRRRREverything you can get from microtransactions is attainable with in game money, obviously DLC cars won't be but almost every game has that even. You can complain about microtransactions all you want, they aren't going away.SURVURS ALWAYZ DOWN!I haven't seen the servers down once and I've been playing since launch day, I also played in the closed beta, never saw it then either.I'm not saying it's a perfect game, I'm saying everyone is expecting a full fledged simulator when The Crew never set out to be that, it's revolutionary in the fact that there are so many different ways to customize your car, street, offroad, etc etc etc. I mean seriously somebody listed no working turn signals as a con, that's so petty. Yeah, the mirrors don't have reflection and some of the shifting animations are fudged, sometimes the character will act like there's a paddle shift and there isn't which leaves him changing gears by swatting the air. As far as I can tell not enough people even use manual transmissions in game to care about shifting animations. Overall this is an incredibly fun game with enough to keep me coming back for a while. I paid full price for it and I don't regret it.EDIT: 12/17I saw the servers go down once a few days ago, they were down for all of 15 minutes. Yeah I was butthurt but it was pretty quick. I'm still enjoying the game but there are a couple more annoyances. PvP is a♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ everybody has full driving assists on and never even has to think, they go careening off walls and guard rails and beat you by 4+ seconds while you're taking care to not hit anything.The factions are odd, there's 5(I think) factions in the game but only 2 or 3 actually have people. I just so happened to put myself on one of the ones with a significant lack of people and it takes me 20+ minutes to find a PvP match for the faction v faction mode. I honestly don't see why they put so many factions in the game.Uplay's "drivehub" is showing me news from 1-15-2015 lolEDIT NUMBER 2 12/17I'm gonna try and stop looking at the other reviews for this game, I just saw somebody complain that it is difficult to get a gold medal on challenges. LOL GIT GUD, THERES ALSO PLATINUM MEDALS IF YOU ACTUALLY WOULD PUT MORE THAN 2 HOURS INTO THE GAME. The challenges are exactly what they should be, CHALLENGING. ♥♥♥♥ing hell, you all want to be spoon fed yet you don't like the idea of microtransactions. Speaking of microtransactions, it's not like I can go buy the best parts right off the bat with real life money, I would first have to earn the part with a car, the spend real life money to put it on a TOTALLY DIFFERENT car. So in essence, I'd be spending my money to make another car just as good as one I actually earned the parts with. Yeah you can buy cars outright with real  money but without parts it doesn't matter. People are just being way too critical of this game because Ubisoft. I bet they turn around and call Far Cry 4 GOTY though...Edit 3 1/9So after getting over 120 hours and not seeing myself stopping I thought I'd throw out another update.I've seen the servers down here and there, they're fixed within 20 minutes though.I have one friend who everytime we try to crew up, it doesn't ♥♥♥♥ing work, so we have his brother get on and crew us up. (Until they patched that a couple days ago)Ubi announced they're going to fix mirror reflections, I hope you're all happy.First DLC coming out in a week, they'll be keeping that pace for about a year, supposedly.They're also fixing the biggest gripe, the AI chase catchup whatever you want to call it, it's getting patched next week, so basically every review for this game becomes null and void. >Everyone's face when Ubi is listening and patching♥♥♥♥♥

content:
Posted: January 4, 2015
 The Crew Review  This review will contain some stuff i love, like, dislike and hate about The CrewPrepare yourself--- Things I LOVE - The MapThe best map I have EVER seen in a racing game, and not the biggest, but the most diverse map I have EVER played on. It's that good. It would take a large amount of hours to completely explore the map. I still haven't completely expored it in my many hour playtime. It takes about an hour (if you are going very fast) tho get from one side of the map to the other. It just such a fun map to drive around, to take a road trip, and to see all kinds of fabulous landmarks throughput your journeys.-Everything about the carsAll the cars have lots of detal, interior and exterior. They are all different to drive, and unique in their own ways. Also, all the sounds for the cars are the legit real life sounds, recorded from the cars in a sound studion. SO nice.--- Things I like -Customization of carThe customization is quite good, especially compared to most of the recent need for speed games. The only problem is the customizations seem too concrete, there is no ability to add your own imagination or personal touch. Some stickers have different colors, but you can't change the color of a specific sticker. Also, each sticker goes on a certain, unchangable place on the car. You can make your car different than others, because there a large number of aesthetic parts and stickers.-Car specsI really like how the car can utilize many different utilities by changing the spec. There are 5 specs: Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, and Circuit. They are all fun to experiment with. Some are great for the racetrack, while others are great for offroad trails. My only gripe about specs is that very few cars have the full 5 specs, most have 1-3 of the the specs. The starter cars all have the full 5 specs, so you will be able to have them all in at least one car.-The storyIt is surprising for a good story to be in a racing game, but in this case that surprise came true. It may seem cheesy and cliche to some people, but I thoroughly enjoyed it. -The graphicsThey aren't amazing by any means, but they are good. They capture american geography well (with a few minor hiccups) but there are many current racing games that have better graphics. They are definitely not bad though, they still make the game nice looking. The best graphics in the game are seen in some of the cutscenes. Legitimate movie quality cutscences.--- Things i dont like -The "mmo" aspect of the gameOnly 8 players in your session, and they players continually switch to different players, so, yeah, no. I still don't really know how to play with my friends, because there is no server choice, just places you in one.-Not that many carsThere really should be more.-Anything that has to do with AIOther racers, cops, even NPC traffic. All equally annoying.-Customization of your characterNonexistent. Hopefully you are okay with the way you look, cuz you can't change that.--- Things I HATE -ubisoft-uplay-ubisoft support-uplay servers-ubisoft bugs-uplay bugs-ubisoft glitches-uplay glitches-ubisoft in general-uplay in generalFortunately, ubisoft only published this game not developed, so it isn't UNPLAYABLE (i.e. ACU) a good company called Ivory Tower made it, which was responsible for some other open world maps (i.e. GTA 4) Some things about the game just seem buggy and unfinished, not because of Ivory Tower, but because of ubisoft. It just seems like with the many delays the game should be PERFECT but it isn't.And now, for the thing I HATE the most about the crew, the following is a reddit rant that i put onto /r/The_Crew/ :Originally posted by author of this review: There is one thing that i just can't get past about this game: THE MIRRORS DON'T WORK! I mean SERIOUSLY!!!!! WHY?!?!??! test drive unlimted from THE 80'S has working mirrors.http:// http://i.ytimg.com/vi/xSvpmi79ZXY/0.jpg  <---FREAKING 8 BIT MIRRORS! and the crew doesn't. GAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHHHHHHHHH3 reasons why the crew doesn't have mirrors1. ...2. ...3. ...Don't get me wrong I love the game but.....I JUST CAN'T GET PAST THATOk thanks for reading all that. I'm done now. The good conclusion:The game's main feature, a big map, is DEFINITELY true. The map, the cars, the graphics, all together make the game an great, interesting, and fun experience.The bad conclusion:The online, which was the other big feature, fails to deliver. There are many online problems and bugs that make some give up on the game. But I am not a quitter. My Rating:  8/10 Final conclusion (tl;dr) :This game offers an amazing experience, one that I have never seen in any other game. Simply being able to take a trip down a desert highway, explore a mountain, race around a city, and explore the entirety of the United states is something that no other game has ever done so beautifully.Overall great game, beautiful map, beautiful cars, just some problems that need addressing. My rating is subject to go up if those improvements are made. The crew is definitely my favorite driving game, and it will never get old or boring. With a map the size of the U.S., how could it? Happy driving!

content:
Posted: April 15, 2015
 Easily the best racing game I've ever played Popular criticisms include; "handling too much for an arcade game" Because it's not an arcade game"wheelspin is too much" because you're using a 250 horsepower shot of nitrous in a car with a 10:3 power-to-weight ratioUnfortunately because Ubisoft has listened to what they're hearing (ie; game hate faries on the forums) the AI has been brought down to a minimum.Game has a huge map, probably the biggest of any open world game so far, the car handling is amazing, physics are pretty much bang-on, the in-game community is great, the car customization could use some work but it's a very small kink in an otherwise well-oiled machine. As a veteran racing-game enthusiast (weird guy that 100%s gran turismo games) it took me almost 20 hours to get through the story mode watching every cutscene, the story is even good although somewhat generic, it's well done. If you're an open-world racing game fan this game will probably give you a weird feeling, traditionally we saw games where you could see it, but not necessarily go to it. With this that simply isn't the case, if you can see it in The Crew, you can almost always go there. 6 levels of customization put the game's huge map to use, they are fullstock, street, dirt, Perf (performance), raid (trophy trucks), and circuit (full-blown race cars) each with it's own merits and downfalls that add an unmatched level of diversity to the game.The options menu is even pretty comprehensive with toggles for anti-aliasing, even types of anti-aliasing. individual performance impactors with their own toggles, and full wheel support with multiple ways of customizing so you can tune it to your driving style. All in all a fantastic game, even after the career mode there's plenty to do and fun to be had. 9/10

												Fantastic game. Each spec you unlock changes how you play, and upgrading your vehicle is rewarding and challenging. Community events, plans for additional vehicles and features, and a strong fanbase/developer relationship means that The Crew has a bright future. The only downside is that a constant internet connection is required to play due to the MMO aspect, but considering no one seems to complain about World of Warcraft needing a constant network connection to play, I find it difficult to justify that complaint. If you're looking for a racing game that goes beyond what any Need for Speed title, especially the soon to be discontinued Need for Speed World, The Crew is just what you're looking for.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												This game is amazing: despite the Ubisoft logo.The map is 3x larger than GTAV, me and a friend measured Seattle to the Miami Keys and it's roughly 98.9 miles.Other than that, flawless launch from Ivory Tower, very good optimization for a game designed for high end pc's.It runs fine on my 750 Ti SC. My favorite parts is Death Valley, the Black Hills, even though I've only discovered only 6% of the map. I can't praise Ubisoft and Ivory Tower enough for The Crew. It is a huge check mark in the positive coloum for PC gaming. It's far from them earning their reputation back, but it's a very good start. Glitches and bugs are expected since this game is brand new.WIth nice little easter eggs and salutes to past racing game legends like Need For Speed World, Hot Pursuit 2010, Burnout Paradise, Shift 2 Unleashed, Test Drive Unlimited 1 & 2 and many more, The Crew is a hotbed of MMO racing that just feels right. How many other games out there can you tune a Ford GT to 700hp, and wreck a Koenigsegg Agera R? I can't think of many.Another huge check mark is the fact that the devs actually watch the forums; someone suggested that a free roam cam be added, like the one in NFS World, and within 12 hours someone from Ubisoft responded saying that something like that is in the works...Now that's rare now a days.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												It's an assertion that doesn't make any sense! Ubisoft has sold The Crew as a racing game, and there are certainly plenty of parts where you drive your car really fast. Hell, there's a race in this game that's four hours long (more on that later).The Crew  isn't a racing game though. Not really. I have no doubt it was pitched as a racing game, and I know why it's being sold as a racing game, and it's because a racing game is something people can understand. It's the same reason Assassin's Creed needs some ridiculous science fiction frame story—because in 2007 the idea of an action game set during the Third Crusade wasn't "viable."

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 18, 2015
												I would like to start off with the biggest reason I even recommend this game is because it is the closest thing we PC gamers have to Midnight Club L.A.I love and hate this game! What is does right, it does right! What is does wrong, it really does it wrong!I will only list the things wrong and missing in the game. It has everything else in my opinion!1. This is possibly the biggest one for me and I don’t really know why! The side and rearview mirrors don’t work! WHAT THE HELL WERE THEY THINKING! Almost every racing game has working mirrors!Racing games on mobile, last gen systems even the PS2 AND PS1 racing games had working mirrors!This seriously needs to be fixed!2. Not enough races or race types! There are plenty of street challenges… -_-There are so few races that I forget I’m playing a RACING GAME sometimes!3. Damage on cars are overdone in some places and underdone in others!If I hit a leaf, my whole front end looks like I hit a tree at 200mph! But glass wont break or even crack even if I roll my car! This just seems lazy!4. Textures look good on your cars and most of the environments. It’s not what you would expect from a next gen graphics game, but they look good. And with the size and scope of the game I would think they look amazing! Where is the bad? EVERY SINGLE PEDESTRIAN CAR AND THE PEDESTRIANS WALKING DOWN THE STREET! I have seen better textures on the PS2! I swear I am not exaggerating! They look horrible!!!I can’t even begin to figure out why they thought this was OK!5. Now on to the little things. No neon lights. Why is this a big deal? It is and isn’t. I like neon’s, what can I say? But in a game that is supposed to be an MMO, you need to have more customization!6. No window tints.7. Very limited on body parts.8. The game has a lot of rims to choose from, but 90% of them all look the same!9. Cant paint parts different colors.10. The performance parts system is kind of wack! Look it up on YouTube.11. Not a lot of cars to choose from. But at least they had my Skyline!12. Its structured as a F2P type game. Now that wouldn’t be such a problem if it weren’t for the fact that they are selling it for $60. Plus I have played some F2P racing games that felt more complete than this game that had WORKING MIRRORS! (Sorry, but I’m not going to ever let that go till they fix it).At any rate, the game is fun, not worth what I paid, but fun.Buy it on a sale, a BIG sale! Anything over $20 is way too much! But if you really want to play a game that kind of reminds you of Midnight Club L.A. then this is the game for you….Kind of.. -_-So yes I recommend it, even though is sucks!

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 17, 2015
												So, I don't get the negative response. Sure, right after the release - when I got it - the game didn't feel finished in any way. I myself was a bit disapointed, but still played on. The reason I got the game was because of the HUGE map, which was in pretty good shape at the time. The cars didn't feel too realistic and I didn't feel the "feeling" I was expecting. But still, I plaed it, because I just bought it and wanted to try it out. I then stopped playing it for a couple of months as I had other things to do. Then a while back I started playing it again. The feeling was completley different. The cars were updated from the last time I played, and countless bugfixes had been fixed. I played it with my brother and had really fun! (Except the graphics I have on it as my computer is pretty bad xD) So would I recomend this game? Well, it depends. If you can relate to all of the following you should pick it up, and you will have a great time. So:-If you have friends that play it-If you like car games, but your not looking for a super realistic simulator-If you want a HUGE open world to explore So the first point is really important. If you have friends to play with. If you don't, it will get boring after a while. You basicly just sit there driving arround. This is after all a game made for multiplayer. Although the "story mode" which is still in the online world was better than I expected.So overall should you buy this? Well if you have friends that play it, yes, of you don't well it's still wuite fun as you can still find people online to talk with, but it is not as fun as cruising arround with your frineds. If your unsure I sugests that you pick it up during a Steam sale of any sort. At the monent while typing this, there is a 50% discount due to the steam summer sale.I hope this helped you, and I would recomend this game. (Maybe due to my 88 hours playtime xD)

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
Finally a good old Need for Speed like game!This game is a really good game. The Crew is a Open World Racing Game with MMO and Coop features.You get into the role of a racer named Alex who gets pretty much trouble with the group 5-10 of his brother. After his death you are on the way to get revenge!Pls dont be too angry to me and my language. I´m not the best in writing english, but i want to tell you my opinion of this game, because it deserves to be telled of :)Short Version- Graphics: 7 / 10- Performance: 10 / 10- Storytelling: 7 / 10- Possibilitys: 10 / 10- Server-Onlinetime: 9 / 10► Total Grade: 9 / 10Long VersionGraphicsThe Graphics of this game are pretty good and well done for a racing game being that big. But compared to other titles released today not the best and detailed one. Not saying that they are almost perfect for a game like this, its still not the best it could be.Shader is well done, also the Antialising. Textures are well but not that detailed and a little bit "spongy" if you are looking close to them. However, its a well done composition of textures and it´s nice for the eye.7 / 10PerformanceDue to the fact, that this game has a dang big world to explore and the graphics are pretty nice the performance is incredible. I was surprised that this game runs on a very low quality computer of a friend very stable and well. You got almost every time the amount of fps you loocked in the options. (30 or 60)Nothing more to add. Perfect performance for a game like this and for a game of this generation.10 / 10StorytellingThe game has a OK story but it is pretty long and has it plots and twists. Short cutscenes, short dialogs.I´d had it rated lower if it does´t have a playtime like this. If you play casual you can come through the story in something like 25 - 30 hours which is very long for singleplayer/or coop story without using the extra things and PvP a long time.7 / 10PossibilitysThe Crew offers a veeery big world to explore. To get from the west to the eastcoast you are driving something like 2-3 hours if you are fast. Also you got additional to the Storyraces and PvPstuff a tons of tests/skill mini missions where you can test your skills in some small disciplins. Escape fast, drive fast on a road, climb a hill and so on. If you want to get through everything you are going to have some 100 hours.In addition The Crew offers a very good Tuning system. Optic tuning is back in business in a little bit smaller version of the "Need for Speed Underground 2" tuning possibilitys. Front, Back, Enginecover, Side, inside the car, outside the car, vinyls and weels. You can change many things in the optic again which is a must have for racing games in my opinion.The powertuning is a little bit different. You get stuff after completing Missions and Skilltests. The bigger the level and the better you are, the better the stuff will be you are adding to your car. Later on you can get "Platinum-Rank" in every mission and skilltest which offers good stuff for your car in every skilltest and mission, the lowlevel ones and the highlevel ones.There is a good variation of cars in this game, however i miss a little bit the cheap streetcars like in the beginning of Underground 2 which you had to tune from zero to hero. You start with a little bit besser "level" of cars. You can find tiles and build secret cars and you can buy cars from the carstores. In the end you will have a variation of something like 40-50 cars i guess.Big world, finally good tuning, many missions and extras. Its a racing game we waited for years to release.10 / 10Server OnlinetimeSadly its an only online racing game which palys on a big Ubisoft server. (Or some servers, i dont know, you cant choose). You will put together with players in one session who are your ubisoft friends and who are on the same story-progression like you are.So you will see allways your friends and possible helpers for your mission.Servers are very stable in my eye. However, some disconnects happened to be true, but these didnt happen very often and i could play most of the time.9 / 10Total GradeIf we put everything together and a little bit of my personal grad we will get this grade which is in my eye a true one. Pls dont forget to Comment if you have another opinion or want to add something :)9 / 10[/b]- Evilemerold

content:
Posted: January 22, 2015
												Great game, storyline is solid. But you can't "customize" your car, you can only add packages, i.e. street package, performance package, with some flexibility otherwise. Graphics aren't the greatest, but gameplay is more important. Well, offline gameplay is, considering the community is full of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s. What people like to do is form little posses of 3 or 4 cars, then find solo players just cruisin' around and run them off the road to the point where online gameplay is literally intolerable, since you can't drive anywhere. On top of that, grandma's Nissan has the same physics as a Dodge Ram 1500, so theres no way to defend yourself. To add insult to injury, I bought the "game of the year" edition, or whatever they're calling it now. So thats just 85 bucks down the drain.If I still haven't turned you off yet, I'd like to mention that you need UPlay to run this game. What's UPlay? It's like Steam, for Ubisoft. UPlay and Steam hate each other. It's nearly impossable to get in a game with people from your friends list because it's so hard to get Steam and UPlay to work together.Still need more? Recently there was an update for The Crew that added a new feature called "Wild Run". Wild Run is 25 dollars, regardless of whether you bought the season pass. What? I just paid 85 dollars for your game and I still don't have everything? Now, Wild Run includes a feature for the player to do races with other players, which was availible as a part of base game. Was. Now, unless you pay Ubisoft even MORE money, you can no longer play with other people, which was the original intent of the game; multiplayer co-op racing. Ubisoft just decided that it was a good idea to completely disable the most vital part of the game in favor of petty amounts of profit.Ubisoft recently released a new DLC for police chases called "Calling all Units" which I was really psyched for. Turns out, just like Wild Run, even though I have a season passI still need to pay EVEN MORE for this content. The Crew, plus the season pass, plus Wild Run, plus Calling all Units equals well over 120 dollars. Honestly Ubisoft, when does the money hoarding end?Screw you, Ubisoft. I'd give anything to get my hands on one of your devs right now.

content:
Posted: July 9, 2016
												Before wild run, it was a really good game. It has a huge map, a very large selection of cars, and multiplayer, the career, and faction missions were fun. Now the game is unplayable due to Ubisoft's negligence to fix the game-breaking map rendering glitch. It's been there for 6 months, and whenever I play the game I encounter it and have to restart. It not only makes freedrive, career, and faction missions unplayable, but causes multiplayer to black screen until the person with the glitch leaves. TLDR: Ubisoft made the game unplayable and hasn't fixed it for 6 months. Don't buy it and think twice before buying any other Ubisoft titles.

												Got it on sale for $40 - Gold Edition. Then it is worth the price. Screw paying $80, no matter how good.And this game is great :) The world across the US is amazing. The different kind of cars drive great (street, dirt, perf, raid) and you get to upgrade the visuals to get amazing cars.I'll keep coming back to get a few 1200 rides and kick some PVP♥♥♥♥♥ Well done guys, great game.

Posted: December 1, 2015
												I can't be more honest than that.The game is cool, Actually, Its pretty amazing.Tho i got some thing to say about it.First, I will start with the PROS i guess.SO THE PROS:-The world is huge. You can drive for hours. (I literaly finished a race with a 104 minute record.)-Theres a weather system, Also day and night. Which really affects the gameplay.-TONS OF CARS.-The game not stands for full singleplayer, You can make a crew (A some sort of group that will join your missions.) -Pvp (NOT ONLY RACING, Theres a lot of multiplayer pvp mods !)-Upgrading and modding your car... Oh man.. This part. You just need to see the customization. (Ps. Made me poop myself when first saw).-You can have a driving test before getting a new car-Theres Voice chat and a regular chat. (Also whisper, crew chat and etc)-Theres a lot more honestly just. idk less important for this review (You should also taste by yourself you know.)So ofcousre after Pros. I should hit with the Cons !-The biggest con by my opinion. Is the crashing system.Crashing into cards happends a lot (Even if you are not bad like me.) Lets say you gotta race inside the city and theres a turn left or right doesnt matter. Sometime, Because its a city after all, Theres cars waiting for that green light. Yea, In that moments youll find cars all over the road except to the right direction.I find it really annoying. Playing Perf spec (I guess the most fast cars in the game) On a road which is not straight inside the city totally can caus your death. (I did played a mission like that, i wanted to punch my screen, AND I CONSIDER MYSELF A CALMED PERSON.)[Woah thats a big con]^-When you buy a car, No refunds. You cant really regret it. Same with specs.-When theres a chat notification you dont really get it, You need to open the chat box, unless you make it visible the whole time, Which kinda disturbs.I must say, By my opinion once again, There is not a lot of cons to the game. Just really basic things. Handling isnt even bad. (Just on peft spec cars. Well thats because its ♥♥♥♥ing hard.) But yet the game extremely fun, and enjoyable.I really hope you enjoyed my review. Make sure to like it if it helped you so other can see it aswell. *SORRY FOR BAD ENGLISHHHHH*Peace and love sugars.

												This is a fun game for what it is. It is by no strecth of the imagination what the developers told us it was going to be and unless you feel ok with mucking around with router settings the "never drive alone" tag-line will be a confident slap in the face. But it is still a fun arcade racer that looks good and offers some really nice open world play with a lot of things to do from jumps and slaoms to classic exploring. Also once you get it to work PvP multi-player is fun and frantic. Same with the co-op part of the game. It is far from perfect but it is still one really good ride.That being said... It has some very shifty multiplayer and use som peer2peer solution limiting how many players you can run at the same time. It also have DLC and pay-only cars out the tailpipe.

content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												I really looked forward to this game because the idea behind this is very appealing. But unfortunately Ubisoft didn't do a great job of implementing.Positive things about this game, the map is huge and there is so much room for playing so that's certainly a good thing. The graphics are ok, but that is not something that bothers me too much. The idea to form a crew is also a good thing, but is poorly implemented and there are so much things to do with it to make it better, but they didn't. Faction races are great, but could be a lot better. For instance, make a race with a destination point and you can choose with route to take. The physics are not great, but not bad either. Only thing the cars should do is drift, instead of constant understeer.So yeah, there are a lot of things that could be done better and it really dissapoints. This game had a massive potential to become something great, but it didn't take that chance. Maybe The Crew 2 will be better, if that game will ever arrive of course. Not something you should buy i say, unless you really really want to.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 12, 2016
												30 hours in and I still have much to do. The world is so damn big and traveling from point A to point B is not boring at all since the world is full of different challenges for fast and agile cars. Upon completing these challenges, you earn parts for your car. If you don't need the parts, you can send it to your garage which will allow you to build up another car in the future.Story missions have you racing against time, destroying crates of supplies, catching up to an NPC and making them crash, and more.This game has car builds for dirt, street, drift, raid, and circuit racing. I probably forgot one, but that list should show you that this game is the whole package.Jumping online with friends is as easy as meeting up at a certain location and grouping up. Most of the campaign can be completed with a friend.Warning about DLC:"Wild Run" is a DLC pack. You do not need it to enjoy this game, but you will occasionally run into cars and missions unavailable, but don't worry about it. I've been doing just fine without it, but I will pick it up on a sale because I definitely want this game to last even longer.

number of helpful: 4 of 5 people (80%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												While the story is somewhat entertaining, the gameplay is really quite boring. There's literally nothing to do but race around, and while it is a racing game, the trailers hinted at other forms of gameplay and much more exciting cinematics. It's not a bad game, but its not a good game either. The story is pretty minimal compared to most games, and trying to tie this story into a continually running server-based platform makes for some really annoying drive times.Also we were promised the whole country, as though that would be to scale. Nope. Everything has been scaled down so that most of the cities are a third of their actual sizes. I threw down a lot of money for this game because I thought I would be getting a lot out of it. Really, because of the setup we actually got, I say this game is worth no more than $30. If the animations and the LOD look right up your alley, you might be inspired to pay $40. But never is it ever worth the full AAA studio pricing.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------So now that we have Wild Run, I guess the only thing I can say is WHY didn't I get it with my season pass? Considering it adds modes like DRAG racing, DRIFTING, etc. that most racing games have from the start, I think it should have been a free update. I won't be wasting my money on Wild Run though. The gameplay as a whole is still really boring.

number of helpful: 5 of 7 people (71%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: April 6, 2015
												I bought this game because it was developed by the same team behind Test Drive Unlimited, TDU and TDU2 weren't top notch games in terms of handling, but they had this "charm", I found TDU2 so relaxing, I played it for hours and it was really fun just driving around the islands, it had its big flaws like the ridiculous handling but somehow it was fun. I expected the same calm and relaxing mood from The Crew, sadly one of its biggest selling point was their worst feature IMO, the change to RPG style ruined the game, the idea was good but the IA of your opponents is completely crap, to the point that the game wasn't fun to me at all but frustrating, I really wanted to continue playing this game but I just couldn't, I don't have the time I had a few years ago and the fun isn't there anymore, that's why I cannot recommend this game to anyone, it's not a simulator and  it's too arcade that it's not fun either, please note that I played this game with a Logitech G27 wheel, that made it worst because the game is intended to be played with gamepad for its ridiculous handling, TDU was playable but The Crew is not, and you can't progress through the missions if you don't level up, so you will find yourself wasting time on repetitive side missions in order to play the story missions.I hope that in the future there will be another Test Drive Unlimited, with the same idea but improved, if I wanted to enjoy 20 minutes driving trhough the beautiful Hawaii and Ibiza, without feeling pressure to level up or completing frustrating missions TDU was the one, maybe I'm wrong because I thought The Crew was going to be that game, and the team had a completely different idea of the game, but this wasn't the game I expected.

												1st let me say I have never written a review for any game before.Now I ama racing game lover but for the last 5 years or so I haven't found a racing game that can hold my interest for more than an hour at a time.  I bought this game with a friend and he and I mostly play together and that is extremely fun.The story is just ok, not great but who cares this is a racing game.  There are not a lot of cars in the game at the moment but that is ok all of the cars in the game a really nice.  I drive from inside the car with the dash board view, unless I am doing the missions where you run through a banner as you go because it takes you off road and you are usually running through brush and you just can't see from inside.I really like this game and came into it with no preconceived notions about what to expect.  My buddy and I just spent 2 1/2 hours just driving and unlocking more of the map occasionally doing fun side races.This brings me back to the old original test drive games way back when.I really really like this game and the only con I have at the moment is I do get discord and it takes 15 to 20 minutes to get back on.This is an Mmo but just like most new mmo's you don't have to play with other people.

content:
Posted: September 2, 2016
												The Crew is a great game. simple as that, but it defineitely has areas that should be improved but first let me start with the positives.It is easy to progress through the game, provides a challenge, has a huge map to travel around, encourages open world driving by including street and dirt vehicles, beautiful landscape and monuments to visit, controller support (including steering wheel) and the endgame makes you feel like a god but, there are some flaws.cons:1. traffic- although this is pretty fun to dodge around in free roam, it can be really frustrating when you're trying to beat a mission where one mistake can ruin everything but it adds a challenge. The worst part is when you crash there is a cutscene that plays and will ruin your time even though you can skip it and also there are road block made by the AI because they crashed into the car themselves.(hopefully that made sense)2. Physics- This games physics are terrible most people can easily look up an example of this but for the sake of this review, i would list some for you. Some are: crashing into a wall and being sent into the air, hitting a little sidewalk will make you do a wheelie or crashing into a vehicle will push it aside instead of a collision.3. Short storyline- TBH this doesnt bother me as much as it does for other people. If youre looking for a racing game then this is a racing game. overall the story is pretty boring and short.4. The DLC- another thing that bothers other people, this game kinda forces you into the DLC but personally i bought the complete edition which saves a lot of money in the long run if you plan on buying this game because it comes with a lot of cars and the season pass (At this the the calling all units is coming out soon)(Side note) progression is too quick?- I dont know about anybody else but i beat the main storyline and hit the level cap pretty quickly within maybe 4 days of playing. This didnt bother me because i wanted the endgame cars that are fast. Also within a week of casually playing, i already maxed out a couple of cars and a motorcycle dont know if its just me or not but if you buy this game you will find out.5. glitches- This one kinda goes along with physics but while playing, there will sometimes be invisible bumbs in the road and when you crash on the wall occasionally you will get stuck in it or you will be on top of it and will probably have to reset to fix it.6. Online- This game requires you to be connected to the internet at all times not much to say here but its extremely easy to play with friends at least.Even with all these things i still would recommend this game especially if its on sale (I got it during the steam summer sale) Not going to lie this game needs some tweaks and shows a lot of potential. Perhaps future DLC will provide an even bigger map (although i doubt as that will take a lot of resources and time) In the end, if you are looking for a fun arcade racing game this is your go to choice, you can race solo or with friends and overall have a great time. although i said the physics need to be updated, it still makes this game enjoyable for messing around. I hope that if you reading this that you buy the game and expand this community.

number of helpful: 6 of 9 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 28, 2016
												The Crew tries to be a driving game with something for everyone. You can team up with a group of friends for an epic road trip filled with fast-paced illegal activities, and seamlessly explore a massive map of the U.S., from the tip of Maine, all the way down to Miami, over to Los Angeles and back again, passing through other iconic cities along the way. Though it's true that all of this is possible, the experience isn't all that it's made out to be. The Crew tries to do a lot, and while it technically delivers the features it promises, it frequently stumbles over itself. There are brief moments of joy within, but just when you start to think the game's turned a corner, a bump in the road sends your joyride careening off course. When the best thing a racing game has going for it is the variety of environments it has to offer, you know something's amiss.You start off in the streets of Detroit, but it's not long before you're rolling through mountains, everglades, and forests. The huge maps and its colossal number of activities is intimidating at first, but that's great: the more places to go and things to do, the merrier. Story missions, which take you through a trope-filled campaign that plays out like a Fast & Furious sequel, send you from one region of the country to the next, and missions emerge out of the blue along the way. You street race, smuggle contraband, take down competing criminals, and tackle bite-sized emergent challenges that test your abilities behind the wheel while you're on the go. There are hundreds of things to do, but only some are truly fun. The problem? With so much ground to cover, The Crew feels and looks like it's stretched too thin, and it's evident from the start. The Crew's world may be massive and varied, but it's not good-looking. It's constantly plagued by texture and geometry pop-in, and looks generally outdated. People, buildings, the environment, and most importantly, the cars, are represented by disappointing models that suffer from an unsightly amount of aliasing.Keep in mind that if UPlay, PSN, or Xbox Live is down, you can't play The Crew, even if you just want to go solo. During my time with the game, I was booted due to server or connection issues on a daily basis, which was very frustrating. The most enjoyment you get out of the game's connected world comes from player-vs-player competitions, but even they have issues.

number of helpful: 27 of 50 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
Are you looking for a Next Gen racing experience? Go look somewhere else.UPDATE: 01/11/15After nearly 3 months after launch there were only 2 patches correcting minor stuff but not a single commitment from Ubisoft on addressing wanted features in the game. The Steam user satisfaction dropped its recommendation from 96% to 77% and it will continue to go down as more people figure out how little this game offers after 20 hours - which is a ridiculous little time for a MMO. --- CONTINUE TO STAY AWAY.I've pre-ordered The Crew Gold +Season Pass expecting that all publishing on hard working to bring a new concept of game would be delivered. After my first 8 hours with the game I'm never ever buying Ubisoft games at launch anymore (As I'm already doing with Assassin's Creed franchise since Brotherhood).The game isn't an evolution from what we've seen on the Beta phase, it is just a "stability" upgrade in all aspects. To be honest, the only thing I've seen implemented from what was asked on forums during closed and open betas was the ability to change the gear faster while on manual shift, almost everything requested by the community was ignored.To review the game I've used a Nvidia GTX-780 + i7-4770K overclocked, my personal impressions below:- Are you ready for Ubisoft concept of MMO? It was confirmed by Ubi Community Manager that the "bug of few people per map" is in fact working as designed since they believe 8 player per map is OK.For a game where the selling point is "Massive open world" this is a flaw. - Don't expect to be able to play multiplayer, cause it isn't working as it should. It took me about 50 tries to be able to do 1 single coop mission since the message "There is no one in your session" was constantly been displayed even while I could see about 10 players on the map screen. - Do you like driving from cockpit and using the rear mirrors? Hopefully not cause they we're NOT implemented at all you will see is a gray piece of junk that since it isn't showing your rear shouldn't even be there. Surprisinly and adding "more fun" to the randomness of this issue, when you put your view in 3rd person mode (behind the car)... TA DA! The mirrors magically start working! W-T-F!!!Lets pause for a little reflection:  Since 1987 we have working rear mirrors thanks to Test Drive 1 but not in this advanced "next gen" title? There is no other racing series considering doing the same crap.- Anti-Alising is so horribly implemented that even downsampling from 4K resolution to 1080p you will notice the jadded edges everywhere. Specially when you're wandering inside cities hopefully you will not bother on blinking edges in general scenario elements like fences and light lamps, buildings and cars as you will be near to have a convulsion. Surprisinly AAs seems to had worked a lot better with "wild nature" elements so trees and vegetation don't suffer in the same heavy way cities do;This is my tweak guide to correct the game Anti Alising to an standard expected by a Next Gen title:http://steamcommunity.com/app/241560/discussions/0/617321352146025421/?tscn=1417713397Still considering the fact that at DAY 2 I'm trying to manually override what was delivered in the "official pack" , Customer Satisfaction is barely achieved on that aspect;- Looking for Dynamic Lighting and Shadows? Bad for you cause your car and whatever is capable of emitting light doesn't create any shadows! Ugly absurd issues from WatchDogs are all back to terrorize people dreams of playing decent games;- Your car is the only thing on the screen that seems to be made with more than 20 poligons. When compared with your own, all other cars and objects are ugly and seems to be toys or re-used models from games launched back from 90's - Specially Mini Vans - Maybe they have used the same from SEGA Crazy Taxi? Seems very similar to me. ** This can be minimized using my Anti Alising guide - check the LOD BIAS section **- Real bad textures. If you stay like 5 meters from any building you will few like playing GTA3. Ambient Occlusion made them feel more alive but they're all ugly and not even close to HD;- Dust and smoke effects from Counter Strike 1.6 are better than what we can see here;- Offline mode isn't working. You need to stay online on UPlay or, once you get in the game, it will ask you to connect to UPlay and restart it;- There is  no dynamic weather at all;- Engine sounds are very generic;TL;DR:As it is right now, there is no reason why you should buy this game for more than 20 dollars. If you want a good looking racing experience, buy Shadow of Mordor and ride a Warg. I ensure you that your experience would be better than any hype you may have here and you will have a really good game.Besides that, give the game some time to have Ubisoft to fix its outstanding issues and the magicians from the internet to discover what Ubisoft have disabled under the hood to make it similar to the console versions.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												So as you can see i have almost 1000 hours of gametime on The Crew.  I have played since the game was officially released and own almost every spec of every car.  When this game was released it got all kinds of terrible reviews but even at that time in it's incomplete state it was a good arcade style racing game compared to any NFS-type game before it.  Since that time they have added cars, stickers, colors, pvp options, graphics, race modes, bikes, monster trucks, 3 new specs (monster, drift, drag) in addition to the 5 already available (street, dirt, perf, raid, circuit), freedrive challenges, and tons of other things!  Some people will sit here and cry and complain about some technical issues with crashing, which is there from time to time, but with the amount of options they're adding to the game it's totally worth it.  Need For Speed is completely inferior to this game.  I have spent 125 dollars on this game including game, expansion pack, and season pass... I don't regret this at all because this game has been worth it!  There is no better open world arcade style racing game on the market right now (may 2016).

content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												The Crew is a game with so much potential that it actually upsets me playing it at points. There are a few main points of contention I have with the game.#1. The car list.Maybe there were licensing issues or something along those lines but the car list in this game is a massive disappointment. If you're making a game set in the entirity of the US give us some good American cars. I'd love to see classics like your C2 or C3 Corvettes, Pontiac Trans Am, Impalas, '60s Mustangs and even weird obscure stuff like a Buick Grand National. Another thing is that for a game released in late 2014 all the 'new' cars seem to be a few years old. For example you have a 2010 Camaro, a 2010 Challenger, a 2010 370Z, a 2010 Continental Supersports, a 2009 Corvette ZR1, a 2010 BMW Z4, A 2011 M5, a 2010 Focus RS, a 2011 Mustang, a 2012 V8 Vantage,a 2010 Viper, a 2011 Grand Cherokee, a 2011 F150 Raptor and a 2011 McLaren 12C. Maybe it was due to a lengthy dev time but it just seems strange to have a new racing game with a car list this slightly dated. Another thing that annoys me about the car list is that there is an R34 GT-R V-Spec that is Left Hand Drive, they only ever made them RHD that's why Americans who are into "JDM" (That's another rant for another time) go crazy for them.#2. The customisation.The vehicle customisation in this game is odd in that it's very in depth but also very limited. An example would be that I can put a stripe on my car but I can't change the colour of that stripe. All I want is a purple Camaro with a green stripe to give other players their daily dose but because of the arbitrary restrictions in the customisation menus I can't. All they had to do was emulate Forza or one of the PS2 era NFS games but Ivory Tower screwed that up.#3. The vehicle classes.When this game was hyped in pre release and during the beta it was shown that every car could be used in every class (Street, Dirt, Perf, Raid and Circuit) but when the game was released there were restrictions and limitations as to what car can be used with what class. For example a Golf GTI can only be used in Street spec which sucks because Street spec is garbage. A Dirt or Perf spec GTI would be fantastic but it can't happen because the game says so.#4. The Physics.Not necessarily the driving physics, they're fine but they do start out pretty terrible (they improve as your car improves) but the crash physics and impact physics are screwed up beyond belief with my cars commonly performing physically impossible maneuvers. Another thing that isn't entirely physics related is that during the start of every race an animation plays where you cars rear wheels spin even if you have a front or all wheel drive car, as someone who likes detail in their driving games this upsets me greatly.#5. Crew Credits.They're a currency you buy with real money. Need I say more?#6. The "MMO" aspect.This game is not an MMO. Ubisoft are lying to you, it might be multiplayer but it is 8 people per server and with a map this large you are spread out most of the time and barely have any interaction. The 'Never Drive Alone' tag was a lie as I spent most of my hours in this game driving alone.What this game needs is a sequel made by more competent devs and with more attention to the little details. It also shouldn't be marketed as an MMO because it isn't.

content:
Posted: April 7
												The Crew is an open world racing game from 2014. It was developed by Ivory Tower and Ubisoft Reflections. Published by Ubisoft, the game recreated a cut down version of North America where the player can partake in many activities including a story and free roaming. The Story centres around the main character Alex. He is being chased by the cops. His brother Dayton is the leader of an organisation called the 5/10 motor club. When they are meeting together a car pulls up and Dayton is shot and later dies. Alex is arrested and and convicted because of a corrupt FBI agent with ties to the 5/10's. Five years later Alex is offered a deal by an agent called Zoe to be released on the condition that he agrees to expose the FBI agent's corruption. Driven by his need to find out the truth behind his brother's murder Alex infiltrates the 5/10 organisation and climbs his way towards the top with help from the FBI. The story takes Alex across all the USA in his quest to find the truth.The Crew: Wild run is an expansion to the original game giving it a complete graphical overhaul and adding weather effects, motor bikes and monster trucks. The story missions of the crew have more than 20 hours of content. The missions mainly include different types of races and time trials not to mention the raid missions where you have to hit all the boxes before time runs out. There are also skill markers all over the map to make your free roaming more interesting. The skills can be: follow the driving line, see how fast you can go, also there is one where you have to hit the markers. Besides the main story there are many races marked on the map and some go for over one hour.I found the game really fun to play, both the story missions and the other challenges scattered about the map. The graphics were pretty good and the difficulty was not too hard. I found the best way to save money was to use one car for all the story missions as every challenge you accomplish gives your car performance upgrades. One annoying thing about the game is that it is always online so if you lose the internet you will get kicked from the game. Annoying if you have bad internet. I played the game with an Xbox controller for Windows and was quite satisfied. There are some bugs in the game like wild life being able to knock cars around by touching them and people just running around in circles. Apart from this the game was quite polished. The game also has the quick travel feature so you don't have to travel where you have already been. Apart from a few bugs and server issues I give this game:7.3/10

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												There are car games out there that look better, sound better and handle better, but none of them can stand up to The Crew's sheer pleasure and romance of the open road.The Crew is the finest driving - not racing - game of 2014 and probably the very best this tiny subgenre has to offer. Outside of the baffling and bafflingly stupid plot, the game serves up an idealized approximation of the life of a car enthusiast who has nothing better to do but buy great cars, drive them to hell and back... and then drive them some more. With literally thousands of miles to wander across on a map reportedly close to five times the size of Just Cause 2's, The Crew is a paradise for free drivers and explorers, a game that makes the hours pass by at alarming speed in all senses of the word.If you've dreamed of cross-country road trips, this is as close (and cheap) as it gets. If you loved Test Drive Unlimited and its oddball, mildly disappointing sequel, you should stop reading this and buy The Crew right now as it is essentially Test Drive Unlimited 3 in all but name.

content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												This is going to be very long, but I am very passionate about this. Long story short, I do not think this game is worth $60+ I would consider it closer to a $30-$40 game. Very stable, especially for Ubisoft, and I enjoyed myself.When this game was first announced at E3, I was so excited. It appeared to be close to the game I'd been hoping for years ago. I have always been a fan of racing games, and over the last few years I've been underwhelmed by the options on PC. I was quick to pre-order The Crew despite my displeasure with Ubisoft and Watch_Dogs especially. When I played the Beta for The Crew, I was met with a stable game which was nice, but there were little things that bothered me. First and foremost was their approach to many of the landmarks of the US. I live in Las Vegas, so once I finally got there, I was underwhelmed. I feel like GTA San Andreas had a better looking Vegas than this game does. I then noticed that Mazda Laguna Seca was on the map also. Laguna Seca is one of my favorite Tracks ever, so I had to see it. After my initial woes with Las Vegas, I was mildly worried. My fears came true, and this point I was legitamately upset.  If you are going to take the time to put a track as Iconic as Laguna Seca in the game, at least do it justice. The Corkscrew, a sweeping S curve, with a 3 story drop, is flat in the game. plus the bump just before the corner turns into a jump at any speed greater than about 50 mph. I understand they can't capture every single part of the US but for tracks, especially those like Laguna Seca, at least make them like the real thing. Car selection is very limited comapred to most other racing titles, but you can go through the entire game with your starter car. there really is no need to spend money at all. I beat the game only spending 2200 on mirrors for my Ferrari, because the Italian flag decal didn't really fit withthe rest of the car. All class upgrades are paid for and individula parts are awarded from skill challenges. unless you want to drive a different car, or make the ones you have prettier, there is absolutely no need to buy anything. I am not very ggod at games in general so I found some missions to be very frustrating. The takedown missions in particular were an annoyance for me. trying to chase someone down and inflict enough damage was very difficult for me. As were the Smash missions, hit a certain number of container within the time limit. it would take me over an hour just for those missions, mostly due to physics (more on that later). The story was pretty much what you would expect from a racing game. Not super indepth, lots of random missions that you have to do with no real explanation of why, but it does have a rather logical progression, and moves at a decent pace. I played through the entire campaign solo, and the only time i interacted with other players was occasionally having a head on collision mid corner. now that I beat the story I might look more into Faction missions, but for now, I found the online function to be more of an annoyance than anything useful.  Overall, I would say that from a game play standpoint, I wasn't really disappointed.  From a technological stand point I was.... I'll say satisfied. In 24.6 hours of play the game only crashed 3 times. As far as servers go, the only time I had trouble connecting was when they were performing server maintanence. Visually, this is actually a very good looking game. If it weren't for the 60 fps lock, and the strange Depth of Field effects I wouldn't have any complaints. Honestly, playing at max settings (motion blur and depth of field off) I was playing at 3140 x 2160 on my  GTX 980 at a stable 60 fps, and gpu usage was only at around 70%. I would have liked to be able to fully utilize 144 Hz that my monitor is capable of, but for whatever reason they locked it to 60. Not a deal breaker for the vast majority of consumers, but it was mildly irksome for me. Normal road driving is quite satisfying, once I turned driving assists to hardcore, I was quite content with the handling. The collision detection baffles me though. there is no consistency as far as what constitutes a full crash and what is just a glancing blow. I had times that I would ram into the back of a pedestrian vehicle by more than half of it, and my car would just "glitch" to one side and I wouldn't lose more than a couple mph. other times there would be a couple of feet between my car and the pedestrian vehicle, and I would crash. I tried to figure out why, but never really could. The most ridiculous aspect of the physics is most apparent once you unlock the raid class. These vehicles are designed to go offroad, over large objects, and jumps. Every time I tried to go off a jump, the physics would react in a way that I can only call alien.  I could get practically no distance, or I would have insane nose up manuvers. worst of all was the tendency for the car to spring up to one side if only one tire went over a large rock or object. If your vehicle goes past a 90 degree angle the game treats it as a crash, even if you end up landing on your wheels again. If you did end up making it off the jump well, the game trys to keep you flat, most of the time, so more times than not I would end up taking an awkward bounce and spin out. This was completely unnatural to me. and it was so random I couldn't compensate for it. If the game was trictly on road, this wouldn't be a problem, but there are so many missions, like the smash missions I mentioned before, where this comes into play, and it is very frustrating. At the end of the day, I was able to work around these issues, and beat the missions, but I could never really achieve the score I wanted because the physics would mess me up. But i do have to give them credit, not once did i experience a glitch, much less a game breaking one. Just 3 freeze and crashes that I can't really explain, but since it is always online, server based, I didn't lose any progress.Overall I would give The Crew a 7 out of 10. It held my attention the whole time, and I found satisfaction in completeing missions. the overall experience was quite good, it had it's faults, but nothing was ever major enough to put me off of the game entirely. I would say wait for it so go on sale for 33% or more, and you'll get your moneys worth. For that reason, I do recommend  this game.

												I would recommend this game for the driving, seamless map integration, various skill objectives and missions, and all around car tuning and handling.I would not recommend this game for its useless PVP system, its repetitive grind, no end-game benefits, its censorship, the absurd story, or its custom car designs and micro-transaction model.Overall, if you enjoy racing games and play them often, this game ranks up there with some of the greats. number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 24, 2015
												People say a lot about the Crew. That is good and fun and others swear that it is next to terrible. For me the Crew has been a lot of fun, but I have no interest in being with a group of people tearing up the country-side. I personally like the idea of the crew and the changing of car styles and it forces you to play with all of the spec's (Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, and Circuit) through the Campaign. Overall if you like driving around a massive open world in any car you like doing random skills, races and occasional pvp it is a lot of fun and worth the cash. ---->The campaign in general is alright, it is enough to keep you interested in how the characters work as a whole, but it nothing compared to Ubisoft's other story lines. It was written by the same writer of Red Dead Redemption, but was given a limited window in which to write it. The story feels rushed and a little bit like the fast and Furious, but it is a racing game and the Fast and Furious franchise really set the cliche and standard for many years to come. It is best to think of the Campaign as an interesting Tutorial rather than any form of story.---->The game play is very fun in my opinion. In the open world you can drive anywhere you want with ease and have a multitude of things to do along the road trip. With five different types of cars you can go anywhere. The races are fairly easy in solo, but can pose a challenge in Co-op. The servers are lacking players though, because of the recent political and social mishaps that Ubisof has had, but I have had no problem getting into races in PVP. There is a large gripe about the handling model with this game. *IMPORTANT* It is a little difficult to understand, but this is an arcade racer with a logical handling model. The handling is actually quite realistic; its clunky, difficult, and sometimes very difficult to control, but this is how real cars work at high speeds. (I have two performance muscle cars and race them on the weekends, so trust me when I say they can turn at speed worth anything. One is a 1970 Camaro SS Z28 and the other is a 1970 Dodge Charger R/T) Use the brake and don't just slam on the gas the while time is the key to racing effectively. ---->The Customization is more than extensive (except on the Circuit cars but they are supposed to be race cars so I get that.) I have had a lot of fun personalizing my cars to be something that I like and find attractive. I can happily say that they have attempted to find looks and styles that suit everyone's interests. The visual parts can all be bought so you roll out of the tuner with a badass looking Mustang, Camaro, or whatever else. Althought, the performance parts are sometimes frustrating to acquire, but are rewarding after a challenge.---->My frustrations;-The occasional lack of players in the open world-The tiny chance of level 50 parts-The traffic spawn distance is very short sometimes giving you no chance to dodge them when you are ripping along the desert at 250+ mph. -The expense of some of the parts. (Now this is a little bit more specific. Because it is so easy to make money it doesn't really matter anyway.)-The fact that there isn't a circuit spec for the Agera R.---->My Joys;-The customization for the cars-The little things, like overheating brakes and over-spin.-The graphics for the cars and damage models.-The auto-repair for the exterior of the car so you aren't forced to look at a car the is half destroyed.  -The Performance tweaks to the driving models that are a little difficult to notice.-The Spec differences and play style choices.-The ease at which you can make money.All in all it is very good. Not perfect by any means, but enjoyable. Worth the money, you ask? There isn't an easy way to answer that. For me I have played a lot and plan to play more so it was for me, but for others who knows. It is really one of those; "I love it" or "I hate it" games. The hype it got really hurt it. I like it better than GTA five, way more. So if you want it, get it and play with it. Take the challenges with pride and just at least give it a try before judging. My friends and I love it.

content:
Posted: February 3, 2016
												Very well done game. Graphics are done smoothly, and the better the PC you have, the better the graphics. It does take a bit of power for ultra, although. Gameplay is very fun and done nicely. PROS:Every car has potential and can be used for many different things. So if you find a well rounded car you really like, there won't be that "Aww crap, it's outdated now and I need to replace it" issue.Gameplay and graphics are smooth.Vehicle handling is done very well. Some games have very choppy driving experiances. This game does NOT!The fact you can play solo, with a team, and/or with your friends is very nice. All things are pretty much doable in either of these 3 different ways.Bugs and glitches are very rare in this game.CONS:As stated in many reviews, season pass does not include all content/DLC.Some cars, like the Skyline, are a bit OP when it comes down to it. You can obtain this car very early on for a very cheap price. It has the option to do any spec, and performs like an absolute boss. Why is this a con? I feel like due to the handling and how open the variations are, it should be tuned down a tad. No reason for an early starting car to be able to match an end game car. Plus, you may find yourself stuck on this car and not wanting to use any other car which can take some fun out of the game.If you do not own Wild Run, Ubisoft tends to force it in your face whenever it can. Constant adds, constant reminders, and the fact that all the WR DLC races are all over your map as listed races and events, but noooo, can't do them till you buy our DLC type crap.The option to use real currency to buy things. Many different reasons why this is bad. Once you are max level, have all the races done, the game does slow down a ton. Seems like there isn't a lot to do at that point. Gets very repetative and a tad boring. May discourage players at that point.OVERALL:Do I recommend this game? I do. Many hours of fun! Nothing like doing a 2+ hour race with friends on Skype! If a game can give you one hell of a good time, laughs with friends, and make a night into an awesome night, then yeah the game is worth it. The fact that I listed more cons than pros is not a final determination. The pros listed certainly outweigh the cons by a longshot. Plus, everyones opinions are different. Some might find the cons not a problem. This game keeps updated really well. They patch it pretty frequently with fixes and content. I have yet to come across any game breaking glitches or bugs. I have discovered a few glitches, but had a ton of fun with them. For example I have found a few areas that if you carefully drive into the water, you can drive underneath and have a blast! If you do chose to purchase this game, I hope you find your buy worth it and that you have fun as me and my friends have!
