content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												First of all, Use Voice chat, vent, skype TS, whatever, just communicate with people. Probably one of the best arcade racer I've ever experienced. that's something.Let's get something straight. Arcade racers are racing games that have selective physics to allow fun things to happen.If you are like me, someone who clocked 1000+ hours into Gran Turismo, played every racing game from F-Zero,CTR,Top gear,F1 simulators, to Racing lagoon. you don't expect anything to ever blow your mind again.Heck, after NFS after NFS, I started to believe arcade racers have nothing to deliver.This proved me wrong. Fantastically crafted balance of doing what's expected of a racing game, and taking itself seriously without being pretentious. > PhysicsThe physics are well crafted to do what it's supposed to, The hitboxes are somewhat forgiving as they will let you scrape past a crash or dodge trees from time to time, (unlike Forza where entering a corner wrong is kinda...fatal) It doesn't make you OCD about keeping your car in control like GT, and is both a relaxing and exciting experience.> VisualsIf you have a good PC, the visuals are quite decent, the topper is the cinematic value of an active racetrack. The game is light and easy enough for you to enjoy the cranes and planes, and steam leaks, strategically placed to block you from seeing stuff ahead is a nice touch.> StoryThe storyline? I didn't care for it at first, but it started to get better, unexpectedly good for something so cliche and dead on hollywood scriptwriting theories, The characters have a lot of depth for a racing game. It demonstrates there's nothing wrong with cliches, if it's done right. The end feels fulfilling and I'd totally get DLC for some of the character side storiesThe game is meant to be played together, the story is written so you can talk♥♥♥♥♥♥about it. It's not groundbreaking but it does the job right, something I haven't seen in racing games in a long time.(Willing suspension of disbelief regarding "driving fixes problems" is required. though much less than a michael bay movie)> GameplayIt's broken the line of pathetic cops game after game, where you can just "go vroom vroom really fast" and get away. It's a fantastic breath of fresh air. The cops actually do something. They will stop you if you drive stupidly behind them, you react to their radio as it gives you clues when they're going to ram you, and you'll have to take risks to get rid of them (not just "don't crash"). You can see that they're programmed to make the chase fun, forcing you to react and think of ways to taking them out, (which is not no longer a fancy dressing on a cake, it's required.) If you like challenging cops, this is going to be fun. I'm still expecting the difficulty to increase as people learn that you cant just get away by driving in a straight line. you know, the same people who ask Is it realistic? no, you aren't probably ever going to get away from realistic cops.If you are finding it too hard, you probably aren't voice chatting enough.The Missions are actually fun and challenging, there is enough substance in the car handling to make different skill challenges enjoyable, and the reward of making your car a bit faster after every race is great. Those crash missions are great fun, you have to plan and execute crashes giving a nice buildup to a climatic crash.I hate catchup bonuses, But I'm going to make this an exception, It's right for the type of game it is.>MMOIt's the best way to halt the piracy of the game, This was going to happen sooner or later, and this is a really good first step for racing games.For an MMO, this is really well designed, I'm surprised at the MMO elements that they've got working nicely in the game, (like the RNG god) They're missing like, crafting, (Player designed parts? *wink wink*) but that's ok. but The game is well designed with so much to do for every type of gamer in the bartle test. I've found myself navigating a rocky offroad mountian climb with my friend, pushing him when he's stuck, and screaming when i was so close to getting over that rock before tumbling down. The open world is done right.You're all worring about the cash aspect? I feel what they're doing now is perfect, Yes cash helps you get stuff, but to get the end game gear, you gotta get your hands dirty grinding the RNG god for platinum parts. so yeah, money will give you access to some cars, but any car can be tuned to the same performance tier, This is probably the correct pay model, It respects customers enough to not be pay to win, I hope activision keeps it that way.The game is much more enjoyable with people to talk to, It's really how it's designed.The drawback is there's only half a dozen people in your session, so it's sort of an mmo with very small servers. But let's be honest, 1-- players infront of the HQ isn't driveable, especially with how much you guys care about traffic laws. )and the number will probably increase after launch day fad is over when the server is more free"It's not free of glitches, but to be honest i'm surprised at how well it's working for a game a couple days from launch day? I'm starting to hate Activision a little less, just for publishing this.>SoundI mentioned to my team time after time how good the Dodge Viper sounds, what pisses me off is the music, But luckly i'm on a PC, so I can just play whatever I want in the background. The sound's what it needs to be.Tips> (Tl:dr version)- Any car can finish the game- get a crew and voice chat outside of game- accept that this isn't "realistic" like F1, GT, and Forza- prepate a written a list of insults for the police- expect some disconnects and patches near launch date- Don't tune a 2nd car until you get 40, then buy the most expensive kit starter.- Best way to farm for money is PvP, don't grind jumps like I did.- Don't try to gold stuff unless you are stuck at a level, Platinum parts unlock at lv50.- Your mother is a nice person, okay? now stop crashing me out in PvP.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2014
												Edited for Wild Run and patches:Brief:Seamless cross-country racingGreat driving physicsDecent graphicsBeautiful interior details on every carWide system requirementsExcellent wheel and controller supportJapanese voice track makes the terrible story bearable -- The main character is voiced by the same actor as Keisuke Takahashi from Initial D.Very stable, with some minor bugs -- 4K resolution Camera Mode tends to crash the game or forget shaders during rendering.Could almost outcomfy Euro Truck Simulator 2, if there wasn't such a heavy emphasis on driving full speed all the time.Motorcycles just got a physics update, giving them more realistic handling and the ability for dirtbikes to do big powerslides and scrub off jumps, now taking just as much skill to drive fast as the cars. This increases the fun quotient of driving a bike, but makes it harder to compete against an equally-tuned car. Addendum:The whole point is to hit level cap and grind PVP or faction missions with friends, the early game is extremely tedious and limits the amount of connectivity the player has. The first couple of hours in Freeride and you'll see AI driving around in place of real humans. After you get to level 2 or so, they disappear and are replaced with humans, but only if your NAT is good. This game uses a console-style system to deal with multiplayer, so if your home network is not properly set up, you will find it to be a completely dead game, which it very much isn't. You are also kept from accessing your Season Pass bonus cars until after you reach  Level 10. I would have liked to complete the tutorial with the Cadillac Eldorado, but it will be a couple hours of gameplay before you can even touch those vehicles.Base controller settings are garbage -- Make sure to mess with the options to make driving comfortable. Primarily, the speed sensitivity should be turned down, and if you have a newer controller, turn the deadzone off. Not much content - that said, it is a RACING game, and it has all kinds of that. PVP now has multiple gametypes, and the car selection is much better than at release. Some promised features still not yet in gameSTILL NO REAR-VIEW MIRRORS IN COCKPIT VIEWAbsolutely cringeworthy plot no matter what language you listen to it in.tl;dr: Ridiculous fun with friends if you can stomach the kusoge elements, overbearing and far too long tutorial, and odd glitch. There simply isn't anything like it.

content:
Posted: September 27, 2016
												They're giving it away for free right now, so you may as well give it a shot.Got it on sale, I definitely wouldn't buy it for full price. Graphics are pretty good, car exterior detail and rain are especially attention grabbing. The car sounds are really weird and probably a weak point-it sounds like they were synthesized rather than recorded. The game world is huge and the detail is pretty good considering the size, but it feels a lot emptier than any of the competition. The driving physics are pretty good and beginner-friendly and you can turn off the assists if you want. Nothing on the level of say, Forza Horizon but much better than Need For Speed 2015. The tuning is probably the biggest advantage-there are a ton of parts for every car. Bodykits, interiors, wheels etc and many cars have widebody versions in the "Perf" tuning spec. That brings me to the car selection. There are about 60, I think, plus their various tuning kits. This would be fine but the selection is a bit dumb- we get a Cadillac Escalade but no CTSV for instance. Attention to detail is where a lot of the cars fall apart-cockpit gauges are often off, or in some cases don't even work. You also can't sell off unwanted cars either which I don't get. The money system is annoying but not horrible. The game doesn't nickel and dime you that bad and you can make a lot doing skills and just drifting around, but the system is definitely skewed to try and get you to buy stuff. Cars especially are super expensive but you can test drive them before you buy which is nice. Parts are cheap though and handed out for free for doing skills.It's a fun game but the world feels a bit dead at times and a lot of car appearance and spec details are overlooked. You can get lost just driving around for a long time though, and you can turn off the road at any time. Pick it up while it's free or try the trial and wait for a sale.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												     Ubisoft hasn't had a very good track record this year. With buggy games like Unity, Watch Dogs, and even Far Cry 3, I can see why someone would be cautious about buying this game. From my experience in this game so far I am going to use one word to sum it up. L O V E. That's it. This game has so much to offer and I really think that Ubisoft saved the best for last this year. It has amazing graphics, people in the world with you, and a HUGE map and vast selection of cars to choose from. If you are a fan of open world games or racing games or all of the above, I hugely reccomend getting The Crew. To sum it up, there are some cons to this game, as it can be a little repetitive, but, it has an engaging story where you learn to feel for the characters and so many fun things to do.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												With some initial rocky troubles with updates and stability, this game had me swinging from exhilarated to furious and back to exhilarated again.  Right now everything is working fine and its the best damn driving game i've played.I've been a major fan of the Need for Speed series, especially the free roaming, free agent types of Most Wanted and Hot Pursuit.  With those previous titles, they pioneered many features of free driving and competitive co-operative play i've enjoyed.  With The Crew, I get to experience all of that with added elements of full co-operative support, an unprecidentedly open free roam world, well balanced cosmetic and performance modifications.  I'm still getting into the game so i'm still looking forward to the real PvE and PvP experiences along with the action the faction system will bring.For now it definitely gets a thumbs up, though as with any launch title it will have bugs and problems, so be patient (or wait a while before you buy).

content:
Posted: April 19, 2015
												+Decent handling, Little too stiff for my liking, but it does the job.tons of interesting / unique environments / tracks to race inStory mode has good variety in gameplay (story mode lasts about 6 hours)can literally instantly warp to any location/event on the map (assuming you've driven to the area before)You and your friends can be in the same party while still playing different events or be at different locations.Grouping / playing with friends is super easy.Awesome, easy to use menus / interfaces-to have any chance at winning multiplayer matches, you'll need to grind a lot to upgrade your car (which can only done in solo-mode). If you don't improve your car level, you'll lose the race so bad you won't even see your oponent for 90% of the race.This means you will basically NEED to spend 6+ hours (on top of completing the story mode) trying to improve your cars doing repetitive tasks (hit the targets, drive as fast as possible, jump as far as possible, etc) until your cars are leveeld up) just to enjoy multiplayer races. These events, after the first few 3-4 times lose their fun value quick.I really dislike the car leveling system (at least as far as the multiplayer is concerned) and it's for this reason, I haven't had a chance to enjoy multiplayer and probably never will (I refuse to play X hours completing mundane tasks just as a prerequisite to compete against others in multiplayer.)All-in-all, it's a great game, especaially if you're into arcade racing. They really setup a nice framework and allow a lot of flexibility to encourage people to play in groups. If you hope to race against others in multiplayer, be prepared to do 6+ hours of grinding first.

number of helpful: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 20, 2015
												Well, i figured i might aswell write my first review as a review of this game. I just completed it today. Today being 4 days after i got it, and i've racked up just over 23 hours of playtime. And oh boy. Summed up, this game is essentially the result of throwing Test Drive Unlimited 2, Driver: San Fransisco and Need For Speed: Undercover intro a breeding pen together. Being a massive fan of TDU and the Driver series, i'd say that sounds pretty damn good. It has the exploration and collectibles of TDU2, the "undercover ex-street racer who was jailed up but picked by the FBI to catch bad guys" plotline, which i suppose is a mix of D:SF and NFSU, and then the attention to detail around the maps and customization of TDU2. The plotline is pretty short. Like i mentioned earlier, i completed the storyline within 23 hours, and that's with quite some extra time added into exploration. You could probably sprint trough the game in 17/18 hours. Though, the exploration is what makes this game so enjoyable. Like, for ♥♥♥♥'s sake, there's a unicorn and a bigfoot walking around for you to almost run over in your Paris-Dakar specced muscle cars and circuit spec classic cruisemobiles. The map is large. Very, very large. It's basically the entire US, and even though it's downscaled, you'll still spend over an hour getting from one end of the map to the other. It's also surprisingly well detailed, with a ton of stuff to discover, like a giant ski jump to launch your car off, or 5 different race tracks, or wrecked cars, which is another thing very similar to TDU2. It's a good time if you enjoy cars and exploring♥♥♥♥♥♥ Oh, and TD;LR if you can't be arsed to read my ♥♥♥♥♥♥ review:  Ubisoft didn't ♥♥♥♥ up

content:
Posted: April 1, 2016
												I genuinely like the crew as long as you make sure you purchase Wild Run this dramatically improves vehicle handling and adds motorbikes and monstertrucks to the mix as well as dynamic weather and visual improvements. The map scale is truely impressive and the car models are of very high quality making ownership of these cars a real joy to cruise around in. The sigleplayer Story expeience is always down to the wire with nailbiting races and the AI can screw up although not as much as a human will.The Multiplayer option is good and encourages competition as well as working together to finish that hard as balls mission.The in vehicle views and bonet views are very well done and add to the immersion.If I had anything negative to say it would be about inapp-purchases. NO Ubisoft NO. I want to be able to earn my vehicle and drive against players that have earned their new rides instead of people who can just buy the best vehicle and get all the advantages from that.PROS : Graphically stunning as long as you have Wild Run. Incredible scale and detail to the map it truly is MASSIVE! Vehicle Models are of the highest quality. A genuinely fun and exciting story fo the campaign (although generic)AI vehicles can screw up making it more realistic. CONS:INAPP-PURCHASES gives some players unfair advantage over a player who earns their vehicle in game . I don't expect to pay any more when Iv'e supposedly bought the whole game. Get rid of inapp-purchases for sanity's sake it cheapens the whole product.AI drivers can be TOO smart never missing corners and seemingly completing courses with ease they also recover way too quickly as opposed to the player who is heavily penalized for screwing up.

												I have literally never given a review for all the games I have ever played in my 23 years of living, last year I got into PC gaming. I purchased a g27 Logitech steering wheel and have been playing racing games mainly since then. To satisfy my "free roam/buy cars" itch I had been playing Test Drive Unlimited 2. Awesome graphics, Fun enough gameplay and hours of me crusing around Hawaii drinking beer and driving XD.I have read a HORRENDOUS amount of negative reviews about this game and since it was able to be played last night I havn't put it down, I dont know why it says 8.5 hours played. For one, the driving feels exactly the way I want a game like this to feel, I play other racing sims such at Assetto Corsa, WRC3, RBR and I will tell you, i would NOT want The Crew to play like that. WAY more fun being able to fly 120mph in an over powered 370z around corners and flying off rediculously over sized ramps (on the fly challenges are F***ING cool, you'll learn when you start playing) than it being on the "Realistic/Simulator" side. I mean seriously in those games you have to actually drop it to about 15mph around a sharp turn to keep your car in control. Do you REALLY want to be doing that in a NFS style game? No, it would get highly annoying.To those of you with a g27. This game works perfectly with it, 900* of rotation feels just right. Plently of tweaking options to make all your pedals feel just right, Force Feedback kicks just right with what your car is doing.There is alot more, just message me or comment for more questions.Must buy, 10/10, BAD A**.

												The first game that i really didn't regret buying, it's the only game that takes me back through timeon my NFS: U days but 50x bettermy game rating: 9/10Pros:- Customizable Cars- Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, Circuit (NFS, Dirt, NFS Shift)- Open map ( The whole USA, it's just mindblowing )- No Loading screens when on the road, ( roads just keep going and going and going)- Landmarks ( i really love this, i'm learning new places in the game, featuring SALT FLATS! content:
Posted: January 29, 2015
												Just finished the single-player campaign, or whatever you wanna call the story missions, cause you can do them in co-op as well. Anyway, the game is not finished, yet enjoyable for a very specific crowd. Let me explain. At a very technical level, the game is not where it should be. Laggy and stuttery even on an FX-9590 and 290x, tendency to cook a water cooled processor that doesn't go past 58 in Prime95, and almost unplayable on a mobile platform with an A10-5750M and M290x. If you can muster better specs and get it to be playable and responsive, you'll run into their side of the hardware issues, meaning the server. It might not pe hardware though, but still technical. On some networks it works, on others it doesn't, and it will disconnect every now and then in the middle of one of those hour long races, and you'll have to do it all over again. So, if these are things that you think you can look past just to get a glimpse of the sunset from the Grand Canyon behind the wheel of a LaFerrari, this is the game for you. It looks amazing, the cars sound fantastic, and on hardcore driving mode the driving model is brilliantly tuned for a very good mix of arcade and sort of simulator. Not a simulator in the actual sense, just that it follows a few rules that arcade racers usually don't. Say you're in a controlled power slide, or a drift, and one of your back wheels hits the dirt on the outside of the bend, or the snow, or even a wet patch, you will lose control of the car, because the back end loses grip completely. That is a very nice touch. So, driving model not bad at all, but not a full on simulator by any means. The story itself is a cliche, obviously, you've heard it a million times if you're into this culture, or have ever played a NFS game or seen an FnF movie. Bad guy kills/betrays your brother/mother/sister/any other signifcant family members and then you seek to get revenge by driving fast and breaking the law almost all the way. Nevertheless, this story is told well, with good quality cut-scenes and voice acting. Also, the missions themselves are quite fun, at least at first, because later on the same challanges are presented for the lack of more then 3 or 4 modes. You get the normal checkpoint race, checkpoint time trial, a sort of destruction derby against the clock, where you need to catch and bash into the opponent several times until a health bar hovering over his/her car is depleted. This one is quite interesting and fun, until they pit you against a prison bus that can keep up with a modified Mustang that can do 300 KM/h. Funny, but frustrating after the fifth try. Also has the health or relisience of a prison bus. There's another mode which I shall call "touch the package" because it can be interpreted in several ways, and I love a good internal debate. Anyway, this one puts you on a course, against the time, in which there are 100 packages on the ground, the story will explain why they are there, don't worry, not as stupid as it sounds. You have to, within that time limit, hit 80 of those boxes. Sounds easy? Pah. Difficult, but fun.As a whole experience, because there is much more to talk about, and I can't be bothered because it's my night off, and I just wanted to share my general opinion about The Crew, the game is enjoyable if you like cars and the whole customization, FnF and NFSU heritage stuff. For the car enthusiast, the flaws are not there to disturb, we keep hoping that eventually they will be patched, because they are obvious, yet we look beyond them and enjoy good looking and sounding cars, that drive in an impressively fun and engaging manner, amongst scenery that you will probably only get to see in game. By the way, the map is a smaller version of the United States, with little versions of New York, Detroit, Las Vegas, Los Angeles and many other major US cities. Basically, you get to drive across America. And, also important, in my opinion, you can modify your cars in pretty fine detail, and the body parts available are very good looking, and have that racy feel, not the silly Underground toy looking things. You can put together a very good looking off-road version of a 2011 Mustang with 800 horses under the hood. Pretty cool. Thumbs up, but please work on those performance issues at least. Thank you.

content:
Posted: May 25, 2015
												PERSONAL OPINION Well, I'm going to tell you that this game needs a friend. Unfortunately, it doesn't come with one guaranteed.When I played this game/ both alone and with a friend, it is the absolute best racing/driving game I have ever played.No, I don't understand why there's so much hate. What do all those haters play, Need for Speed Rivals?All jokes aside; this game is definitely better than its competitors at its gen. I enjoyed this game thoroughly, and would rate it 98/100 (1 point minus for minor connectivity issues, 1 point minus for bad ending) Let me start with the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ map. Yes, the freaking huge map. And its not just 90% emptiness, no no no no....Its probably one of the largest maps in gaming history. I'm pretty sure it could go par against Guild Wars 2 in map size.Next up is the main story sequence. Overall, the story was NeedForSpeedMostWanted(2005)-ish and really pushes you to want to know more. Its not shakespeare but hey, I found it to fit okay.The cars in the game are well modeled (except their bottom; but who the hell looks there), and there is a pretty good level of car-modding. Okay, not Need For Speed Carbon/UG2 level, but at least around NFSMostWanted(2005) level. The paints choices are great, and the vinyl choices are not bad. They should make more though.I don't think there is alot of cars in the game, and before people start chirping the game because you can purchase cars; you can finish the game and get the best car without paying a single extra dollar. Just don't pay heed to purchasable cars and you're good. I personally liked their car choices; despite the low car count.The AI in the game (which some saw glitching) was actually flawless for me. They are pretty smart, and I'm pretty sure they are much better AI than that of older racing games. This is because the AI will not let you grind onto them or use them as "padding" as you make a sharp turn with them. They will speed up or slow down to make you screw up. It makes the game have a level of challenging in it.Okay, you got me here. The handling. Its not great is it? Well, I'm going to tell you that to each his own because me and my friend both just got used to it. I know, its kinda annoying, but it makes it a tad bit more challenging. It kinda forces you to learn how to properly turn and drift. Not sure if its realistic, but that doesn't matter for me anyway, it wasn't the end of the game. The graphics. This stuff is not your Driveclub or Forza graphics. But its definitely the right gen. I can barely run it with my computer but it looks amazing. Although there are some blotchy textures in shady places, the surrounding game has some good texturing.The Audio is good, but could use a little bit more bass/could sound more heavy.All the different specs you can get for your car, these are what fill in the "not enough customization" and "not enough cars" gap. The specs and their upgrades are well done, and they give the cars more specialization in what they do.The performance parts in the game are acquired by the means of completing mini-challenges or buying them at high levels. Of course, I didn't mind this as much but I could see why people would prefer buying them. Plus the model of the vehicle's inside does not change, no matter which performance part you pick. I did not have this game crash too many times, only twice from my many hours of playing and also once because my Eyefinity is not really compatible. I didn't find any bugs so far (minus my friend apparently being able do drive underwater once). The PVP in this game was decent, and the MMO-thing is not the biggest thing about the game. I played with a friend; as I said before, and we both really enjoyed this game.The challenges are a bit silly, but they are great in the case that someone wants to get some quick cash. The game's economy isn't that bad. Worth every dime of my 40$. TLDR; 98/100, huge map, get a friend, ending sucks, but overall an enjoyable game.

content:
Posted: June 18, 2015
												I never write reviews, but I had to for this: This game is totally worth it.I've been waiting for an open world racer forever and the scale of this is incredible. The biggest hesitation I had was graphics. I'm on a gtx 960, I'm used to playing max quality games whether it's Assassins Creed or Starcraft or Guild Wars 2. The reality is, I'm used to good graphics, and I can't play anything that looks terrible.This game, with gtx 960 I can easily crank up to maximum, and my God it looks beautiful. I mean, I guess it was the expectation that it might be crap, thanks to all those negative reviews and the only videos that portray PS/Xbox gameplay. But on PC, with max settings, it's a modern game. And that's critical because I want to tour the country!Now gameplay wise, I just started, so I can't tell you yet. But even if it literally had 0 story, 0 missions, no campaign, I'm satisfied. And I can't wait to spend hours just driving around the country and check out all those cities I've visited before and explore all the new cities that I've never seen. Screw the AI, screw the online gameplay. You want those? There's already plenty of games before The Crew that deliver on that. You're here because this is literally the craziest open world driver there is.Thanks Ubisoft. And to those hesitators out there, I deliberated since its release, and now I've picked it up and totally worth it.

content:
Posted: June 20, 2015
												Online racing RPG, if you like realistic racing games, stay away from this one, it's an arcade racer.Level up your cars and customize them, be sure to look up guides on car handling settings for one that fits your style.+ Huge world, drive to Mazda Raceway Laguna Seca and then drive off to the mountains, you can go anywhere+ Dirt, mud, grass, snow, sand, icy roads, roads, highways, cities, circuits...+ Fun handling, burn tires, drift, jump unreal heights and reach speeds of over 400Km/h+ Great graphics and highly detailed world from one end to the other+ Over 40 cars with unique visual parts, bodykits, over 100 rims, and a lot of paint jobs+ Great sounds, from car to environment+ Many skill challenges to do all over the world+ Unicorns- Short story, boring and senseless- No single player races except for the story ones- Only supports about 10 players per online session- End game is all about farming car mods and it takes forever- Weird things happen sometimes when jumping and flipping over

content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
												I'll be honest: I was hyped as hell when i first saw the trailer.But I waited it to go on sale, and downloaded the trial version first. I was scared by the huge amount of negative reviews.I bought the standard version, no DLC, no Season Pass, they will come later, maybe, we'll see.The Season Pass is tempting me, but 24€ is just a little too much. I'll wait a sale.The driving feel and physics: doesn't feel totally right, I've had better, but it's not so awful as many had depict. Maybe it's just my steering settings, need to look into it some more.Rubberbanding AI: not found. Both when I got the lead and when I was behind, I felt no rubberbanding from the AI cars. Drive clean, with no mistakes, and who's behind will stay behind.Little update: the rubberbanding is noticeable in long races (>30 min), otherwise is pretty much nonexistant.It is not a simulator, at all.Later I'll add some more details, I need to go deeper in the game experience. Until then, it's a 7/10.Get it when on sale (30-50%).EDIT, 1/8: Damn me I bought the SP. Worth. Cars are really well made, only thing that bothers me are mirrors not working. In 2015. Come on Ivory Tower, you can do better than this. Still a 7/10 and still worth, even more if you have 2-3 friends to race with.PvPs are demolition derbies, never seen such unsportsmanship.Fun thing to do is dodge the oncoming opponent, watch the wannabe rear-ender fly down a cliff and taste his salty tears as he insults you in french.EDIT, 21/8/16: More than one year is passed and I STILL CAN'T GET ENOUGH of this game!However, some things really♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥me off:- Wild Run and the incoming Calling All Units are not included in the Season Pass. Need more money, Ubi?- "Smart Loot" my♥♥♥♥♥♥ Getting end-tier car parts is now an almost impossible task with all the useless vinyl/paint/rims drops. Either farm money and buy the parts from the tuner shop or get ready for some serious grinding.- Wild Run adds pretty much nothing compared to its price. No story, no challenges, no trials, nothing. Also, bikes behave like cars and your monster truck behaves like a normal car (don't expect to ramp through traffic Monster Jam style).- Car physics are a little too much uniform. Raid cars, for example: a 1750kg Dodge RAM jumps and swerves like a 950kg Porsche. Not good.- WE (at least I, for what is worth) NEED SOME BASIC CAR SETTINGS. High-end gearbox parts have ratios too low, the car in 5th gear does not pull without NO2. Only way to tune gear ratios is to install lower tier parts. ABSOLUTELY not good.- Still can't use custom music in the in-game radio. Seriously? Come on.The vote is still a 7/10, get it if you like roam around with some music (played in VLC), don't get Wild Run.Also, people complaining about game not working with Nvidia drivers or new GPUs: I have drivers version 372 with a GTX1070. Everything works flawlessy. Get your PC right before downvoting a game.

content:
Posted: July 23, 2015
												Updated: This is my final review. All of my review on thia game are base on gameplay and its features except story plot, as I always skip them like I do in other race game (except Split Second <3 ). If you have experience in Need For Speed Underground 2/Most Wanted (old), then you might have a same experience in The Crew, with different styles of course. Graphic is ok actually, and the control or handling car aren't that bad. So far it is good, it's cool to see other players during roam mode. Basicly the PvP (non crew pvp) is just same like other race game such Dirt 2, however, instead require host create a a lobby and organize the event, The Crew players that joined the lobby will vote which event they want to try. Haven't try yet the Crew vs Crew PvP (aka team vs team). Event after try I wont update anymore. xPDo caution that server in co-op/PvP is really terrible, most of time you'll get disconnected issue, not sure is this is really base on player's internet connection or it's the game's server issue..There's no rubberband Ai like those negative said, it's just normal Ai like other racing game. There's no perfect and logic Ai. It's yours skills to how you deal with them. Here's my screenshot.

			The Crew Racing On Detroit's Freeway! -Subscribe - https://www.youtube.com/user/renaldy75?sub_confirmation=1 -Follow me on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/renaldy75PC -Follow me on Twitter!		

Here's about Ai info I've been meet:Racer: •Like other game they sometimes can bit speedy or slow, even they speed is same as your. But as I said before, it's about your skills. For me, most Ai racer are very easy to handle. •Most of them stick into they waypoint, lika a train rail. There's a mission that I saw the same car hit on a truck twice (I retry the mission and yea, it occur on same place, same time). But meh, I play other race game before so its just normal.•A Take Down mission really annoying. Dunno how to explain lol.Cops, Police:•All right.. So far I only see two way to trigger chase. 1st, hit anything inside 'Police Watch' area, until they trigger chase. 2nd way is, hit the police car if you see them. If you guys know other way (than mission), please let me know coz its fun trolling them xP•All police just do is only ramming you. The star wanted level seems only increase number of police chasing you, road block and heli. Seriously roadblock is pretty ridiculous, only 1 police car block, with signal obstacles, in any wanted level. Please do not run from them by trying taking offroad, they'll chase you with dirt specs, also with heli, which is really difficult to escape if your car were using non raid/dirt spec. It was hell for me to run from them using Golf inaide forest but it was fun. xDNote: For those people who is don't have a clue about trial issue, copy your CD key in Steam Library and paste it at Active Product on uPlay.Please also do note that the trailer is too promising. I suggest you to try demo 1st. Well, it's still fun and cool racing game I ever played, 2nd of my fav after Split Second.Here's my review so far:-Pros:Big detailed mapAble to see other players roaming around. It's cool!Nice graphicSomewhat it's challenging. Seriously, sometimes there's too many cars (obstacles) on trafficNo cut-scene crash/accident like Need For Speed series (if you think this is cons it is pro for me. I hate when speeding in race or in free roaming, or while eescaping from police you got crash and then a cut-screen, slowing down you).Support are nice, I guess.Most time updateGreat communityCrew vs Crew PvP systemGreat car customization. You can tune your car to into various specs which is street, dirt (rally actually..), raid, circuit. You can't tune Stock specs but you can customize its visual on your HQ.8 players on each roam map is great, I guess.. Assuming enable more players will make the map lag, like most online game I played. Even though the map is very super large scaled getting lag will make player frustrated and stop play. This is my experienced in most online game. At least for me.Cons:Crew Credits systems in-game, in PAID games. Some car cannot bought through bucks. This should not happen. (Note: ingame progress you'll receive free 100k crew credit once. But as I said, Crew Credit supposedly not exist since this paid game, also can make game unbalanced.Season Pass benefit kinda unfair for me. Plus it is expensive, not worth for its features. DLC also expensive.Kinda unrealistic physics.Must have internet connection to play.Ingame player's profile avatar are using uPlay avatar, and can't upload/customize ingame profile avatar like the trailer.. This is so frustrating, stupid, and horrible..Thats all from me. :)My rate: 8/10

content:
Posted: January 16, 2016
												I bought this during the Steam Christmas sale (2016). I got The Crew and the Crew Wild Run for about $20.  WELL WORTH IT. NOTE: Activate your CD KEy within Uplay, otherwise, you will be stuck on The Crew Wild Run beta. Pretty stupid, I know, but it took me a little while to figure that out since its not an official steam game. You can get a great deal on this game for the content you receive if you wait for it on sale.The driving style is more arcade-ish,  kind of like the Burnout series. Downsides:    You receive the occasional framerate drop from 60 to about 50 in bigger cities such as Los Angeles due to the higher volume of traffic.     The story is good, but the story missions are kind of repetitive. Hopefully, they can mix it up a little more in the sequel (if they decide to make one).

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												I've played this game for 3 hours total, i cannot say i have anything to complain about in the way the map system and cars look and so forth. But anyway, pro's and con's.Con's:- controlling of cars aren't as good as i expected when i bought the game. - At points, not occuring too often, the game freezez like a glitch or loads forever which ends up in me restarting the game. - Too good graphics, (shouldn't complain, but not having a high end pc is taking it's toll on me, and in the position i am in right now, i can't upgrade my pc. Therefore i wish the game had more "modifiable" graphics where i can choose what the graphics card focuses mostly on. Such as for example, car quality over cloud/sunray quality (For example).- I do feel like it's not a super great racing game, where as i got my hopes up while watching trailers and such. Pro's:-Game looks amazing-Great details on car, great details on to be honest, anything graphic wise. - Very "rookie" friendly, i believe anyone could enjoy this gameIn general, i do very much recommend this game if they fix the cars driving and drifting control. (More like GTA V) If you got a high-end pc, and you enjoy games with amazing graphics, this is definitely to recommend! :) Based on skills with driving games and such:  Experience Recommended?   Noob Sure, try the Demo   Experienced Yep, try the version without DLC's and such   Pro Yes definitely, just buy the whole kit, won't regret it.

content:
Posted: July 21, 2016
												Reviewing / Comparing with Need For Speed 2015Crew Vs NFS 20151) Story mode - NFS 2015 has a disappointing story mode which basically is not a story mode its just (Just cutscenes) and they are like hey come on over so we can race with this dude and i am doing a night out in racing, You get cutscene or phone calls which is frustrating as they call you duing a race and they tell  you tht i am here waiting come-on and dont leave me hanging even when u are playing in co-op. Crew  has a nice story mode which is good and a plus point you can play some of the missions again if u want in co-op or Solo Crew Story Mode - 8/10   /////     Nfs 2015 - 3/102) Graphics - Need For Speed uses the frostbite engine same as BF4 which makes the game look good but its only night and always rainy. But the Graphics look Awesome Crew uses the new Anvil+ engine which is used in AC unity and AC syndicate + all their game which is also good and it has a 24hr cycle before the wild run update it used Babel EngineCrew Graphics - 8/10  /////   NFS Graphics - 9/103) Internet Usage - Both of the games are Online but Crew stands out bcoz of its Least usage of internet when u are alone , Crew uses a 8mil radius to match you with other players so if no 1 is in tht 8mil radius then u only communicate with the server on short intervals on the other hand NFS 2015 needs a Constant Internet connection even in Play Alone mode my routers lights didnt stop, They just kept going so its a constant communication of Send and Receive which is not Good if u are on a Data Cap.Crew - 9/10   /////  NFS 2015 - 5/104) Races in openworld - Races in Crew are good as u can play them in PVP or Solo mode but it loads you in the match means u wont bump into other players unless u are doing Skill challenges , In Nfs even if u play solo or in a crew u will bump into players or npc's which are not in your race which ruins the whole race exp. NFS 2015 - 3/10  ///// Crew - 9/105) Customization Paint and Parts and Car -Some Customization in NFS is good like Paint Jobs (Wraps) which you can customize according to your style just like NFS shift while in Crew u cant put any paint skins on some cars. Parts some cars cant be modified in NFS,  while some parts are missin in Crew but still they can be modified.Crew Cars = 66 cars + 7 bikes (BIkes is a plus point in Crew)Nfs Cars = 49 + 2 hot rods (no bikes)Crew - 9/10 ///// NFS - 5/106) Open World -Crew it stretched from US EAST. to US WEST whole USA basically.NFS a place called portview? which is some highside roads and some city and 2-3 bridges.Final Verdict - Go for The Crew You will love the game more content to enjoy than NFS , But if u want to buy NFS go for when on heavy Sale like 50-75% off otherwise is a NO GO.So final socre The Crew =8/10 and NFS 2015 =5/10

content:
Posted: September 16, 2016
												So I bought this game day 1, when it came out on 360, and too be honest, it was dissappoining then. However, since then this game has become much better. There are still a few things that need to be addressed. Until the Cops vs Racers update, I'd give it a 7/10. Once the new update is here, depending on what gets fixed, it might go up.1) Open world. And I mean OPEN WORLD. The map is immense, go any where you want to go. It literally takes almost an hour to drive at 150mph to get from NY to LA, and that's if you don't get distracted by something shiny. 2)Envornment. Might not make a difference in how your vehicle handles. However the change from forest to snowy mountains to desert adds life to the game. the addition of wildlife also adds a nice touch. challenging when your going 180mph in a McLaren and then DEER!!!!3)AI. Ubisoft still has some work to do on this one. However, compared to what it was at the beginning, massivly better. The cities actually feel like their alive to a point. Its also neat when your in the countryside, theres no where near as much traffic as in the city.4)DLC. I know most people don't like paying for extra game. However, the DLCs have brought much needed content to the game, and has greatly added to the depth of the game.5)Graphics. They are just fantastic to look at, and i have a $50 low resolution TV, so imagine if a High-def TV is used. I can see the individual drops of rain on the windshield.6)The cars. What car game can be complete  without the cars. I still felt that there were too few cars, maybe about 35 total with the DLC. They have been adding new cars for free however, so there's still hope for this one.7)Cops. Ok so this is probably my biggest irritant. The cops are well, easy to beat. They don't really present a challange. However, they do set up roadblocks, PIT you, and they have even down the rolling box on me. However it is so easy to get away. On this one, Im waiting too see what happens with the new cops vs racers uodate in November. 8) Physics. Kindy goofy. For those looking for a simulator level of driving, go look elsewhere. Its got a arcady feel to it, which for me its fine. If I wanted simulater I'd go play Forza.9)Always online. With good internet connection, you can still play and not deal with anyone else. They'll still be there, but it doesn't force you to interact with them. However it would be nice too have a offline option. Eventually Ubisoft will have to add it in. They cant keep the servers up forever.10)Story. Really short. Feels kind of forced at times, and makes you go "wha" at times. But i didnt get tis game to watch cutscenes, i got it to take a sportscar off roading and launching it off cliffs, because why the F--- not.Overall, I give this game 7/10. It is fun racing game that can make hours dissappear. Id wait til its on sale to get it. Get the one woth all the packs. It'll make the game that much better too play.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												Love it, the game is so much of what we all hoped for from NFS and TDU series. What they were supposed to be and then some.  I have longed for a MMO Racing game that was just that.  A "MMO" racing game... Since the days of MCO, we finally have one.  I just really hope the MS doesn't kill it, turn it into P2W, and that the prices are REASONABLE!!!  Now if they would just add a few more trucks and (before the tuner haters start ranting) that they add Scion.  Look'em up, they are winning like mad!  (and hey, the tC and FRS are good lookin! don't deny it you muscle car lovers =P )  But really though, go check out the vids on youtube!   So looking forward to the game expanding, so much potential with such a great idea!(aside from the normal dose of haxlet nubtart basement dwelling trolls, the ones on here don't seem to grasp the concept of "crews" nor factions in this game.)I did the closed beta and even at that time with bugs and adjustments needed in phsyics/mechanics it was a blast to play.  The cars look great, although the car audio could use some attention to make them sound more like the real deals IMO.  Have any questions, feel free to ask!Also IMO, the gold will be worth it.  Look forward to hating some tires on Dec. 2nd!Well now after launch I still don't change my opinion!  I have noticed a bit more lag than beta and had a crash.  In beta I had less lag and no crashes lol.   If you didn't get the pre-order you missed out on some cool content.  Any questions as I said before; Feel free to askLag has lessend quite a bit and still waiting on the patches.  They are starting to make a habbit of not really supporting the games after release.  Still though I do reccomend the game, just wait for a sale.  If they fixed the sync issues and a few other bugs that can hinder game play a bit, it would be well worth the full price.Well after playing and waiting, it is about half of what they promised.  Not suprised as Ubisoft is making a habbit and trend of this crap.  With the issues of being able to see other players and "co-op"  still giving a problem, with NAT issues.  It can be fun when you can actually play with others and find people that actually have a clue as to what The Crew is supposed to be.  Still say it's not worth full price, but it is free to play monthly, So... If you are still on the fence, I suggest wathcing some streams or Youtube vids.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Okay here I am, two years after the game got released. And having bought the Gold edition, and now CAU with WR it wasn't the cheapest thing here. Hell I might have bough a ship in Star Citizen instead of this. But this game has given me Many hours of relaxation. If we are talking about PVP even some frustration. If you want an open world racing game, get this, but I'd wait for a sale, since it's crazy buying it for the full price with the DLC's, it's important to say that you are good to go with the standard version, altough CAU brings some sweet Police vehicles.But hey first I'll tell you what you will completely love about this game.The world, it's just so huge that I can't stop loving it. I always wanted a racing game where instead of just running around tracks, you could just set a course and go that way. And these guys finally did it. I've driven aimlessly for about 500km's (real). And then another 500 km's with set destinations (without any purpose)And another 300km's when I had to get somewhere.So that's the open world done.Racing SP - AI is weird and stupid. But it can be quite enjoyable to try and stay in the perfect line on the current track. Singleplayer racing is more used for grinding money.Racing MP - I don't like it. It's just exploiting the games arcade drive model. So instead of real driving action you are just sliding and doing unrealistic stuff all the time.The Summit - You do some stuff from time to time to increase your chance to get a vehicle for free, nothing extra.CAU pursuits - Feel extremely weird... You have two abilities, as racer and even as a cop. They slightly are slightly different from each other, but extremely OP. Just press one button each 40s to literally stop each and everys cop atempt to stop you, cop players end up just resetting to the transporter to get emp'ed again... Cops are in a huge disadvantage, if you are Dark Souls kind of player who just wants to die of frustration, suit yourself. For Racers it's a grinding quest, where occasionally you get intercepted by a cop player, and just follow two simple rules 1) head for the destination 2) Press any of your abilities when ready and cop players are nearby to ruin their day and secure yourself that you get the money to buy another car to do the same thing again to buy another car and so on.Vehicles - Another thing that I love about this game is the amount of cars. They might not represent their real life counterparts. But hey, they are not completely same cars. You get European supercars, classics, sportscars, American Muscle cars and Japanese tuners. If you have a favorite car, it is probably there.Customization is also fine, most of the time you get about 8 bumper variations, hoods. Wings, rims. Hell of a lot of colors and stickers. To make your favorite car appeal to you even more.Also I really love the added police vehicles. Nothing says security more then a cop driving 360km/h in a police Lamborghini Gallardo SVVerdict - This game is just great for wandering off just like you do for instance in Skyrim.Unfortunately you can see throughout the game that the energy to develop this game went into the wrong aspects. I personally think that Ivory Tower should've gone into the RP style of gameplay, similar to Test Drive Unlimited. They focus too much on "your" Crew, that is just a normal group like in WoW or any other MMORPG.But if it is in sale, and you crave for a driving game with vast open world and a variety of vehicles. I say go for it.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2014
												-Short and Sweet-If you know what your buying, did your research and understand its an MMO-R-RPG, with future free updates and DLC, Know what it is: Arcade-ish, Horizontal progression, minor vertical progression, open-world. Know what it is not: Not realistic racer, no massive important story, a game thats been out for a long time. Side notes: the BS thats being said about fixing up your cars, complete BS, Every spec, every car has its own style and body parts, i havent seen a clone of my skyline yet. Also iv been helped out by lvl 50's many times, just my Quick Cooping, iv made friends and raced on open streets for no good reason. Story missions done with rando's then friend requested. The car parts are like MMO's loot systems, you gotta complete something to get the upgrade part.Theres a lot of BS comments revolving around this game.The game is what you make it. Thats why its called Open-World. Also if you notice, some of the reviewers that talked♥♥♥♥♥♥on the game, still play it, GG.

												So last year after playing for 80 hours I gave this game a bad review. I said easy fix, let us make a race and do our own checkpoints. You pretty much are forced into getting gold  just to get an upgrade to your car that only adds a point or 2 to the specs when you can get platinum which should be a better part. Sometimes smart loot gives you a part, but mostly a new color paint job that if i wanted I would buy. But with limited tuning that seems to not matter in the end with a mini cooper with the same specs as a hyper car. It wouldve been fine to cap off lower end cars, it would have made the game more fun to get faster cars and actually made the season pass worth it. 7/10 with friends 5/10 solo

Posted: February 14, 2015
												Ubisoft has created a new genre of racing game, it's neither arcade or realism, it's Ubisoft genre which is really, really bad.This game is one of the worse racing games I've ever played.The cops are like walls of brick.I finished a quick activity where i needed to drive through the arrows and a cop was after me, it shouldn't since i was in an activity but oh well i end up the activity and now i can't to anything cause a window appear to show me my score and right after i was gonna click on something so I could retry it I got bursted... What the heck is that?There are many flaws other than that but In my opinion, that is the worse of them.It is an MMO but why is the connection always required? That's ********, In 1, 2 or 3 years, when the servers will close, what we'll do? Lost 100$ for a game that is not even worth 2$ that we won't even be able to play anymore?I'm not pre-purchasing games from Ubisoft anymore, I got my lesson, thanks Ubisoft and congratulations.Seriously, If I could get a refund I would ask for a refund right now.Now I'm stuck with an horrible game to finish.I thought that this game would be so great, I'm really disappointed to be honest.It could have been a really great game.2/10 (I can't give it more than 2, I'm not even sure if it does deserve 2 to be honest).The 6/10 review is way too good, a 6/10 game is a under-average game and this game is far but really far away from that.Facts are facts.This game is crap, it's not a simulation, do not believe those idiotic morons who says that this game feels like a simulation one, it's pure arcade, the problem is not that this is an arcade game, the problem is a that it is a really, but really bad arcade game.It feels like a Pay2Win game (or spend a lot, but a lot of time grinding for crap) that I have paid 110$ for.Of course I'm done pre-purchasing games, from any developers, developers and publishers are cancer nowadays, the only game I am glad I pre-purchased even If i didn't not play it alot back then, was the Witcher 3 because it has content, the price was okay and it doesn't have crappy greedy "we're too incompetent and brainless, we need your money, feed us with your money, we're w**res" microtransactions.People who pre-purchased the game (such as me, not pre-ordering any Ubisoft or EA Games never again, never did with Activision, Treyarch and Infinity Ward) paid 110$ for this piece of trash that required you to be online 24/7 if you want to play, the season pass is not worth **** and the game is made by a bunch of pathetic incompetents, we barely got any content and we have to pay for crappy "expansions" that should be in the season pass since we got barely anything off it.We paid 40$+ for a few cars... Okay? And we have to pay for the crappy expansions wannabe that should have been in the season pass in the first place?Damn it Ubisoft, you're worse than I thought, you have no limit to your dumbness, pathetic greedness, you are easily in the top of the worse developers ever, probably worse kind of human too? You don't kill innocent people, that's it, at least, that's a start but you ♥♥♥♥ them up with such bullcrap. And you except us to buy more of your games?Right, even some brainless dudes can dream I guess.Like always, they're lying, they says that there's more than 100 cars on this game but there is NOT, it's just different variations (dirt, street, raid, etc). You can't say that there's more than 100 vehicles, that's just bu**sh** and you know it, one lie after another, Ubisoft are the best at it.The driving is horrible, the handling is horrible.The physics are simply horrible, the physics were better in many 2000 racing games than in this one for fu**'s sake.Microtransactions on a 110$ game.The cops catch you way too fast (you stop for a second and you are already under arrested, that is not realistic at all).After finishing a challenge, It brings a screen with your score and stuff but if you have cops after you then you'll get arrested and you can not do anything about it.They sell DLCs that should come free with the game, let's be honest, anyone with gray matter and who know how a computer works can make meshes and textures, animations are more complicated but if you spend the time learning, you'll be able to do something way better than what those morons at Ubisoft did.There's not many vehicles and they all feel the same but with different speed.Microtransactions on a 110$ game.Now they sell an expansion that people who bought the season pass should have for free.I could say a lot more but I'll stop here, well done Ubisoft, well done, you are seriously pathetic and your name is the definition of "greed" and "incompetent".Wait, did I said that this game has mother♥♥♥♥ing transactions? Because there is.In my case, he only reason to keep playing this game, It's because I paid 110$ for this crap so better make it worth it even if the game is in all honesty, sh**.And it will probably be too late in a few years when they will close the servers, will they add a offline mode? Seriously, I doubt it, we're talking about Ubisoft after all, a bunch of brainless, worse than headless chickens, ****oles.I'm always straight when it comes to facts.Save yourself some money and do not buy this game, they're probably going to close the servers way before 2018 and they probably won't even add an offline mode, if they do, then I'll be impressed and they'll deserve an award for being somehow competent.This game should be free to play, seriously, just stay away from it.The question would be... Which one is the worse? EA Games, Ubisoft or Activision/Treyarch/Infinity Ward?This question is giving me a headache...And now most of the developers follows them.Where is all of this going? I love video games, I really do but it should just stop, no more producing, or at least, not from incompetents such as those, it should be illegal for them to make any games.Sorry not sorry if you love Ubisoft, it's all about the facts, I don't know how you can like them after all what they've done, perhaps 19 years ago, when they started but not today, they're just bad.Are there even bots in this game? That roams freely like in Test Drive? All I see is humans, sometimes, there are like two players, no bots.I don't know if this game has bots or not but it doesn't seems like it, which would be pretty stupid since a way older game has them and they were pretty good, sometimes, you thought they were humans.Seriously, just go play Test Drive Unlimited, it's a way better game, it may have a few flaws and not the best handling ever but does this game even has a good handling? Not at all, not even average.Heck, even Test Drive Unlimited 2 is better than this.I'll be waiting for my offline mode with bots, If i don't get them, you can be sure I won't be buying any of your games ever again Ubishit.

												This game was quite a letdown, to be honest.The physics are awful, every car handles like it is front-wheel-drive, any collision will send you into either a cutscene, or will shove you into oblivion, Traffic will spawn randomly causing more collisions and annoying cutscenes,The story is flimsy at best,Objectives are repetitive,Map is large, but sparsely populated with cities, and the cities that do exist in game are much smaller than they should be.Police chases lack any real substance (all they do is follow)Lack of carsLack of customizationThe customization that the game does include feels like it came straight out of F&F The Crew almost feels like it should have been released about 10 years ago with NFS: Most Wanted, because that is exactly what this game reminds me of.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
The Crew ReviewWARNING: My opinions are just opinions, nothing more. Do not just buy this game because I said so, look at it overall and ask yourself if you want it.Side Note A lot of people are saying that they keep getting disconnected from Ubisoft servers because of Ubisoft. They are lying. Ubisoft have fixed most, if not all connection bugs on their side. It is just their internet, if you have a solid internet connection, you will be able to play with hardly any interruptions at all.SummaryThe Crew is an open world MMO for racing. Sounds familiar, no? If you liked Test Drive Unlimited, you will most hopefully like this. It has a variety of cars, and what with a few DLC's and the new expansion pack 'Wild Run' coming out (more on that later) soon enough, this game will have you playing for quite a few hours either racing through the story, or taking a leisurely cruise through the Mountain States.Features- 30+ cars- 5 regions: each different from one another.- 5 different specifications: Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, Circuit, 3 to be added: Drift, Monster and Dragster.- Short story, so you can get down to the pure racing and cruising- 8 player sessions, 9/10 times you are paired with your friend's session.- Lots of ways to make money.- Game will look beautiful, thanks to the new overhaul made by the Wild Run (17 November)ConsSome parts of this game can be enough to put some people off. For example, if you're looking for a deep storyline, MASSIVE amounts of players to mess around with and races with great AI, this game is not for you. However, lets face it. 32 cars all driving around in the same vicinity would take a beating on your PC (unless you have around 2 grand to play with). Also, this game will force uPlay on you. Not necessarily bad, just thought I should point that out. (Some people HATE uPlay).TL:DRLong story short, don't let people tell you its bad and then never play it. That's what the demo is for. Play the demo, see if you like it, and if you do, then go ahead, buy it and have fun. Think of this game as a successor to Test Drive Unlimited. After all, it was designed by the same people.Rating9/10 ★★★★★★★★★

number of helpful: 3 of 4 people (75%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 22, 2015
												Recommended for %75+ discount price, for its base price it absolutely does not worth it! ( i also bought it on sale that is why i gave it a "recommended" )This review is from someone who is not a racing or sports fan at all but my all time favourite racing game which actually got me into trying some racing games is Need for Speed Most Wanted 2005:The Crew is a bit close to NFSMW 2005 since it has a story line + car tuning + cop chases + helicopter supports and different type of racing methods such as circuit or just a straight racing line or just like NFS 2005 time trials in addition it also has "Raid" and "Dirt" racing too which completely makes it different than other racing games. story line is not that good or amazing it is just there to help you progress faster and unlock more stuff before you jump into multiplayer so do not expect an amazing ending or something totally unique.Pros:- a complete racing game for those who want to experience every type of racing methods in one game.- handling the car can be really realistic if you put it on hardcore, unlike NFS it is much harder to handle the car here it is more realistic.- perks which can help you to finish the game easier.- good online compared to other UBI games this one is one of the few games which has a good online, COOP is really nice if you are stuck in a mission just find someone to do COOP with it is alot easier to pass the campaign missions in the COOP than solo.- huge map and a lot of different areas to test your car in.- different tones of online game modes which can be selected by voting before the match starts.Cons:- if you have a wireless gamepad your game detects it as driving wheel and therfore keys dont work properly at all.- sometimes you need to restart the game completley to avoid some minor bugs such as not showing a friend online or in your crew when they join you.- for a $60 game there is too much cut out contents being sold as DLC, for example the biggest joke is all Mercedes cars in this game are DLC none of them can be unlocked without paying real money which is a shame for a $60 game.- some missions are extremly stupidly designed specially the raid ones. they have no racing feeling at all and in some of them yu have to drive in middle of trees at night so you crash a lot and it is really really annoying.- not all cars can be tuned to what you want, the tuning is just a side option in this game it is not actually tuning like in NFS 2005, you have nearly no options for tuning your car except accepting what game forces you to buy for the missions.- finding a multiplayer match is so hard, first you need to search automatically for a game and as long as not enough players are found the lobby wont get started, when it does players have to vote for what type of game mode and race they wanna play, you can not select what game mode you want before searching so you exactly get what you want. you select what you want in the lobby and so do other players so if you are lucky you get what you want if not then you have to play what others want.- you can not test your favourite car in every race you want as most of the cars do not have much tuning options for Raid and Dirt. for example if your car is aston martin you can only play it in "performance missions" if a mission is dirt or street you have to use a street car and aston martin can not be tuned for any other race than "performance".- for a 2014 game i was expecting a lot better graphics for this game but sadly only cars are really detailed and well designed people and the city enviroment have the graphics of GTA back in 2000s. Cutscenes are nearly like a movie they are really detailed well designed and really high quality but game its self is absolutly awful for a 2014 game.- cop chases are really really stupid and they can be EASILY avoided. road blocks are a joke only one car in the road block and helicopter always runs out of fuel so fast and returns to base so you are safe from air recon. your car is 1000x times faster than police cars they never reach you and you can clearly see this in every escape mission you can avoid them under 20 seconds and win the mission. i personally never got arrested in this game by cops but in NFS 2005 i think at least 30000 times i was being arrested by cops.- crashing physics is really stupid and unreleastic somtimes. you can avoid a hard crash and sometimes by even a small scratch your car gets messed up, it is really random.

												Well this is the 2nd time i bought The Crew becuase EA delayed their NFS 2015 for PC, and i need to fullfill my Racing Game addiction so i bought this game again. Because this is the only decent Arcade Racer game yet on pc, and im sure when NFS out on PC it will knock the♥♥♥♥♥♥out of this game :DShort Review: Good Story and Large map to play with + BIKES!! , Lack of Cars + Bad car Costumization. So get this game only when it goes on Sale, i dont recommend you to buy it at full price,Now for Pros and Cons:+ Preety good story that can keep you playing for 1 week just for the stories. I say this because i have completed the story for 2nd time and it still enjoyable :D+ Large map you can travel across USA and it takes roughly 30-50 minutes to travel from Chicago to Miami. Imagine going from side to side :D Really fun for cruising around good scenery.+ Have diffrent kind of weather, like Rain, Snow, Thunderstorm, Sunny. If they add Tornadoes it would be so cool!+ Monster Trucks, Dragster and Drift spec, Lovin It!+ BIKES makes your game more easier to beat hahahaha+ Decent graphic after the Wild Run update.Now for the cons:- Bad costumization option.- Lack of Japanese car and some old European cars. Too much supercars here.- PVP not so good right now, but still enjoyable though.- Online feature in this game still kinda meh. Like Crew feature is kinda useless here which is they promised to #NeverDriveAlone but for me its #AlwaysDriveAlone.So you may ask "Do you Recommend it?" then My answer is, If you REALLY REALLY want to play an Arcade Racer then get this game. Becaus its currently the decent Arcade racer game you can get for PC right now, When NFS released i wont recommend you to get this game tho.

content:
Posted: November 7, 2015
The Crew ReviewWARNING: My opinions are just opinions, nothing more. Do not just buy this game because I said so, look at it overall and ask yourself if you want it.Side Note A lot of people are saying that they keep getting disconnected from Ubisoft servers because of Ubisoft. They are lying. Ubisoft have fixed most, if not all connection bugs on their side. It is just their internet, if you have a solid internet connection, you will be able to play with hardly any interruptions at all.SummaryThe Crew is an open world MMO for racing. Sounds familiar, no? If you liked Test Drive Unlimited, you will most hopefully like this. It has a variety of cars, and what with a few DLC's and the new expansion pack 'Wild Run' coming out (more on that later) soon enough, this game will have you playing for quite a few hours either racing through the story, or taking a leisurely cruise through the Mountain States.Features- 30+ cars- 5 regions: each different from one another.- 5 different specifications: Street, Dirt, Performance, Raid, Circuit, 3 to be added: Drift, Monster and Dragster.- Short story, so you can get down to the pure racing and cruising- 8 player sessions, 9/10 times you are paired with your friend's session.- Lots of ways to make money.- Game will look beautiful, thanks to the new overhaul made by the Wild Run (17 November)ConsSome parts of this game can be enough to put some people off. For example, if you're looking for a deep storyline, MASSIVE amounts of players to mess around with and races with great AI, this game is not for you. However, lets face it. 32 cars all driving around in the same vicinity would take a beating on your PC (unless you have around 2 grand to play with). Also, this game will force uPlay on you. Not necessarily bad, just thought I should point that out. (Some people HATE uPlay).TL:DRLong story short, don't let people tell you its bad and then never play it. That's what the demo is for. Play the demo, see if you like it, and if you do, then go ahead, buy it and have fun. Think of this game as a successor to Test Drive Unlimited. After all, it was designed by the same people.Rating9/10 ★★★★★★★★★

content:
Posted: January 19, 2015
												I cannot reccomend this game in its current state. It's in a obvious beta form, which is unthinkable given how there were 3 open betas before release. It's like Ivory Tower has never made a driving game before. And it IS a driving game, not a racing game. It's all variations of 'point-a-to-point-b' in this game, unless you're being chased by the police or a gang. The AI racers rubberband incredibly badly, the AI police/gang chase vehicles are moving brick walls that can go faster than you on any terrain and can only be outrun through sheer luck. Totally unplayable to people who don't min/max. Sometimes in Freeroam a cop will glitch out and try to arrest you, even though you don't have a wanted level (though him ramming you will cause you to gain one soon enough). The car handling model is hellishly bad when the car is low level and either fun but challenging or boring as hell at high levels depending on the car. The graphics are outdated and has a fair share of bugs. The antialising (aka the anti-pixelation stuff) is pretty much nonexistent, which makes areas with lots of foliage an eyesore. The instances flat out don't work. You can't ever connect to friends or even your crew once you've moved out of the instance you met in, unless you get rematched together out of sheer luck. PvP isn't balanced at all. If you crash once, you lose. If you don't have a fully-specced supercar, you lose. Simple. Money is attained primarily through a system wherein people on your friends list can be used as ammo to start a 3-hour timer to do faction missions in order to get 1/4 the award of the normal payout. All other moneymaking is completely moot.  The endgame is an interminable grind to max out your favorite cars whilst also micromanaging the above-mentioned grinding system. The cars are not very varied- the majority are american muscle cars and random supercars, with a few european tuners here and there. The car parts system is not very well explained (what each part do, etc.) and boring as hell, especially given how to get the best parts you must gring the same jump, speed or hill climb 'skills' for around twenty minutes each for each part for each car. Alternatively, you can spend money to buy parts you unlock for one car for the rest of the same spec. This costs a lot of bucks (ingame cash) but not much crew credits (microtransaction money). Hm...Visual customization is pretty varied for each car but you can't ever equip the stock parts of the Fullspec vehicle. Annoying.Specs are not well thought out. Circuit, Perf and Street are all for road driving in descending order of effectiveness. There's no downside to using a circuit over a perf or a perf over a street. Just straight upgrades. Dirt and Raid could have been rolled into one without an issue (Raid goes better off road, dirt goes better on dirt roads). The story is one of the worst I have ever seen, with extremely cardboard characters and a boring revenge plot that has a totally contrived happy ending and no direction whatsoever. Attempts to be heartwarming or funny fell flat, except for one occasion that made me crack a smile; one Chinese 'Vaas' expy in big debt once enthusiatically said simply 'Money money money money money!' to remind me to do a mission to help him.Story missions are cookie-cutter from something like four or five types but with arbitrary additions, i.e. a 'A-to-B' (they actually call them that) could be 'don't take damage' or 'you've got a time limit' or 'you have to escape pursuit before you reach the destination', often without even any in-story justification. Sometimes an NPC will be in the car, giving you an infodump that you probably won't pay attention to while you haul♥♥♥♥♥trying to complete the objectives. Or maybe they'll just yell at you every time you bump something using the same three lines. Ubisoft and Ivory Tower failed on every count reguarding this game. This is despite the Betas and the fact that we know Ubisoft knows how to make a good racing game from Driver: SF. It's incredible how bad this game is. I only play it because I want to get my $85's worth, and I'm hoping they'll fix most of these issues in due time. Knowing Ubisoft, it'll just be more DLC and mircrotransactions, but just maybe...TL;DR This game has literally every bad element of every bad driving game ever. Don't buy it.

Posted: February 9, 2015
												This game has a lot of potential.  The biggest problem I have is the AI is ridiculously overpowering when running from police.  They are like tanks that accelerate faster than any car you can buy.  They will push you right off the road but are impossible to be moved or budged themselves.    Also, the handling on some of these cars is whack.  Not so bad that the game can't be played, and I really like the game even with the ridiculously hard to kill cops.  There aren't very many people playing this game, dare I say 'yet'?  This game seems to be one of those game where you buy it and get hooked, and then they start releasing more stuff at extra charges.  It'd be nice someone made a complete game before they sold it to people.All in all, I like the game, and will keep playing, but only because I've already got it.
