content:
Posted: January 12, 2015
												This game had a lot of potential, but in the end its just a giant failure.Graphics: The game looks really nice and runs pretty smoothly when other players arent near you, i am able to maintain a constant 50-60 FPS, my system stays cool and i dont get stuttering too often unless im driving over 200 MPH. The enviroment is attractive and makes exploring the huge map even more worthwhile, the waters not the most attractive but its not an issue since you should be spending most your time staring at the road or the cars.Customization: Theres enough to make your car unique and the game allows every spec to be different so your car can look completly different in street then it does in performance. However Raid and Cicuit spec have almost no custumization available and dirt spec is sometimes lacking as well. Also higher end cars ussually have less then cheaper cars meaning aventadors and vipers ussually look identical while mustangs and camaros can be heavily customized.Map: Its large, it takes about 30-60 mins to to drive between 2 major areas (ex. Detroit to Miami, Maine to Texas, NY to LA) mostly highway averaging around 160MPH. Most areas look pretty accurate and you can ussually guess where you are if you have seen the place in real life, however many areas are located FAR from where they should be and some are sized quite oddly, for example Salem MA is up in Maine and Miami is most of florida.Cars: This is one area where the game fails miserably, while it does have some great cars the balance is horrible and very unrealistic, mini cooper is one of the fastest cars in the game, bentley continental outruns sklyine gtrs and vipers with no issues, no point buying an expensive dirt spec since the ford focus is pretty much the best for dirt, mustangs are faster, better handling, and have better traction then the 370z, the murcielago feels like its on ice all the time ect. Many cars cant be put into specs that make perfect sense to be available, most supercars cant be circuit, f150 cant be raid spec, golf gti cant be anything but street spec, high end cars can ussually only be performance spec and thats it. AI uses vehicles in specs that you cant for example circuit spec trucks, Some cars are just pointless like the golf gti and  jeep cherokee, and others are so expensive its not worth getting since there are faster cars for half the price. Also when theres only about 30 cars in the game why would you have 4 lamborghinis, 4 mustangs, 3 Trucks and 2 SUVS, 2 camaros, and 2 chargers, but not include any hondas, mitsubishis,porches or toyotas and leave out cars like the suburu impreza and lancer evo despite how well they would work for street and dirt spec.Driving: Suprisingly the game worked perfectly with my g27 racing wheel as well as an xbox controller without needing any configuring or calibration(other then turning driving assists off). It has a lot of options for adjusting force feedback, steering deadzone and sensitivity making it easy to get a comfortable set up as well. Unfortanetly despite good settings the game feels very unrealistic, collisions never make sense sometimes you go flying 1000ft into the air other times you bounce off like nothing happened, other times a bump at 10MPH totals your car, some cars spin out randomly for no reason, traction is terrible for some cars, theres no difference between FWD, RWD or 4WD , for some cars the game handles very arcadey much like an old need for speed game where you can just drift sideways through a corner without slowing, other cars you NEED to brake before a corner like you would in a simracer. Also if you play manual transmission on a controller expect to be heavily disadvantaged since the only way to reverse is to shift all the way down to 1st, then down to nuetral then into reverse and theres a forced pause between every shift so you cant just drop two gears quickly.Online: Honestly, dont even bother. For one the game has no level scaling so all pvp is mixed together meaning a lv 300 f150 will be expected to race lv 1299 (max lv) lamborghinis and vipers. PVP is very buggy and laggy cars teleport 500yds ahead of you, cars lag into you causing you to crash, and disconects are very common, back on track feature sometimes places people far ahead of where they were, and sometimes you can clearly finish in 2nd only to have the game tell you you finished in 4th. PVP is also full of hackers and the developers dont seem to care, expect to see a lot of people with infinate nos, 300MPH cars, invincible cars that dont get slowed or moved when rammed into and even some people who just instantly win the race shortly after it starts. even if you do get a match without hackers or terible lag its boring since everyone only chooses highway races in performance spec with traffic off and then everyone is in either an aventador, bentley, or one of the free cars from the season pass, ive never seen a pvp in dirt, street or raid spec, ive only found a couple of circuit specs, and ive only seen about 10 of the 30 cars in the game in pvp. Outside of PVP the other players on the map can be really annoying, you will probably never see them while dirving around exploring but go to a skill challenge and expect 5 people to telaport there after you and start parking in the way or even trying to ram you off the road for no reason.AI: the AI cheats...A LOT. doesnt matter what car your in or how fast your going the ai will be faster, cops will catch your 250MPH ford GT in a crown victoria, ram your Hummer H1 off the road easily without damaging their own car, cops can arrest you if your driving below 40MPH for more then 3 seconds and they teleport to your position sometimes if your escaping. Races against ai can be really annoying because the game decides to tell you that you were in 3rd place despite finishing 1 mile ahead of the 2nd place guy, the AI will teleport miles ahead in a race sometimes and you cant ram them off the road but they so much as bump you and your sent flying off the road.Multiplayer: The games really fun to play with friends however i played the whole story mode with a friend and we did all but 3 mission at least twice due to the game disconecting one of us after winning and not giving us credit for completing it on almost  EVERY SINGLE RACE.Overall: Its a fun game to play with friends, tons to explore, cars are expensive so theres a lot of farming to do, plenty of acheivments, skill challenges and multi hour races if your a completionist, however its a mess of flaws, bugs, cheating AI, lag, disconects after races, and the pvp is honestly by far the worst pvp i have ever played.

content:
Posted: December 19, 2014
												Score: 80	 Author: geekl33tgamer	 Test Drive Unlimited Reddux?http://www.geekl33tgamer.co.uk/reviews/198-the-crew-reviewFrom the outset, the core concept of the game seems very appealing to anyone who has ever picked up a copy of any recent Need for Speed title, or the poorly executed (but great idea) Test Drive Unlimited game. Here we have a huge sprawling online world, filled with literally thousands of players, all going about their own thing with a Need for Speed and Burnout inspired driving model.The games career play is a very cinematic affair, and within the first few minutes of starting the game you’ll soon start to understand how this game’s style will play itself out. You start off with some cut-scenes of a chase which you get thrown into, this is basically your tutorial. You need to race to the checkpoint marker whilst keeping the vehicle pointing in the general direction. It was certainly a very entertaining start to a game if ever there was one.You get taken to a garage, meet some key characters who set the scene for the plot in the career play, and you need to buy a car. To begin, you only have a selection of 4 cars to buy, and once you have chosen one your given brief tutorials to the tuning system, car upgrades, perk points and such. There’s not a lot you can buy at this stage, but it’s handy to remember where these things are for later when you have enough cash.You then begin your journey, working undercover for the FBI whilst infiltrating the 510 car faction. So as not to spoil it for anyone, we shall not go on any further about the plot within The Crew as may are still playing through it, or may not have purchased it yet.When you have a required first few events of the tutorial / prologue out the way, you are free to play The Crew however you wish. You can crack on with the career play, or so exploring. This is where you get your first look at the seemingly huge map that you have to play in. It is littered with icons of all the events you can do, your friends positions are shown as well as the major cities.Our first thoughts were that the map is very, very large – however we quickly found out that it isn’t. Despite appearing large, we can drive from the east coast to the west in a little over an hour. Missions as you play them will move you over most of it, but we felt a little disappointed it wasn’t as expansive as the map from Test Drive Unlimited for example. It doesn’t feel too small neither, but isn’t as unwieldy as it first appears to be.As you explore the world, between events on literally every road are skill events you can just drive into at full speed to activate a mini-challenge. This helps break up the monotonous task of driving long distances between places, and gives you extra cash to spend in-game as well as car parts and experience points. Once you’ve explore enough areas, the game has a fast travel feature so you can easily jump back to anywhere you’ve previously been. If you discover the airports and train stations, you can also use these.The major US cities litter the map, and the world is busy with jots of NPC traffic filling up the places. The cities never really feel big enough, but we understand the compromises that they had to make here to a point. Each city has a unique vibe and appearance. The mountain sections look particularly impressive, as does the games day and night cycle. It creates a great environment overall.There are 4 cars to start with, but you can purchase any of the others as you discover new garages on the map. New garages unlock new classes of cars, but for a car game the total amount of cars we counted was only 45. We know Ubisoft plan to add more (with a season pass, sold extra), but the amount in the game does seem disappointing.Of the cars that are in there, they are nicely replicated visually. Each car you buy can be upgraded and tuned into different cars to suit your environment or event. Almost all the cars can be upgraded to street spec, performance, track, dirt and raid classes. The latter 2 are heavy duty modifications that make your car great off road, while the others lend themselves well to road racing. You can customize most visual areas of the car, upgrade its engine parts, and add decals. It adds enough to the car customization to make the cars to make them feel like they are personally yours, but the tuning options do not go deep enough for some. The upgrade parts are fixed, so you can buy varying grades of better brakes, or a differential, but you can’t tweak them if you wanted to say shift the brake bias forward.Perhaps the limiting of the granularity in the tuning area is deliberate so the game is more accessible. We don’t mind it as it does offer enough, but I know from speaking to players while racing, some were not happy with it. They equally wasn’t thrilled by the cars handling model. It is very much in the arcade category, but we expected that. It makes the game enjoyable to zoom around and have fun without needing to pay too much attention to corner entry lines and braking – Instead you can hone your skills on seeing how high you can jump off the ski-slope for example.Now, this is perhaps the game’s biggest selling point, and in Ubisoft’s own words they say “You’ll never drive alone”. I need to make it clear from the get go that this game does not have all the Uplay problems that come with Watch Dogs at launch, or any of the other recent titles released – However there are still problems.We had no problems getting into the servers on launch day, despite the large surge of traffic, but the connection reliability has been ropy from time to time while playing. Without any warning whatsoever, if your connection drops for even a second, you’re returned to your desktop with an error message about the servers not being reached. That is coupled with the fact that every time it does this, some of your game progress gets lost. When you re-load the game, you will invariably find yourself many miles from where you actually were when it threw you out. This unfortunately happens with varying frequency, but it is something they are aware of so we hope it improves.Another widely touted feature was the ability to form a Crew on the fly from either your friends or others who are in the world with you. Crews are important to help with the co-op options available in most missions – Some are quite difficult to do on your own, so pulling in others is an easier way to beat that one mission you may have been stalled on.Sadly, we encountered several problems with this that could easily take up most of this review. We had problems adding friends into Uplay first off, and getting the game to recognize them in the game so I could add them. All too often friends in Uplay would not appear within the game itself. When they did, getting them added to the crew is simply an exercise of luck. Constant errors and timeout’s hampered forming a Crew on the fly as intended, and I found myself driving around by myself a lot of the time as a result. It’s currently near impossible to add players who are in a different country to yourself too, and this frustrate me further.As a final nail in the coffin where online play is concerned, if you have the game in Steam as we do, you can’t invite your Steam friends into a game at all. You need to ask your friend for their Uplay ID, try and add them and then go through the process above.I feel players who buy into the game expecting a racing simulator should steer well clear, but if Need for Speed and Burnout style games are your thing, we think you’ll love The Crew. We do.

												TL:DR9/10 Closed beta.  Awesome for casual and competetive racing. So the closed beta, what do i think.  First of let me state that i saw the trailer from e3 or whenever the game was presented for the first time, and I thought to myself; this looks like crap.  Who would want it?So iam sitting here, kinda bored and looking at games and The Crew Closed beta is up if I preorder.  Hmm, let me look at the reviews.  Read about 3 of em until someone says, i remindes of Midnight Club.  There i was sold.  I start it up and skip all of story and such.  After some races I get into freedrive. I get about an hour until i need to go.  Its okey. I hate my Mucle car.  Next day, let me get to a car dealer, pick up a Ford Focus. Spend all my money to upgrade it. And think lets roll.  Well the next 5 hours is a blur of streetraces, cops trying to kill me,  players trying to kill me and alot of jumpes.  I havent had this much fun in a car game since the last Midnight Club.  I think this game will be great, i certainly had alot of fun in the beta, and can not wait until realease.Pros-Huge World-Race Tracks-Hidden objects -The community (all the crazy drivers out there)-The car customaztion-Good "car driving" feel (not too realistic but hard)  (I played on the car setting of hardcore, do not know anything about the other settings)Cons-I fear the ingame microtransactions-Some bugs (like a tree in the middle of the railtracks)-Cops needs to care about speeding not just dmg to them or other cars-Beta was limited to 30 fps.  (get atleast 60)But for me this was a good 9 - 10/10

content:
Posted: October 17, 2015
												I bought this game while high yesterday and god damn was it a wrong purchase.The game seems like it would work pretty well, if it did so smoothly.Problem here is that the game is terribly optimised. On a high end rig that can easily support Arma 3, this game runs smooth but has a ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ of occasional framespikes which cause you to ram into something at high speeds.Now don't get me wrong; even when i was high i wasn't blind: i saw the game's description claiming it's ment for high-end PC's and next gen consoles, but that's just a very very weak way of saying "Our game doesn't even look that good but runs like♥♥♥♥♥♥ if you complain we'll blame it on your specs!".In reality the game itself looks very very meh. I've only played a couple of missions so far and from what i've seen the world is empty and very forced at looking alive.For example, you see the low res environment around you (and yes, it really does look ugly and different than the cars), and you realise it's just a HUGE big open map with forced events. You'll have a cop car race out an alley and stand there as if he's going to chase you, you'll have fake people driving around to create the illusion you're not in a boring old sandbox and you'll be reminded how bad the game really looks for the framerate lag you have to pull yourself through to compensate for it.Has a lot of potential but you'd need a 2000/3000€ pc to run this "like the publishers suggest".Which kind of just means they didn't feel like optimising this bad port and you are to blame for not having a better PC.Haven't gotten into the game that much but the driving is extremely simple and the physics are trash. I rammed into some cops at the opening sequence and proceeded to ram the fake players i encountered on my way from race to race, what i saw was my giant truck and my majestic american muscle car get twirled around like the physics engine went "What the ♥♥♥♥ bro this isn't my job i don't know what to do i'll just make♥♥♥♥♥♥spin or something".Really, really have no idea why i bought this game yesterday, but the "mostly positive" rating is misleading at best.My guess is that i wanted an open world racing game as if you'd play GTA 5 but with much better driving and focused on this.Nope, enjoy normal AI cars that have stupid nametags of random uplay accounts slapped above them, because that feels so real!Man i had more of a feeling of co-op driving when i was mimicing AI driving styles in GTA vice city.-Disclaimer-I don't have 0.4 hours in the game at the time of this review because the game barely runs. The game runs on 60FPS (capped at that), but it feels like it's poking you with a rapier every time you're trying to race by freezing your screen every once in a while even on low settings, this is a sign of poor optimisation.EditForced myself to play it a little more to get my money's worth (got it from a third party website), but the game seems to stutter and lag even more at lower settings and it is visually as attractive as a skinned rat.Looks like you're playing a ps2 port, plays like it's an ps6 port.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												So I'll start off with saying that this game was not at all what I expected. The little research I put into the game gave me the impression it was more of a Gran Tourismo/ Forza fell rather than the Need for Speed game that it is. The tuning system is very simple and easy to use. In regards to customizing performance there isn't any adjusting specific specifications. The entire system is based on "part 4" is better than "part 3" by xxx points. Simple and effective, just not what I expected.The games racing phsyics are probably my biggest complaint. It has a very arcade feel. Say there is a pebble in the road. We'll call it 'bob'. Say you hit bob on a run with your front left tire at +100mph plus. Bob may just nudge you a little bit causing you to have to steer and correct course. Another run you may clip the same bob at 40mph on your rear right and find your vehicle 30ft in the air while spinning like you were shot from a canon. Then your next run bob decides to take your front left tire at 80mph and throw you into a spin where you may travel over 50yards off road before being able to regain control. Now I love my wrecks but some sort of consistency in the games phsyics would be expected of a game title like this.  All in all the game is still fun. It even has a ton of acheivments to unlock, plenty of vehicles for your specific taste, visual customizations are abundant also. End game gameplay is fun and they offer various styles of events to enterain your mood what ever it is.I'll keep playing it so look for me in game. Always down for a pvp event.

number of helpful: 5 of 9 people (56%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 7, 2014
												I have played a lot of racing games from sims to arcade racers, and I have not found a better racing game. This game truely has it all; two tracks, bayous, jumps, cities, MILES upon MILES of roads. The scope is simply amazing. I have seen some people say that this game lacks detail because of the size, but I simply don't think thats true. Going through my neck of the woods (Michigan area) I can clearly see they nailed the look and feel of the state, and I think the pure size only enhanses the experience. As for the handling think heavy Need For Speed influence with maybe a hint of Burnout. Definitely not a game for the people who are simulation master race, more of a fun game for everyone else who just loves driving for the enjoyment. There is nothing more satisfying than logging in with some friends and just cruising across the Rocky Mountains or flying through the Vegas dunes, and thats why this game is so good.As for the bad, there isn't a whole lot. My main complaint would be with the AI being able to hang with you even if your car is rated over double theirs. However this makes the game more challenging, so its not really much of a con. Also the disabiling missions aren't very fun. They are all doable since the AI takes the same path every time, its just annoying the first time you hit them and they have 6 health and you have to chase them for 60 seconds only to love tap them and kill them.Pros:- Great arcade driving feel- Huge world- Cruising with your friends across AmericaCons:- AI rubber bands hard even if you have an insane car- The disabling missions aren't funOverall: 9.5/10Anyone who gives this game less than a 7 missed the point.

												Simple the most awesome and fun making car / racing game I have seen for PC for years.Even doing simple road trips is highly enjoyable. The cop chases are intressting and there a neat variation of race types.And the car personalisation is wonderful. There may some games with more visual costumization options but there also many that ignore the topic. You should have no trouble to get your car to your personal tastes.And then there the car list with is wonderful, there something for every taste in there and for diffrent type of driving as well. (On road, as well as offroad, there something for everyone).And ultimativly its a car game that has car interior view. How many other games are trying to avoid that for the sake of saving money and time?!In Short this game is just awesome, and if you like driving / racing and cars then this is defintly something you should consider to check out!

number of helpful: 60 of 118 people (51%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 25, 2014
												This is more of a first impression review of the game in the first day of the Closed Beta!In short: if you like to customise, an open world game, nice graphics and fun co-op/online this is the game for youPro's:- nice graphics- the handling is smooth (though this is more an opinion, also, expect arcade handling over realism)- various music genres (which i dislike when they stick to one genre, give something for everybody to choose; also, you can change between radio and sountrack in the options (if you want to add drama to your races)).- a HUGE open world driving- very social/competitive: you get constant updates whats going on around you, there are always players nearby- much custom, such wow: you can change appearance of your car (which doesn't affect it's performance). it's nothing in-depth (not sure if it will come in the final release) but there is plenty to choose from to make the car look like you want it to look.Cons:- buggy sometimes (i encounter some slight freeze (for 5s) when a race enters and i get swapped to the next screen))- (not really a con, but quite strange) the need for uplay (which loads quite easily together with the game)

												Strzelałem sie w Rosji,Polsce,Francji,Holandii czy innych Włoszech ale nigdy nie przejechałem całych Stanów Zjednoczonych wymarzonym samochodem.The Crew bo o tej grze mowa pozwala nam na przejechanie całych stanów zjednoczonych począwszy od Golfów kończąc na Ferrari. (Chyba ze golf sie rozpierdoli w połowie drogi).tzw "Ekipa" na polskie tłumaczenie wzbudza w graczu tylko 2 rodzaje emocji jednym z nich jest chęć podziwiania pięknych i urodziwych Stanów a drugim odczuciem jest wyjebanie tej gry gdzie raki zimują.Wszystko zostało spowodowane dodaniem "Wild Runa" przez co optymalizacja i strona wizualna gry leży i woła o pomste do nieba. (po co ulepszać coś jeśli jest dobre?)Teraz troche gadania o fabule a raczej o jej "duchu" niby mamy brata,dostaje kulke w plecy a my jako świadkowie chcemy dorwać tego skurwiela który to zrobił. Oklepane nie?Nadjechał problem sterowania którego w zasadzie nie ma... ale trzeba mieć na uwadze,że przy 300km/h i spotkaniu z bandą nasz samochód będzie mieć nas głęboko w dupie i pojedzie dalej jak gdyby nic sie nie stało a metrowe wgniecenie na masce to tylko wkurw graczy którzy sie tym oburzają.W tej grze mamy takie coś jak poziom samochodu który zdobywamy za wykonywanie czasem wkurwiająco nudnych i rozsianych po całej pierdolonej mapie jak krople deszczu w Angli o 12 w południe dzieki którym nasz Golfik czy inny wynalazek może cisnać więcej niż "fabryka mu dała" (max lvl to 1299)I o to całe The Crew zajebista gra lecz gydyby wild run nie spierdolił jej do samego końca mogła by być za jedną z lepszych gier z otwartym światem z samochodami w roli głownej.Podsumowując oceny dawać nie będe bo to nie ma najmniejszego pierdolonego sensu ale gre za 60 zł moge polecić w 100%

												This game is ♥♥♥♥ing wretched. I picked it up thinking it was a steal, with dreams of the old need for speed days in my head. First off, I expected some huge expansive enviroment. There are invisible ♥♥♥♥ing walls sectioning off all of the cool places, the cities are generic and small, and burning out in a cornfield is only fun for like 5 minutes.The story line is ♥♥♥♥ing garbage. Youre some weird♥♥♥♥♥ex-racer turned narc trying to avenge your ♥♥♥♥ing juice head brother and it doesnt even make sense. You have this weird ♥♥♥♥♥ who keeps ♥♥♥♥ing calling you all the time, even when your free roaming you hear her ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ voice; "DID YOU KNOW YOU CAN INVITE YOU FRIENDS! YOU SHOULD GO DO YOUR ♥♥♥♥ING MISSION!" SHUT THE ♥♥♥♥ UP YOU STUPID ♥♥♥♥♥ I HATE YOUR VOICE AND I DONT WANT TO DO A ♥♥♥♥ING MISSION!The handling feels like a ♥♥♥♥ing dead donkey's being dragged around by a snowplow. All cars feel like they came out of GTA IV. Like somebody spread butter all over the roads and squirted honey all over your wheels.The physics are♥♥♥♥♥♥and your car often glitches. This is really common, like, your car will teleport 10 feet when you hit a tree.They also try to rip off the cool burnout crash scenes, but the only cosmetic change that can happen to your car is the ♥♥♥♥ing bumper pops off. So you have to endure a 10 second scene of your ♥♥♥♥ing bumper popping off. Its so anticlimactic it cringes me out.The real nail in the ♥♥♥♥ing coffin for me was the ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ online. Its literally broken. ♥♥♥♥ UPLAY ♥♥♥♥ UPLAY ♥♥♥♥ YOUPLAY!MMO MY♥♥♥♥♥I cannot join my friend. We bought it together and I cannot join him no matter what. If we get real ♥♥♥♥ing lucky and get in a crew, one of us will DC right away. Its ♥♥♥♥ing broken.My favourite part is that when im trying to join him my personal helpful little ♥♥♥♥♥ narrator will remind me I can join my friends games.Just for the love of god, dont by this utter♥♥♥♥♥♥ Ive never written a  review before,  but I just had to after that aweful experience. This game is worth 5 dollars max, and it still wouldnt be fun.♥♥♥♥ ubisoft, ♥♥♥♥ uplay, ♥♥♥♥ the crew.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												I really want to love this game, I really do.But I'm just not feeling The Crew, on paper, this game seems amazing, maybe even one of the best racing games ever made. The idea is revolutionary.Too bad the gameplay is sub-par.The car handeling is just about the worst I've personally seen. Maybe I'm just used to the NFS/GRID series, I don't know. The cars just seem so weird, you either oversteer or understeer 75% of the time, I just don't feel it.The idea for a "Racing MMO" is fantastic. Sadly, I can't really take advantage of it, since I don't have any friends that currently own the game, I'm sure it's probably very fun with a few buddies.Just playing by myself, I got bored very quickly.In my opinion, this game has one of the worst prolouges I've ever played. The story itself isn't very original either.This game has/had a ton of potential, but I just don't see it at the moment. I'll try it out on the Xbox One.4/10

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												Big Game industry is full of hype. Don't believe what you see on the trailers, I tell ya! (..at least that's true in most cases)It's harder to know these days if the game is good or not. Many people get amped up by the hype of salesmans and their trailers with awesome music, superb graphics (which in many games  are from cutscenes and no actual gameplay) and all that stuff. Emotions sell. That has made me think a lot harder on what games to invest in.I thought about buying this game a couple of days, during which, I watched a lot of youtube early access videos, read some reviews and so on. And finally decided to buy it. I'm now very happy I did.Many times with big releases, there comes the feeling of money gone to waste. Not in this case. THIS GAME is, simply put, AWESOME!!Actually I can honestly say that it's the best racing game I've ever played. I really can't compare it to the good old racing games, because it's been so long. I was a hardcore carmageddon fan back when it was the new hot stuff. Also need for speed since the first game of the series, and enjoyed them very much with maybe one or two exceptions of the NFS series later releases. I also liked Flatout 1&2 very much and Gran Turismo 5 was my the only racing game on PS3 I played a lot. And thought bugbears new Next Car Game on PC looks good, it seems to be pretty much same the formula then Flatout2, just with minor upgrades and graphics upgraded ofc - nothing this major as we see on The Crew.I'm listing these just so that you know, what I'm rating this against, and what kind of driving games I usually enjoy.I haven't bumbed to games like that in a looong time and was starting to worry that they're gone extinct. Luckily my fears were unjustified. The Crew really delivers!The part I've read some critique is the phrase "never drive alone". Well, yeah, it's kinda true. There are lots of people online, but the time I've played, only one dude crewed up for a race without me asking first. But since I haven't been looking to form a crew yet, can't really complain about that. And I must say that the time flies with this game even if you play solo races. go exploring or just enjoy driving and leveling up. Also, it probably the launch is effecting to that too because I'd think that lots of people are busy leveling up their rides and exploring. And of course, people come and go and play at different times, on different timezone and so on.If you have 1-3 friends, who enjoy racing games and play a lot at similar times then you do, then think no further. I can't imagine how much fun this game can be if you play it with 1-3 IRL friends, with teamspeak ofc.Another thing, the world is HUGE. Also the terrain is done very well. Mountains feel like mountains. There are lots of racing tracks, like the legendary Pike's peak, some oval tracks and one of my favorite from Gran Turismo: Mazda's Laguna Seca raceway! And many others. You can naturally also go check Death Valley, Niagara Falls, Grand Canyon and so on.I've explored maybe 1/5 of the map in 12 hours, and I've done a lot of exploring during that time. If you think you might enjoy driving from coast to coast, it's going to take a long time to drive. Luckily there is an option to drop in at locations you've already been. Also it's possible to just take a plane and from NY to Las Vegas, and you're instantly teleported to the airport, if you don't care for joyriding cross the country.During the 12 hours I've played so far, the negative can be pretty much summed to the following:-Uplay.-3-4 server disconnects during 12 hours gameplay. But if they fix this, I think it's acceptable during the early stages. The server load must be huge. But still, it's a minus because company like Ubisoft should have the resources to host the game. Better to have some extra capacity going to waste during launch, then the other way around.-Uplay. I hate the fact that I have to run steam and Uplay at the same time-Some very minor bugs, that really haven't effected the gameplay, for me at least. The guide thingy that shows you where the waypoint is pointing, doesn't always follow the road. This happens rarely though and only with custom map markers. I also have to note that this has happened only couple times during my gameplay, and it's a very minor thing. I hope they fix it though.-Uplay. Steam doesn't show the people I've played with on uplay ofc, and every steam friend probably has different nickname on uplay. Makes connecting more complicated.-The cars feel a bit rigid/stiff and slow at start, but once you get to lvl10 or so - you'll get there fast - they start to show some character. 12 hours in and I'm near lvl20 though I've done lots of exploring. I would guess that the leveling gets slower though, when you get to higher levels. -Season pass/DLC. But this time it feels that I will be getting something for the money, unlike watch dogs for example. I of course don't like to spend 20€ for 12 cars and a bit of content, but as an OVERALL, I think this game is worth the combined price of the game + the season pass. And I can't think of another Ubisoft game I could say the same.-Car damage could have been done better, in my opinion. I don't know if it's me, but if you crash a car to a brick wall @ 300+ km/h, something should happen (other then the cosmetic fender flying off, and then we go again). Stuff that happened in Flatout2 for example. Wheels flying. Cars being torn apart. Driver flying through the window. That kind of stuff. Or something towards that. That's how I feel about this, others might disagree since it is more towards arcade game. Still, maybe they could have implemented a toggle switch for that for those players who want more car damage.-Cop cars sometimes way too overpowered. they will catch you with their normal cars weather you're driving on road or on corn field. Sometimes this makes very nice getaway races though, but more then half ot the time it's a bit ridiculous when you're going 280km/h and your car is like a huge magnet for cop car(s) to ram into.CONCLUSION: 9/10 (might change this as I get more time into the game, but for now)AFTERTHOUGHTS:Me being on steam for years, and this being the first review I've ever written should say something of this game.But to be absolutely clear: If you have ever liked racing games like NFS series, Flatout and racing in general and have the hardware to run this game, definitely buy this one. I was positively suprised how well my PC runs this game (a single GTX770,  Phenom II X4 940BE (3.5Ghz) cpu and 8gb RAM). And the settings are pretty high.PS. Sorry for typos and spelling errors, english not being my native language.

number of helpful: 6 of 11 people (55%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 25, 2015
												Boring, braindead game. This game becomes extremely trivial once you upgrade your vehicle at least +50 from race requirement, and this isn't hard to do. Game can be completed with just your starter vehicle, there's hardly any incentive to buy  a new vehicle unless it's something that catches your eyes (and you can afford it) or its practical and covers all 5 Upgrades. You do not get a great sum of cash income at all. I've spent probably $4k (Crew Bucks) in total for cosmetic items like paint, bumpers and rims. By the time I finished the game I had 300K. Which can barely get you♥♥♥♥♥♥all. The Crew can easily be completed around 14Hrs if you just tunnel vision your way through story mode - While upgrading your vehicle on the go. Getting to max level (50) took me around about 10hrs. The Crew's story it self was trash. It's not interesting it makes barely any sense and it's really not worth paying attention to at all. You'll often be questioning the choices made by writers who wrote the story. The game does showcase key-parts to cities well, it isn't exactly to real size, however it does take in the important parts to places within USA. Performance wise, it ran well on my PC on high and with 60FPS cap on (Note you can apply this within game setting - initial install its locked on 30FPS). Sometimes frames dipped within motion blur and unnecessary police red. blue light flashing on border of screen, but majority of the time i had a solid 60. Honestly this game is decent at best, if you want a braindead game that can be slightly enjoyable and relaxing at times. But you will get bored easily. Main reasons i pressed No to recommend game as it felt incredibly empty, boring and overall did not fill my expectations when I saw trailer for this ages back. You will 90% time be on your own and rarely EVER come across anyone online. IF you ARE keen on buying this though, do recommend buying on sale - not at full price.

number of helpful: 7 of 13 people (54%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: July 18, 2015
												This game panders to anyone who has never played a racing game in their life. Super arcade style physics. Like more arcade feeling than Need for Speed. You can be going 200+ miles an hour and handbrake drift around a 90 degree corner with great ease. Worse than that, hitting the wall and other players in corners actually makes you go FASTER than traditional braking. All the cars feel the same and have very similiar, if not identical handling. The handling of cars is very boring. They all feel like I am piloting a hovercraft that has better side to side movement rather than a car that takes turns and corners in lines. The controls are unresponsive to a point of feeling like a beta free-to-play game. The graphics look like they were built on an engine about 7 years old. The music is all whiney and or emo sounding alternative rock. The user base is very rude and anti-social. The story line is uttelry absurd and stolen from Need for Speed "Most Wanted". Unlocking items and upgrades for your car requires entirely too much time and effort. If the person you are racing crashes into traffic or rams into a corner it doesen't matter because they just use NOS to get back to speed. The game has a very juvenile vibe in general. The only saving throw this game has is a large open world to explore.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												As usual there are pros and cons in this game.Pros: - Good looking graphic- Very detailed environment and cars (the environment feels alive, even if you set it on low)- Great game mechanism (leveling up)- Very optimized game engine- Good on steering wheel (Logitech Driving Force GT) Cons:- Not good on controller and keyboard (i thought this is an arcade game?)- Difficulty is a bit tough especially on the hit and run type of mission (not enjoying, more to stress)- You can't change difficulty- Some issues with connection, during car selection on the board the screen will freeze and lost connection (happened to me for now)(edit) - If you have max your level which is on level 50, you will not received any skill points. Instead you have to buy using crew credits (cc) if you don't have cc you need to buy it using real money. This is stupid.- The prize money you received in game is very little in amount, so you have to wait longer to buy lamborghini or ferrari but if you're impatient you have the option to buy crew credits in order to buy cars without waiting (to me this is a little bit unfair, because people have already paid for the game and you need to pay more in order to buy cars in-game because some people could not afford to buy the crew credits because they have spend it on the game itself)Overall verdict:I recommend this game to those who like cars and exploration type of game. Who enjoys playing with friends and strangers, competitive driving and enjoy site seeing in their dream car on a virtual world. The issue for me is that, the difficulty for this type of game is kinda difficult. It is suppose to be an arcade game, people supposed to enjoy not stress when doing story line missions (especially during the hit and run mission). The fact that you can't change the difficulty is stupid to me. It reminds me of Midnight Club Los Angeles, how hard it is to win races, you have to be focus and not able to enjoy it. It put my stress level high. The next thing is that you can't control the car properly on a straight line if you use controller or keyboard, it is utterly impossible to corner and keeping the car on a straight line. This is an arcade game, ivory tower should make the car controllable on any gaming peripherals (keyboards, controllers and steering wheels). I hope that they fix the control issue and also the difficulty settings, let the customer or user choose their own settings.(Edit) this is my second thoughts on this game 6/10 for me. I hate the internet connection issues. #0_24, #0_34, #0_1..i mean what the?. They should have fix these problems before launching the game. Apart these issues i have no problem.

content:
Posted: December 5, 2014
												Think Need for Speed: Most Wanted combined with Fuel. Think Test Drive Unlimited combined with Driver: San Francisco. Think Need for Speed: World combined with Burnout Paradise. Think…ehh, you get the point. If any of the games I’ve listed so far tickle your fancy, or even combinations of them, then The Crew might be for you.The game has its quirks and its rough patches, but it is generally an alright game. The story is bland, the graphics could be a smidge better, the car handling takes time to get used to, and the claim that it’s an MMO is kind of false. I’m not saying the graphics are bad, they just have their moments of making me say “that could look better.” The car handling, at least for a 'keyboard racer,' works but feels somewhat odd. I've yet to try The Crew with a controller or steering wheel. At times I feel like I'm not in complete control of the car. Playing with all the assists off just made the game harder, not so much more enjoyable. I now play with all assists on because I'm already tapping the left and right arrow keys twenty times per second. Vehicle collision bugs me. Sometimes you'll tap a wall or car and bounce off unharmed. Other times you'll nudge the same entity and do a full 180 and come to a screeching halt. The AI of the other racers and police are painfully scripted. Cops have near infinite acceleration and top speed at times. Opponent racers haul♥♥♥♥♥off the line leaving you in the dust for a bit. And towards the end of a race, the AI "gets tired" and basically coasts for the remainder of the race, allowing you to finish first almost every time.Calling The Crew an MMO is incorrect. The roads aren’t full of other players. In fact, they’re almost completely void of other players. The Crew only ever boasts 8 players on the same map at once. If you’ve played other multiplayer racing games, I’m sure you’re used to the whole “drop-in, drop-out” system. Regardless, for most of the time I’ve played The Crew, I’ve generally been either completely alone in my own world or only paired with 1 or 2 other players. Players can invite others to do missions with them, but I’ve only ever received a handful of invites. It seems that with The Crew you either have friends to drive with or you don’t. But then again, I didn't buy it to mindlessly hang out with other players and talk smack about their iridescent paint jobs.But besides this, I find myself compelled to keep playing. The Crew combines open-world racing with some RPG elements. Grinding XP, car parts, and money is there. Oh, and numbers. So many numbers. The sheer amount of digits littering your screen upon completion of a challenge, race, or mission is a bit daunting. But as you do missions, you’ll level up your general level, as well as your car’s level. Thus, more numbers.Needless to say, I like The Crew. I’m sure not everyone will enjoy it. It definitely sets itself apart from other racing games, at least a little. I’m a fan of the customization, the leveling, the open-world, and the numbers (oh baby the numbers). It’s a game to keep an eye on to see where it goes, or maybe even what games spawn because of it and its ancestors. And if you still have a vendetta against Ubisoft after their previous releases, as in 99% of the people reading this, just know that this game actually works...though you will have to suffer because of the UPlay integration.

number of helpful: 10 of 19 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												This game I have to say is one of the best and most anticipated racing games I've come across thus far. It's nothing like iRacing or Assetto Corsa as in a simulation. This is a Need For Speed Underground 3 with a massive open world driving experience. The car customization is impressive. I started off with a Nissan and finished with a Ford Focus fully tuned with street and dirt specs. Doing challenges was a blast, reminds me of the old Trackmania days competing for a better score/time. Physics are great too. The better the parts you get make a noticable difference in the handling of the car. Not to mention the perks you get as you progress through the campaign. Racing with friends was a blast. The 4 of us beat the campaign, got our dirt tuned vehicles and went cross country up and over hills and into canyons. Traveling from Florida to Washington. From NY to LA. Took quite some time even doing 180+ most of the time with a few crashes. We ran into multiple players and ran them off the road (They were pretyty slow) xD The cosmetics are amazing. Back when NFSUG2 was the game to play, this is the baby of that. A big baby though. Years of research and development going into a large massive MMO racing game that has topped my expectations.

content:
Posted: June 24, 2016
Product received for free
												Honestly I don't know what's all this hate for. Most of the people who reviewed this game either played 0.0000001 hours or didn't even bother solving the launch crash issue. If you actually spend a good 10 minutes searching for answers about your problems with the game, and follow the steps you are provided in posts about these issues it will run perfect, but guess that's too hard for ya. So now for the game review and not the stupid toxic community review:The map is massive, the variety of cars is very good and the customisation is amazing as well. Story mode is enjoyable but definitely not the best, but the map and online compensates for it. Graphics are very good considering the size of the map, though I think the weather changes way too often and and there's rain every 10 minutes. I personally like the physics though I'm not gonna touch on them because it depends on the type of physics you like. The game has a good photo mode and very good places for taking photos. So, do I recommend this game? Depends on the person you are, fortunately there is a demo, so you can see if you like the physics, graphics and if the game runs smoothly. The crew has three versions:Normal-29.99€Wild run edition-29.99€Complete edition-49.99€(it has all the dlcs) If you are debating on witch to get, get the wild run edition(if you are on a budget)  or the complete idition. Obviously you can wait for a sale to come, so when there's a sale definitely get the complete edition! Hope you found this useful!P.s(don't look at my hours, this is on my second account)

number of helpful: 11 of 21 people (52%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 8, 2014
												Do I recommend this game?Yes, I had a lot of fun playing itWould I pay full price for it?No, wait until it's on sale. It's good and I enjoyed it, but not that much.Note: It's an arcade style game so I've judged it accordingly. IMO a lot of people are judging the car physics and handling etc like they would for simulators, but it is an arcade game so judge it on it's merits. For an arcade style game I think it does really well.Pros:- Fun single player: Combined the typical "Need for Speed" storyline elements with the GTA style open world roaming allowing you to pick and choose your missions- Co-op can be done on any missions, you can do everything on your own or with friends, you don't need to be alone for some missions or with friends for others- Graphics are great- Haven't encountered ANY issues with the game at all- Hidden cars are found by exploration and unlocking areas of the map, not just winning races and earning moneyCons:- Story Mode isn't very long, I've finished it in 18 hours and I didn't use quick travel at all so spent quite a long time driving to some missions- Limited selection of cars, possibly because they decided to make DLC but would've been better if they were available as part of the core game- Not many "customisation options" at all: This is for both car customisation and audio/graphics/display settings etc. There's really not that much at all compared to other PC games out there- Limited replayability: There are some bonus missions and "skills"  and stuff for completionists to do but other than multiplayer with friends and a few longer missions, there's nothing really to do after you finish the game until more missions are released with the upcoming DLC next year, assuming you buy itOverall, I had fun playing it and would recommend you buy it too if you've enjoyed Need for Speed/Burnout style games in the past, then you'll likely enjoy this too. I would however wait until it is cheaper before purchasing it.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												完美的赛车游戏。有一整个美国供你探索，虽然肯定会有大量的缩减，毕竟才14G。但是现有的地图仍是我玩过的赛车游戏里面最大的。如果你没有X1，但是又想玩Forza Horizon 2.。那么毫无疑问这款游戏绝对是你的最佳之选。玩了8个小时了还在底特律城转悠。大量的任务，优秀的合作模式，排行榜，各种地标建筑，即使作为旅游指南都足够。一切的一切都让你不自觉投入大量时间。城市的刻画也非常到位，可以看到人，还有消防车，卡车，火车，总之地图做的非常精致。，比欧卡2丰富太多。当然两者本身投资肯定也不能比。。极其丰富的改车系统，虽然目前似乎只有10辆车提供给你改。不过每辆车都可以改成多种类型，以适应不同的赛事和跑道。新车型可能会在DLC里面再出，我已经有想买季票的冲动了！！剧情简单明了，作为赛车游戏已经算是描写最好的剧情了。担心UBISOFT服务器的同志们，反正我到现在就掉过一次线，能看到大量的其他玩家。至于别人愿不愿意和你COOP就是另外一回事了。。我到目前为止COOP过三次。。总之，目前来说这60刀花的非常值。还有大量优点需要你自己去感受了。我也说不完。。9.5/10.。0.5分扣给画面。。只能说这画面中等，算不上次时代的感觉。。不过大概画面上去优化又渣了。_(:з」∠)_。。所以这样也好，反正我一直车内视角。。

number of helpful: 46 of 91 people (51%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 6, 2014
												I've been looking for a racing game for PC for ages now. I've played most of the newest- attractive - racing games and honestly, I'm addicted. Grid Autosport was the most recent release that actually got me interested. I like the "Circuit" type of racing cause it reminds me of Gran Turismo 5, which I played for hours on end. I've bought Asseto Corsa, Grid 2, dropped $30 on RaceRoom Racing Experience, and nothing.Nothing caught my eye - I missed the Gran Turismo 5 style of racing game. Winning races, getting money, and then doing what YOU want with that money. Its the best system.A lot of racing games now are rewarded types where you win a certain amount of races and then it awards you with cars, which was frustrating.I doubted this game... a lot. I thought it was going to be a buggy, disgusting visuals, pay $60 for junk type of game... you know, like a lot of PC release titles recently.I watched a few videos and I decided to give it out, wanted to see how big the world is and such.I played 7 hours straight on release day.No crashesNo disconnectsNo bugs (That I've seen)This game is POLISHED. I LOVE IT. The world is absolutely massive and it never forces you to do certain things. I got my Skyline and drove from NY to LA, then to Miami. Not being forced to do tasks. It's perfect, being able to see other players, there car, seeing players FLY down street, drift, hit♥♥♥♥♥♥ its great. The campaign is long too, which is also great! It helps you become more attached to your car, and to save up for upgrades and for a new car. It keeps you interested, and for once, I actually feel like I'm playing a story. I mean really, a lot of games out there are too short to remember. 14-20 hr games? ... Typical ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I've been playing the main story for hours on end and I dont feel remotely close to the end.When you have a game with a longer story, you become more involved in absolutely everything. I havent played a good game in a while that has a story thats long enough for me to immerse myself in it. Im not saying that this game has the best story, but it definitely beats A LOT of recent titles. Just because of its length, and how that length makes you become more involved with the story. A huge plus from what I've experienced.Graphics are awesome, they really are. The game runs INSANELY smooth on my SC GTX 780 and i5 3570K @3.4 GHZ. A lot of releases lately have had fps drops here and there even when there stable.I havent gotten one frame under 60 fps yet, even with the 60 fps lock on. Brilliant (Also because it looks better then a lot of recent games too)If you love cars and want to do what you want with them, get this game, it is ABSOLUTELY worth the $60. And don't go on metacritic for this for PC, its a bunch of winey PC Gamers that are constantly looking for an AMAZING game to come.Sorry, not happening. It may not be perfect, but its one of the very few games this year that has gotten my attention and has hooked me. Cant stop playing.10/10 - Racing games should be more like this and less like Grid and free games.

Posted: July 13, 2015
												As an online arcade racer - this is fairly good. Not 'wow', but its worth buying on sale.As there are different specs (Street, Dirt, Raid, Performance and Circuit), the game covers more of the important ground of racing imo. People who love dirt and mountain climbs will like it, people who are just innit for the thrill of driving the fastest car down the highway will like it, and of course you have that 'standard' city race where the Mini's and Golf's are agile options.There's also abit of fun with the customization part with rims, colors, decals, bumpers - you name it.The downside is the physics where its almost impossible to land on the roof for instance. Or you just fly sky high hitting a rock at 10 km/h.Are you a racing-fan, then this is a game thats worth buying (wait for it to come on sale if you can), just for the sole purpose of the pvp-part. Actually, the singleplayer-story isnt that bad either.Conclusion - racingfan? Yes. Not a racingfan? Dont.

												You know, I understand The Crew is nothing special; however, I think it's still a good game. The microtransactions are there, yes, but to me at least, it's more fun to earn your keep rather than simply buy it. The driving seems solid enough to me, it is a bit lacking on cars if you don't get the DLC, but the ones that are there look very good and are fun to drive. I love the open world, it's beautiful and fun to drive around in and that's part of the reason I got this game. Admitably, I'm not hard to impress when it comes to racing games, but I do like this one just for the world and because I like racers in general. I would advise that if you do want to get it though, wait until a steam sale, not worth the full price.

content:
Posted: May 28, 2015
												Do NOT waste your money on this hollow shell of a game. It's titles like this that move the title of "greediest gaming company" to other people than EA. Your initial $60 gets you a whopping 40 models of car, with somewhere between 1 and 5 tuning settings each. Then, you're forced to pay for any additional content they provide past "updates" for those first 40 cars. Now that wouldn't be so bad if they didn't waft all these extra rides in front of your face on every vehicle select screen, including the new car lot, making every completionist out there cringe. Oh, and the icing on the car cake? Your vinyls/liveries for your car are limited to whatever presets are available in the game, and some cost as much as a new car. Talk about limited customization!On top of all their swindling of your cash, the map is far from fleshed-out, with vast expanses of nothingness where only one relatively small subset of the vehicles in the game can get above 60mph. This makes the game feel very empty, and it's only compounded by only being able to see 7 other players (in an MMO, haha!) at a time in-world. The rest of the "life" in the game are NPC cars with little to no driving skill who will inevitable get in your way more often than not, NPC pedestrians with whom your only interaction is "spooking" them out of the way, and random furry critters that act suspiciously like the people.The story is short and will only take a day or two to finish for a decent player. The endgame content is lacking and the leaderboards are dominated by trainer-using cheaters, so you can give up your dream of being e-famous in this game.It really feels like I paid $60 for a very pretty but very empty tech demo. Despite desperately needing some games to play with new PC friends, I'd never recommend this thing to anyone.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful3 people found this review funny
content:
Posted: January 10, 2015
												For an RPG/Driving game this is a decent game. In terms of execution... oh dear.Beefeing up your ride to twice that of the AI one would think you'd win easily, yeah, not so much. You can ONLY win if you wait for the script to let you win. Don't even think of overtaking cars with pure skill. You can drive like an asshat and win since the AI slows down and lets you win... right before the end. Or, you could drive like you're paid to do it... and loose since you had to break in the last curve. Lets get one thing straight, your skill as a driver has 0 impact wether or not you win races. All you have to do is to wait for the script to let you win. And that is even before the AI starts to cheat.Then there's the police...Going from 0 to 300 in one second - CHECKBreaking suddenyl in front of you at 300 kmh and taking no dmg nor moving whatsoever - CHECKTaking turns at breakneck speed without braking - CHECKdoing a 360 at full speed and then just continue in the opposite direction - CHECKBeing able to send you into a spin just by nudging your car - CHECKBeing able to do precise manouvers EVERY time without fail - CHECKBeing able to catch up to you when you drive the fastest most badass car in the game, and they sit in a "normal" car - CHECKBeing able to pass through other cars with nothing happening - CHECKIn short, the police in this game is not bothered with physics.It has potential, but without fixing a cheating AI and a godmode police... no, not worth getting

content:
Posted: July 19, 2015
												The Crew is by far the best racing/free roam car game I have played in a long time. It's basically a Driver type game with more options and rpg (car mods, perks ect.) elements. You play as Alex, a racer who looks up to his older brother who's in a car club called the 510's. Anyway, some stuff goes down (not going to spoil anything) and you end up going to prison. You end up meeting an FBI agent who offers you a proposal you just can't refuse. From there, the game starts and let me tell you, I've been having a BLAST. The map on this game is HUGE! It took me 35 minutes to drive from NY, NY to L.A. That's insane if you ask me. This game offers tons of racing optoins as well. If you get bored with street, mod your car to race around in the dirt. The game is on sale right now and I would reccomend this to anyone who loves racing games!

content:
Posted: September 22, 2015
												Well what can I say about this game really? At first I thought it was just the racing game I was looking for. But along the way I've learned that I really share a love hate relationship with this game. It seems that buggy have become the normal for Ubisoft this days, instead of releasing quality games like the goold old days. The game was marketed as a big open world full of people, but that's really not what I got. Instead what I find is that you're pretty much driving around alone, rarely running into other players. Check the map, in the demo video it was full of other players. Now that you've checked that one, check yours, you'll see a few people here and thereA couple of my biggest problems with this game, happen to be the AI and respawn systems in general. There are alot of times - too many to count actually - where after I crashed, when I was way ahead in first place, it respawned me in last place, 8 miles away from the other racers. Therefore meaning I had to spend atleast a good five minutes racing my way back to them. Next thing is the traffic. Just yesterday for example, a car came around a corner and just tapped mine, my car went flying into next year and registered as me crashing. Another issue that seems to happen alot is when I'm driving around the entire map, the roads tend to turn into rainbow colors, and I'm getting this ERROR_<something> on the top of my map, where the location information is supposed to be.Final bad thing about this game, lets get to that shall we? The "ram this person" or the overall raid missions. They're overly hard, "frustrating" as some people call it. Overly so if I do say myself.Now apart from the bad, there is the good. The story seems solid, and it is fun to be cruising around in my Skyline enjoying the scenery - just wish there was drifting in here. Why is there no drifting?!If you can look past the bad, get it, if not, don't get it.

content:
Posted: December 10, 2014
												The Crew has terrible driving mechanics, and cheap ways to extend the "story" missions as much as possible. The cars severely overcorrect, there is way too much drift even when driving at lower speeds, the acceleration and braking in every car is terrible, even with extensive upgrades, and it is impossible to make small adjustments when driving. Basically, everything that can go wrong in a driving game's mechanics has in The Crew. Add that to the frequent server down time, DRM, requirement of Uplay, and other cars in races being boosted even when you have much better parts than them, and this game is worth maybe $20, but even that's a stretch. The open world is nice, but when it's this hard to get around it, it makes an extensive map like this much less impressive. This is something I would expect from a new indie games company, not a large company like Ubisoft. Maybe they'll learn from having 3 large releases being terrible this year. If you're going to buy The Crew, wait until it's on sale for less than $20, and don't expect to get much out of the story missions, it's really only good for the open world exploration, and even then it's a stretch.

content:
Posted: December 18, 2014
												I thought The Crew is a great game. I will admit that it isn't  for everyone and i have a few complaints, like the lack of cities in the game, i would've liked to see Atlanta in there, which is where i live, but i digress. It is still very fulfilling to drive across the country and see all the major American sights. My last really good racing game was Midnight Club LA and that game was very frustrating, but extremely fun with friends. This game has a bit of a different feel, since there aren't any game types like there were in Midnight club (I realize they are completely different developers) but I would like to see Some gametypes implemented, like keep-away. But anyway, The Crew is addicting, And from a developer's standpoint, as i am, for a game of this scale, the graphics are pretty insane. The world is massive, but it still looks beautiful and runs very smoothly. Even the little things, like reflections no the cars. I see all these people complaining about visuals  and AI catching up to you. Firstly, what do you expect from the police? a cake walk? and secondly, It would be too easy without auto-catchup. I personally prefer a challenge. It's a good game, and I am optimistic for new features and DLC's. In the meantime, see you on the road.

content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												this games is highly recommended for anyone who liked the Test Drive Unlimited series or any fans of open world racing.  the gameplay makes up for its falws very easily but there are a lot of issues with the game as well.Pros- great graphics- fun gameplay- findable parts and spots make you want to exploreCons- limited car selection on base game* ( UBI made the last Driver game which I feel had a much better and larger car list than this game ) - no custom audio support *- map feels a bit small - storyline stolen from future fast and furious sequel- hidden car stolen directly from TDU2- map scaling and accuracy really bad ( seriously, they totally forgot about MN,IA,WI,NE,OK, etc. )*- no weather transitions ( I have only played the game for 3-4 hrs so this could change ).* this game was claimed by Ubi. to be a "next generation open world racer" and in my opinion these issues are not acceptable for next gen gamesOVERALL Its a fun game that will keep you entertained for hours and probably longer if you buy DLC.  This game feels less like a TDU3 and more like what TDU2 should have been.

number of helpful: 2 of 4 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												This game is awesome, I'm hooked. The launch it seems went off without any problems as far as I could tell and there was lots of people driving around. The way coop missions are done are pretty nice because you can send out a request to people in your general area. Also if your in a crew, they could be like off in a different city for example then start a cool co-op mission and it asks if you want to accept the mission and then you both just start it up seemlessly from wherever you happen to be. So when continuing missions, if you are like sidetracked at the car vendor, they can go on and drive to the next mission progression and start it up. Also, you can see your team mates like line in the sky showing where they are headed next (its shown on the map as well) so you can sorta instantly see if your both heading toward the next place.I'm not nearly covering all the different cool things but one more thing that really stood out to me. In all driving games before where you could explore a city such as grand theft auto for instance, its always been where you go in one direction and eventually you are going to hit a wall and have to make a right or a left then another right and another at the edges of the world. I must say, it was sorta of a weird sensation where I never hit that wall, I just could drive in one direction for a REALLY long time and never reach that invisible wall at the edge of the world. The scenery changes and all of a sudden I'm seeing new landmarks in the distance. Its quite a trip, of course there are eventual walls at the border of the USA but you literally would have to be on a mission to reach it. While just driving in one direction on like a 1 lane road I was also very surprised because quite often I would go through a mission start thing where all of a sudden I'm trying to get the most air off a jump or go as fast as possible for as long as I can staying on the road. It was like a total bonus to me just joy riding off into the sunset.Last thing, there is an option in settings to put refresh rate to 60 FPS. Boom, on Ultra graphics its gorgeous, not sure what some people were saying how it didn't look new gen, It does.Buy it, its worth it.

number of helpful: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 14, 2016
												This game is silly.  Physics are merely a suggestion.  Cars, even parked ones, will periodically float off into space for no apparent reason.  You vehicles can get sandwiched between an opponent and a wall and sent hurtling off in a random direction or fly through the map.  There is even one skill point where, if you attempted to do it in a certain direction, you WILL be sent off the map.  The AI sometimes breaks, and gets stuck trying to get to a checkpoint, or doesn't realize that it's missed a checkpoint and appears at the finish line doing doughnuts while waiting for you.  The game's story is the most cliche and stereotypical street racing story line that's featured in almost every movie and game on the subject.And it is glorious.There's a lot to do in the game.  Even more with the expansion pack.  (At the time of writing, Wild Run has been released, but not Calling All Units, which I am eagerly awaiting.)  Several races, including an up to almost four hours (in reality can be finished in around three) endurance race.  A few different game modes, including an annoying "drive over the boxes" mission type, or a few where you need to try to knock out another car.  Lots of pain jobs and "stickers" to apply to cars, as well as some visual customization (though some are quite lacking).  Unlocking everything can take quite some time, and some of the in-game achievements won't trigger properly.  There's PVP, and you can group up with three other friends to do the races and events together.  With the expansion pack you can set up your own races, and accept random stunts.This is not a serious racing game.  It's pretty arcadey with an open world.  But it is fun.  It's great to laugh at the game when it just goes wrong.  The races can be a lot of fun.  Even just driving around can be enjoyable.  Grab the game and a group of friends and just cruise around the USA.  See who can make the best, or worst, cars.  (No under-lights available, sadly.)  Compete with each other on skill points.  Just don't expect a Forza style realistic simulator.  Accept that this game is DUMB and embrace it, and you can have one of the more entertaining driving experiences out there.(Note: I played the game on Uplay for months before getting a complete version on Steam.)

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												Absolutly amazing. This game is the perfect in-between of GT and Forza. People have been compairing this game to Forza, but in reality they shouldnt because its totally different. Other racing games have been about one thing; race, win, upgrade, and repeat. But this game adds character that everyone has been craving in a racing game. The social racing style gamepaly is incredible to say the least. Example: I pulled up to another driver and reved my engine a little and we both did a burnout and drag raced to the end of the Vegas Strip. Afterwards I flashed my lights and he flashed back and we took off. Do I know that person? Will I ever see him again? No and probably not. But it was insanly fun none the less. Now on to the pros and cons because there are actually quite a lot of both. Pros:1. The open world (probably the games best feature to be honest) is to say the least HUGE. But is also deatailed very very well. 2. The Customization is also very detailed and expansive. 3. Social Interactions and ease of joining friends. Very very easy to join friends. 4. Very little to no delay or lag. When playing with friends its not like TDU2 where you see someone teleporting next to you (Ah the memories). Its to say the least almost seamless even at high speeds. 5. The little need to spend real money on crew credits. I made enough in one day to buy the La Ferrari. Its easy but no OP easy. 6. The graphics on the cars and people. I would give the graphics on the cars a 9/10 for the exterior, and a 8.6/10 for the interior. The people on the other hand are easily 10/10. Cons: 1. The relativly small number of cars in the game is quite frankly annoying. When you compare to other games its very small. My view on this will probably change with the DLC coming out next month. 2. Missing specs: now this is really really annoying to me. Not because there are missing specs. Its that you can still race against those specs in races. If your going to pull specs then pull them completely. Not just from players.  3. Level cap of 50. I got to 50 in 3 days. If its that easy you should have a level cap of 150. That would take a lot longer. 4. You can't sell cars. Now come on Ivory Tower, I know theres some old TDU devs in there. 5. Barley any cosmetic tuning on the raid and circuit specs. You cant tune any of the body work besides wheels and color on those 2 specs. I can understand the circuit spec (not wanting to misrepresent car companies), but raid? 6. Broken car level system with AI. The rubberbanding (When they slow down when your behind and instantly catch up when your ahead) in insane when doing non story AI races. Wheres the logic when a level 800 circuit spec can catch a level 1128 circuit spec easily? To top this review off even with those cons, this game is still absolutly stunning. If I could go back and preorder it over again, I would do it in a heartbeat. The last time I had this much fun in an open world game was probably skyrim. Its amazing where your on the top of a mountian or in a city and see something far in the distance and you can say "I can drive there". Good job Ivory Tower and good job Ubisoft. My final score for this game is 9.7 out of 10.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												Worst racing game experience I've had since the old need for speeds, which is what this feels like, except not as fun. Low quality graphics that remind me of early 360 games, and absolutely god awful car handling. The cars don't ever feel like they are going fast or you are pushing the limits like in other games like forza, the "drifting" is unrealistic and feels like an attempt at the need for speed style of drifting, but its not as refined or fun. You touch one corner, wall, or car and you lose control and the race. This is my least favorite type of racing game because the entire goal of the game is not to crash, not to actually race. There is no skill at all envolved in the racing like finding a line or going as fast as possible, the only objective when playing this game is to avoid the crashing AI morons in front of you, the traffic that doesn't avoid the massive amount of cars heading down the road, or the trees that come up fast because of the terrible handling. This game was Ubisoft's attempt to make a Need for Speed style game for the next gens, and it is a failure. I know I sound like a NFS fanboy, but I hate that series and the best way to describe this is as an outdated, terrible version of need for speed.

												The Crew serves a great concept for a Simulator, Racing and Open World MMO at the same time. But, that's only it - a great concept. Good graphics. Not as resource efficient as other games. Amazing map.What went wrong though?Well, the game itself is enjoyable.. in the first 10 missions. After a point, the feeling gets too repetitive, up to a point where the player, me at least, isn't motivated to keep on playing. The game is a little bit pay2win, in my opinion. Bugs still exist.Verdict: Meh. I mean mind you, if you like open world games and racing, etc, you can try it for yourself, but unfortunately, for me it's a no go. 4/10.And yes, the story and feel plays a big role.

Posted: March 12, 2016
												I'm just here to complain about the dumb keybinds: if you want to use a gamepad controller, and you want to change controls so you can use a manual gearbox, or just change keybinds around, well, you simply can't. The game will only swap controls, so you'll end up with a ♥♥♥♥ed up control scheme after changing 3 bindings. Also, the game doesn't let you get rid of useless♥♥♥♥♥♥you don't need to have on a controller, like a button to see your friends or a button to activate missions when you can do that from the map or the controller start button, or, maybe one of the 4135643513 keys on the keyboard sitting in front of you (Remember this is a pc game? I don't think the devs did).  After dicking around in the menu for 20 minutes you'll think you're all set and start a race, turn a corner, hit the button you bound to look behind you, but instead downshift, hit your handbrake, set off your nitrous, blow the welds on the intake manifold, remove your brake calipers like the white Jetta in Fast and Furious, yell "MONICA!!!!!!", pop a wheelie, say a remembrance prayer for Paul Walker, and lose the race.  If you hold it down, it'll teleport you to New Orleans and put in a reservation for you at Bubba Gump's Shrimp Company. If you want to change the asinine keybinds on this game, run forrest, run the hell away.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												UPDATE: The game is an absolute desert right now, It fails as a multiplayer-only game, it fails as a co-op game and it absolutely fails as a MMO. This game will be dead before the end of 2015, although the fact that only 5.000 people were playin this game on a saturday night tells me that this game is DOA.What a shame, this game could have been amazing.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------The game was already good in BETA, but now that it's finally out I have to say that ubisoft has delivered, I admit that due to recent events (ACU) my expectations were very low, but still, the game has improved considerably from the beta and in all the right areas, handling has received a major upgrade, graphics are good (for a MMO) and the game is running very smoothly.Reviewing a MMO is a very difficult and in some ways unfair since these kinds of games tend to be improved upon with time, however as of right now, the game deserves praise IMO, If you loved the old NFS games like NFSU 1 & 2 and the 2005 version of NFSMW (the greatest racing game of all time), then this game is for you.Score: 6/10.
