content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												*BETA Review* *spent most my time playing from Uplay*I would recomend this game to people who are looking for a good time NOT people who are looking for something realistic. The game has a pretty cool storyline(from what I have been able to play) and very nice graphics(allthough I couldn't play max as my computer is not that great). Lists of pros and cons can  be found belowPROS:1. In depth customizing of cars2. Cool story3. Nice graphics even on low4. Open World US map5. Many cool places to visit6. *In Future* Import music to game(as of second beta Agust 25th-29th 2014)7. Voice chat with other playersCONS:1. Unrealistic map (not very accurate to the actual shape of areas. ex west coast is 1/3 of the west half of the US, texas is practically half way across the map from where it should be)2. Non-realistic handling(cars slide too much)3. No offline mode. Wish I could play without wifi4. Crew only suports 4 people.5. Voice chat is all languages. No separate chanels for english, japanese, arabic, ect.6. Voice chat sounds poorly. Either too loud to too soft. bad quallity.(had my friend do a comparison with me. He said it sounded horrible on the crew vs skype)Overall:Nice game with lots of room to play with. Could have better handling but I don't think this was ment to be a sim. Loved the cars, as each has its own strenghts, and weaknesses. Very cool visual upgrades(my dirt spec Nissan 370Z had some cool hill climb looking parts). The only thing I would have wished for is some late model cars. Not just the newest 370z or the 1967 Mustang. It would have been nice to see a 1999 Viper in beta. I know they had the 2002 Skyline GTR R34 but thats a common car in these games.Overall Loved it. Could it be better? Yes. Hoping for improvements for November? Definitely

number of helpful: 11 of 22 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												The Crew is a fun racing game and has a good online experience -when it works-. The controls are good, they manage to feel responsive under the arcadish style of the game. Each upgrade does have an impact on the car's handling. This is not a driving simulation game, i don't know what was the popular belief in the game but i never seen it as a driving simulator type of game. The way the cars feel reminds me instantly of the old need for speed series, which is something nostalgic and fun. Progression through the game will allow you to unlock different specs for your cars, being able to tune up your favorite ride with up to 5 different specs: Street, Dirt, Perf, Raid,  Circuit. Each spec has an immediate impact on the car's handling.The story is not the most ingaging one though is not too tone down to be silly or childish. Its just there for you to follow. The AI feels cheap, which can sometimes ruin part of the experience. You can indeed outrun them and get some nice distance as long as your driving skills are up to par, but they still somehow manage to keep up a speed that their cars shouldn't be able to have. Not sure if this is working as they intended or a bug, but it would be better if they didn't use cheap tactics to make it "challenging". The cop AI is -okay-. It sure makes me chuckle when i run inches away from a cop at 180mi in a 50 zone and they don't seem to give a damn, but then again, if they actually had to chase people for every time they are speeding the game would become unbearable. Its not hard to escape the cops, but its not an easy task at first. Once you get the hang of it you will be able to lose them easy, especially inside cities, or you could always go rampage and try to shut them down. So far, the only way to have the police chase you is by breaking things, crashing into other cars or the police itself. A small destruction bar will fill up and once its max the chase starts, or if you break things right in front of the cops, that sometimes also triggers the chase. Day to night cycle is highly welcome making the world quite beautiful. I've been stopping several times just to admire the view and take screenshots left and right. The entire presentation of the game's world is quite good. I gotten no texture pop ups so i've been able to enjoy every detail without problems. Some landmark views are just way too good to miss. If you are into these type of exploration, then the game has plenty of areas to go just to get a cool view of things. Exploration is encouraged, be it either for the view or to find abandoned car pieces / antennas. Antennas work like Far Cry's antennas or Watch Dogs CToS, once found they will display all side missions around that specific area plus they will also allow you to fast travel (though about this i am not 100% sure cause at times i could fast travel to locations where antennas were not activated yet). You can use trains or airports to travel from the different locations, this can help at times especially if you are in a hurry and want to go to a specific part of the map that you haven't explore yet, as fast travel won't work on locations you haven't visited. Car and player customization is minimum. I think for a racing game of this caliber, its a shame it has so little to offer. For colors, you are only allowed to change the whole body and only with preset colors for official/metallic/iridescent, there is no color palette. Another lacking thing is the fact that you can only place one sticker on the car, and i can't seem to change the color which makes it almost impossible to bond with your ride. You can modify the front bumper, the interior of the car, hood, spoiler, rear bumper, side mirrors, and the side of the car though i haven't found any car that allows me to change that area in particular. As for player upgrades, the HQ has perks for you to increase that will grant different bonuses.Each mission and side mission will grant you a car piece that directly affects on the performance of your ride. The better you rank in the mission, the higher the upgrade will be, ranking from Bronze to Silver to Gold. Self explanatory, bronze is the minimum upgrade, silver is the medium and gold is the best upgrade. Each car piece comes with a specific bonus (acceleration, top speed, grip or breaks) Every car piece you get is "car-bounded" though the piece will go to your garage, if you want to place that upgrade on another car you will have to pay a small fee. Though if i am correct, the car pieces are only usable with other cars as long as they share the same spec (Race, Dirt, Raid, Perf, Circuit), so if you finished the mission or side mission with a street car, the piece will only work for those specific cars. Upon leveling up you will be given the option to purchase pre-build kits that will instantly upgrade your car. The first kit you get it at level 10, the second one at 20 and so on. This kits are barebones generally level 10 or 20 (depending on the level of the unlock) bronze pieces, but it does help speed up things if you don't want to go through the trouble of racing every mission or side missions again. Every 5 levels the overall performance of every car you own will get a boost.The damage on impact is nice to watch, though the autoregeneration of the car is a bit puzzling. Not sure who's idea was but its strange to see the car going all wolverine on you and shaking off the VISUAL damage. The damage done to the car won't affect the performance on your car though it will affect the life of it, causing you to eventually head back to your HQ to repair your car is the life on your car is low. Same as damage, you car can be covered in dirt and snow but it will wipe off the moment you hit the road.Pairing up with friends is what the game was meant for, and sadly this is were the main problems shows up. Making up a crew with your friends can make progress easier, though the sole act of crewing up with your friends can prove to be frustrating. Connectivity issues, unable to join crews, made this particular experience tedious to no end. For some reason the 4th member, will somehow always find a way to not work and when it does, you might be able to run some missions before you get dc'ed from the servers. The game seems to eat a whole lot of bandwith, so slow connections might have a tough time playing the game with friends. Upon reaching level 10 you will be given the option to choose a faction out of 4. This will enable PVP missions and PVE, and also a type of "salary" that will increase base on your performance.Overall, despite of connectivity issues, the game is fun. Its not the mmo experience it was advertised but what you get is not bad either. Its hard to recommend it unless you are into exploration and have the patience enough to go through the connection issues. When it works, its a really fun game. If you are in doubt, i would suggest to wait a bit longer, maybe a price drop. For racing enthusiasts, the gameplay might be  too arcadish, but its still fun.

content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												9.9/10 Pure awesomeness.I'm not into driving games, infact I haven't really played a driving game since Need For Speed Most Wanted on the PS2. I decided to grab the gold edition of this game because I had some extra steam credit, and god it was worth it. The driving feels really nice, and there are a couple cool types of races. There are regular street races, off road races, and raid races where you try to destroy/damage the opponent's vehicle by ramming into them. The MMO aspects of the game are awesome, It's cool seeing 10 to 15 (you can only usually see around 10 people in one city, and driving around you'll come across different players) driving in the same area as you. The graphics are very nice, and the game runs pretty smoothly. (I play at Max Settings/1080p/50-60fps depending on location. Consoles apparently run it at the same but at locked 30fps.) The map is also massive. I drove from Michigan to Tennessee to Georgia to Florida, seeing cities like Detroit, Nashville, Atlanta, Miami, and other various small towns you can encounter in the countryside. You can literally go across the entire US. (It took me 10 minutes to go from Detroit to Nashville, so I'm assuming it'd be about an hour or so to drive from east coast to west coat and vice versa.) The Crew aspect which makes the game unique is also very fun. You can team up with random players or your friends and race or do missions. Overall, It's extremely fun, and It really suprised me since I'm not a big racing/driving game fan.TL;DR buy this game, you won't be dissapointed.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Heres what you should know about The Crew:TuningThe Tuning Garage is more of a bolt on parts shop. You dont actually tune anything. You select a part and put it on. These parts are unlocked through races and events. I was a bit let down on the whole 'tune your car' thing, since you arent really tuning your car. Customization:There are lots of colors and vinyls to choose from, but it feels lacking in the customization department. Again, a letdown. Yeah, its got body mods and stuff, but it fails to meet expectations set by NFSU2. For instance, you can pick a wide array of stripes, but not choose their color. Multiplayer:This is NOT an MMO. Yes, there are thousands of people online. However, you will only see a few at a time. At no point will you ever see 100 other drivers at the same time. Ive seen a few people, and we have largely ignored each other. 7 other drivers is the maximum it will ever show you at once. They wont always be the samer drivers, but that it the limit. Thus far Ive done everything alone, though Im still pretty new to the whole thing. Now, the game is fun. Especially with a wheel, pedals and H shifter. They will require about 1/2 hour of tweaking to get just right - but its very enjoyable when done. People said not to use manual and hardcore driving assist (which is zero assists such as traction control and stability) but quite honestly, I find this the best way to drive. Granted, I have just under 20 years driving experience and have had my fair share of street and drag races IRL. Manual transmissions are natural to me. The vehicles simply act slightly more natural with everything off. I think the visceral experience of shifting and turning a wheel really add to the experience...Im not even sure Id enjoy the game half as much without it based on the lack of customization available. The game's storyline plays out like a cheap ripoff of a FF movie. Given the arcadey nature of the game, thats ok with me. Cheese is good sometimes. There are tons of short mini games involved such as hitting as many targets as you can, jumps, 'go fast and stay  on the road' races and such. There are plenty of odds and ends to keep you busy for quite some time if you are a completionist. The races and storyline events can be tough, requiring a few shots at it to learn the track before a victory can be eked out most of the time. My most major complaint is the lack of actual tuning and customization. Everything else seems to work as it should at this point. After some hours of trial and error, I have the steering wheel decent enough to handle the game and feel pretty ok with it. Its not perfect by any means, but serviceable. If you want a game with a storyline like a bad Fast & Furious movie, driving style along the veins of NFSU 2, and just a [fair] bit of customization, this might be what you are looking for. If you're looking for realistic handling, deep customization, in depth tuning, and a more serious/sim style experience, this game is not for you. It has none of those things. Im going with Recommended because its not super broken out of the box. Everything works, its fun, but its still a bit of a letdown. I was hoping for real tuning and deeper options for customizing your ride.8/10

												pros:- big♥♥♥♥♥map.- 5 hidden cars 4 hotrods and a buggy (20 hidden wrecks for each).- can fast travel to discovered areas if you cant be bothered driving.- the cars handle like real cars.- a good looking cockpit view.- decent car customization.cons:- cant change rim size- cant change colour of rims (each style of rim has chrome, black, white and gold variants).- car colours are presets (cant adjust to a specific shade).- heavy traffic always appears at the worst time.- traffic also likes to show up at corners when doing intense checkpoint runs.- ♥♥♥♥ traffic.- needs better variety of cars.- checkpoint runs are probably the most frustrating thing in this game i ended up throwing my controller and chair across the room because of one. i was really excited when they first announced this game because it was the racing game i had been dreaming of for so long, an open world racing game with nfs underground style customization and a large variety of cars but as of right now i feel let down and betrayed, i recommend this game because in the end its still a decent game

number of helpful: 14 of 28 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												9.9/10 Pure awesomeness.I'm not into driving games, infact I haven't really played a driving game since Need For Speed Most Wanted on the PS2. I decided to grab the gold edition of this game because I had some extra steam credit, and god it was worth it. The driving feels really nice, and there are a couple cool types of races. There are regular street races, off road races, and raid races where you try to destroy/damage the opponent's vehicle by ramming into them. The MMO aspects of the game are awesome, It's cool seeing 10 to 15 (you can only usually see around 10 people in one city, and driving around you'll come across different players) driving in the same area as you. The graphics are very nice, and the game runs pretty smoothly. (I play at Max Settings/1080p/50-60fps depending on location. Consoles apparently run it at the same but at locked 30fps.) The map is also massive. I drove from Michigan to Tennessee to Georgia to Florida, seeing cities like Detroit, Nashville, Atlanta, Miami, and other various small towns you can encounter in the countryside. You can literally go across the entire US. (It took me 10 minutes to go from Detroit to Nashville, so I'm assuming it'd be about an hour or so to drive from east coast to west coat and vice versa.) The Crew aspect which makes the game unique is also very fun. You can team up with random players or your friends and race or do missions. Overall, It's extremely fun, and It really suprised me since I'm not a big racing/driving game fan.TL;DR buy this game, you won't be dissapointed.

number of helpful: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												First off I would like to say, I have more experince with this game then alot of reviews I have seen, I was a beta tester after all. Here is what you get, a large, open, racing game that takes place in the USA. While not a perfect replica, most major reconizable areas are present, graphics are very good. The content can be realistically beaten in a couple of days if you just run and gun the story. However there is unlimited potential for VS, CoOp and Leaderboard *friend and worldwide*. I will now address some of the falsehoods posted in a few reviews. Getting a crew, and doing CoOp is very much possible, however, I think it is reigon locked, as I seem to be unable to connect to European players and vice versa, for example. There are quite a few people playing, but depends on when you play, like any game, work, school, social events will flux the population. The game is NOT locked at 30 FPS. This USED to be true in the beta, but if you actually enter your settings for the game, you will see the option to "frame limit" to 60. Now in my personal oppinion, 60 is bare minimum for an acceptable PC frame rate, I run a 120HZ monitor and that nothing new to the PC, so I do expect PC relases to hit 60+ without fail. Also, remember, when assessing a game, if you have bare minimum specs, your experince will be drastically different from a high spec machine, so do remember that when publically reviewing.Now some Server stability, there have been issues here, mostly in the midday/late morning, they are not terrible, but for sure more frequant then deiserable, I suspect this will clear up soon. Uplay is almost useless for this game, now I am not a fan of it to start with, but it litterally tells you it is going to use steam to launch the application, if you launch from uplay. Good grief Ubi, just retire Uplay already.Thats it for this review, anything else I have to say about it is purely my personal oppinion and has nothing of relivence for the game.

content:
Posted: December 3, 2014
												This hit the spot for me. Ive been wishing Midnight Club L.A would get put on steam these last couple months, and dayum! this game was perfect. A great addition to the genre with a very expansive world that ive barely seen a quarter of as of this review. The game keeps you motivated with offerings of newer parts, higher ranks, better cars and more excitment. I havent even delved into all this game has to offer such as; PVP, faction missions, and daily/weekly challanges. The game is ever enhanced once you have some friends to drive around with, which truly does make it feel like you are a part of a "Crew". While the game doesnt really feel like an MMO, there are plenty examples of massivity. The map, the amound of races, the customization, and the amount of things you can do. The game drives pretty well! while the handling is iffy, it never takes away from the driving experience, its nice and arcade like. If you have fond memories of Need for Speed Underground 2/Carbon or Midnight Club, or just any racing game period, i definitely recommend The Crew.

number of helpful: 3 of 6 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 4, 2014
												Heres what you should know about The Crew:TuningThe Tuning Garage is more of a bolt on parts shop. You dont actually tune anything. You select a part and put it on. These parts are unlocked through races and events. I was a bit let down on the whole 'tune your car' thing, since you arent really tuning your car. Customization:There are lots of colors and vinyls to choose from, but it feels lacking in the customization department. Again, a letdown. Yeah, its got body mods and stuff, but it fails to meet expectations set by NFSU2. For instance, you can pick a wide array of stripes, but not choose their color. Multiplayer:This is NOT an MMO. Yes, there are thousands of people online. However, you will only see a few at a time. At no point will you ever see 100 other drivers at the same time. Ive seen a few people, and we have largely ignored each other. 7 other drivers is the maximum it will ever show you at once. They wont always be the samer drivers, but that it the limit. Thus far Ive done everything alone, though Im still pretty new to the whole thing. Now, the game is fun. Especially with a wheel, pedals and H shifter. They will require about 1/2 hour of tweaking to get just right - but its very enjoyable when done. People said not to use manual and hardcore driving assist (which is zero assists such as traction control and stability) but quite honestly, I find this the best way to drive. Granted, I have just under 20 years driving experience and have had my fair share of street and drag races IRL. Manual transmissions are natural to me. The vehicles simply act slightly more natural with everything off. I think the visceral experience of shifting and turning a wheel really add to the experience...Im not even sure Id enjoy the game half as much without it based on the lack of customization available. The game's storyline plays out like a cheap ripoff of a FF movie. Given the arcadey nature of the game, thats ok with me. Cheese is good sometimes. There are tons of short mini games involved such as hitting as many targets as you can, jumps, 'go fast and stay  on the road' races and such. There are plenty of odds and ends to keep you busy for quite some time if you are a completionist. The races and storyline events can be tough, requiring a few shots at it to learn the track before a victory can be eked out most of the time. My most major complaint is the lack of actual tuning and customization. Everything else seems to work as it should at this point. After some hours of trial and error, I have the steering wheel decent enough to handle the game and feel pretty ok with it. Its not perfect by any means, but serviceable. If you want a game with a storyline like a bad Fast & Furious movie, driving style along the veins of NFSU 2, and just a [fair] bit of customization, this might be what you are looking for. If you're looking for realistic handling, deep customization, in depth tuning, and a more serious/sim style experience, this game is not for you. It has none of those things. Im going with Recommended because its not super broken out of the box. Everything works, its fun, but its still a bit of a letdown. I was hoping for real tuning and deeper options for customizing your ride.8/10

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												Absolutly amazing. This game is the perfect in-between of GT and Forza. People have been compairing this game to Forza, but in reality they shouldnt because its totally different. Other racing games have been about one thing; race, win, upgrade, and repeat. But this game adds character that everyone has been craving in a racing game. The social racing style gamepaly is incredible to say the least. Example: I pulled up to another driver and reved my engine a little and we both did a burnout and drag raced to the end of the Vegas Strip. Afterwards I flashed my lights and he flashed back and we took off. Do I know that person? Will I ever see him again? No and probably not. But it was insanly fun none the less. Now on to the pros and cons because there are actually quite a lot of both. Pros:1. The open world (probably the games best feature to be honest) is to say the least HUGE. But is also deatailed very very well. 2. The Customization is also very detailed and expansive. 3. Social Interactions and ease of joining friends. Very very easy to join friends. 4. Very little to no delay or lag. When playing with friends its not like TDU2 where you see someone teleporting next to you (Ah the memories). Its to say the least almost seamless even at high speeds. 5. The little need to spend real money on crew credits. I made enough in one day to buy the La Ferrari. Its easy but no OP easy. 6. The graphics on the cars and people. I would give the graphics on the cars a 9/10 for the exterior, and a 8.6/10 for the interior. The people on the other hand are easily 10/10. Cons: 1. The relativly small number of cars in the game is quite frankly annoying. When you compare to other games its very small. My view on this will probably change with the DLC coming out next month. 2. Missing specs: now this is really really annoying to me. Not because there are missing specs. Its that you can still race against those specs in races. If your going to pull specs then pull them completely. Not just from players.  3. Level cap of 50. I got to 50 in 3 days. If its that easy you should have a level cap of 150. That would take a lot longer. 4. You can't sell cars. Now come on Ivory Tower, I know theres some old TDU devs in there. 5. Barley any cosmetic tuning on the raid and circuit specs. You cant tune any of the body work besides wheels and color on those 2 specs. I can understand the circuit spec (not wanting to misrepresent car companies), but raid? 6. Broken car level system with AI. The rubberbanding (When they slow down when your behind and instantly catch up when your ahead) in insane when doing non story AI races. Wheres the logic when a level 800 circuit spec can catch a level 1128 circuit spec easily? To top this review off even with those cons, this game is still absolutly stunning. If I could go back and preorder it over again, I would do it in a heartbeat. The last time I had this much fun in an open world game was probably skyrim. Its amazing where your on the top of a mountian or in a city and see something far in the distance and you can say "I can drive there". Good job Ivory Tower and good job Ubisoft. My final score for this game is 9.7 out of 10.

content:
Posted: August 29, 2014
												Pinged off into space, got an achievement for reaching 250 miles per hour for the first time.     I enjoyed my time playing the beta.  The map is really big.  Its a stylized version of the United States and it takes a good while to drive from one side to the other.  I tried to have cops chase me from one end of the country to the other, but the waypoint line kept dissapearing.  Then I would just get lost.  Wouldn't be a terrible idea to add in compass or some road signs.  You don't have to stick to the roads though, which really increases the area of your playground.        The dirt specced cars handle just as well offroad as they do on pavement, with the sacrifice of speed.  They let you try out the other specs in missions, and they seem pretty fun too.  Performance, Raid and Circuit all have their different specialties as you would expect, though you start with a fullstock car that is pretty slow and handles poorly.  You get your street spec shortly after which will improve incrementally.Car handling is good.  As you level up and gain better parts from missions and skill tests, the way your car handles will change drastically.  They capped the beta at level 10, and I have mostly level 10 gold parts.  The car handles completely different.  It sticks to the road a lot better and feels an awful lot like the Need for Speed series.  When you open the map, your car just sits in the middle of the road.  When I first started the game, I got my crappy fullstock car and did what anyone else would do.  I set a waypoint and put the hammer down.  What I didn't realize at the time was, that other people were also in the process of doing the same thing.  They had moved ahead and were now sitting dead in the road checking their map.  All the npc cars kind of clumped up around them as they slowed down to go around.   Fullstock cars don't really brake or turn well.  They don't happen to stick to the road as you would like them to.  What they do well, is turn into a ballistic missile when you try to evade these little clumps.  I'm sorry to the 5 or so people I smashed into.  That being said, there isn't much of a penalty for causing gigantic accidents.  There also isn't much in the way of reactions.  Cars get dented up, and you get a short little slowed down cutscene of your car smashing into the other car (or tree, etc).  You loose a little health permanently (until you repair) and the rest regenerates.  Sometimes the police get on you because of this.  With a lower level car, it was challenging to get away from the police, but with my 213 street car, it can be more difficult to keep from out running them.  I expect the difficulty will be ramped up by release with more police variation.  They will do a few neat things like try to box you in and stop you.  They'll try to ram and pit you, but for the most part they're kinda dumb.  The cars sound great and the graphics are really well done.  Small glich; the radio plays really low for me.  Sounds like I'm outside the car listening to the music, but the mustang sounds like a guess a mustang would.  There is a good sense of scale and size to the city when you're in it.  The buildings are tall and the streets are pretty wide.  Las Vegas has pretty lights and is in the middle of a desert.  Looks incredible as your driving up to it at night.  Miami is nice, and Washington D.C. is a short hop from New York.  It looks like they could potentially add in other maps as well.  I want them to have better filters for the map, so you can see other people better, and isolate which missions and skills will give you upgrades.  I saw people, but not as many as I expected.  There were definately a lot of people playing, but it seemed to split people up into server shards.  I really hope they allow more people onto the same session at release.  This game really has a lot of potential.  As it is, its a really fun experience.  I enjoyed my time with the game.  Played with a GTX 660; i5 4670k 3.4Ghz Quad Core, 16 GB Ram and a  500GB solid state drive.  Ran very smooth on ultra 1080p fullscreen with an occasional hard stutter that would recover after a few seconds.  They only happened about once an hour or so.  I expect graphics card drivers to fix this, because the game seemed to be optimized for my rig specifically.  I read others have had some problems, as it does require a fairly sturdy computer.

number of helpful: 4 of 8 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: August 30, 2014
												This game is an arcade style racing MMO. A lot of people complain because the gfx arent that great, but to be quite honest they are just fine, fine enough to be able to see the reflections of buildings on your cars paint job. i dont know what it is that people want. Nonetheless, the game is decent and i do look forward to playing it when it comes out, seemed to have a great variety of cars as well as mod parts, and cars are easy for them to add later so thats not even an issue, There are tons of drive space including offroading, with tons of objectives, goals, and acheivements.  My only complaints so far are, that there seems to be too many objectives that arent neccesarry, because you can get car parts so fast it doesnt seem like you even need to go out of your way to try that many objectives before your car is "maxed out" for that area. Also it seems like after about 2 months of playing you will have completed most of the content so unless they quickly add content every few months, there is a chance that the game could become quite boring.          For some reason the game doesnt cater to people who like to drive in manual either, after completing the mini objectives a screen comes up letting you know what you ranked and gives you your reward, but if you are driving in manual trans. the game wont let you down or upshift while this screen is up, which is extremely annoying considering manual is how a car is REALLY supposed to be driven.

number of helpful: 12 of 24 people (50%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												This game is like Need for Speed Underground 2 and Testdrive Unlimited 2 that had a baby and made this game. IF you like those games get this game!!! Steering First people had problems with the steering in this game being to arcadey. Its not at all you have 3 types of steering options in this game and plus many more options on how you turn ect like TDU2. Cars Not many cars in the game just around 40. But I can see alot more cars in upcoming DLC'S Map The map is huge!!!! The traffic in this game is insane there a bit too much to too little and some do crazy stuff too. Its funny to see what the AI will do next though. There also could be a DLC for a new map in the near future. Customization and Tuning You can basicly tune and customize any car to your hearts desire. There not much of customize options but it's way better then the new Need for Speed games. Other The game has soo many nice options in the menu but too bad the fps is limited to 60. Thats the only bad part of the game. If thats even bad.Theres so much to do in this game its insane!!! You can chase people, get chased by cops and even do story. Story is alright for the racing game. It takes around 30 hours to beat the game and thats if you want to rush threw it. There some bugs and glitches that need to be fixed but it's not game breaking. Servers are having some trouble but its launch day. For being an mmo you have 8 people in session thats 2, 4 man crews. But theres alot of people playing. Thats my review. My suggestion:If you do buy this game add me I will play with you. Also the game takes 40 hours to complete. That being said 10 hours of game play = $10 of money that you spent on this game. Therefore 40 hours = $40 and the game should be worth that. I still have more hours on this game then anyother new Call of Duty game. That says alot

number of helpful: 51 of 102 people (50%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 2, 2014
												Deleted this game after not gettin my♥♥♥♥♥♥saved after a 1:30 hours race*** EDIT*** THIS REVIEW IS NEUTRAL! *Wish there was a Maybe button*I was playing a bit more with the game, Thats why i deleted some stand points such as the ai behavior. It seems that it was one race that really bugged me out and that it isn't the entire game Sorry for that!Also i want to make clear that those fps issues MIGHT come from my pc. I dont know how it is for everyone. ok, how to start this. The Crew, The Map is big, The tuning is just amazing. The graphics are ok. It has a 60 FPS cap added in the options menu. Sounds good right? Right! BUTThe physics are HORRIBLE! IT seems that they took watchdogs, And ruined the car physics even more! How is that even possible!? Also one thing i dont understand. Why add a crash cam if you dont have the nicest crash model? this game has nothing to really show of in crashes, Not saying the crash model is ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t, But its nothing you really would want to see in slow motion *I sure enjoy the sometimes flipping out cars due to internet lag from some people* Another Graphical thing.1. What did they do to the render distance? Its horrific. And dont come me with OH ITS OPEN WORLD DUH!. Look at GTA V on console, Skyrim with mods. ARMA 3!2. Racing game.. Where the mirrors on the side and inside DONT WORK in 1st person?! WHAAA? How could you ♥♥♥♥ that up?! I mean in 3rd person they work!?If that wasn't enough this game has a really  hard difficulty. No not that i am against it, GOD i love games that give me a challange, But here with those physics it just gets unfair. There are points in the game where the AI seems to be about 50% faster than you.I was really really excited for this game, And at the start i wasn't dissapointed, BUT HOLY♥♥♥♥♥♥Who had the idea of making a car game that handles so♥♥♥♥♥♥that i would say APB reloaded and watchdogs would be a better racer!But now to the point. I played this game for a bit more and need to say. It is not♥♥♥♥♥♥*like i never stated it anyway just to make sure* BUT this game has some issues i cant over look. Mmo? Not really for me, never have seen more than 2 other player at once (MIGHT BE MY PORT SETTINGS) And i have waited 33 minutes to get into a pvp race (might be because you need about 3 hours to get to the point where you can do it)I was in one crew raid with one other person, No lag issues!Only thing i would say myself is that it is sad that you cant make clans/guilds like in other mmo games. Would have been a nice feature.Also next time when they do a Maintenance which i think is nice. I would REALLY love them to god damn notify us. I am not constantly on the ubisoft forum. Im never on there and i hoped i would never need to!Pros: - Awesome tuning- Big Map- The Car detail is high!Cons: - No clans :(- Physics nuff said- Graphics are worse than expected (talking more about render distance and failed animations such as the Helicopter xD)- Capped 60fps*1- Random lag? Sometimes puts me down to 30fps (may be system problems)Anyone their own- The game is hardMy spec:AMD Fx 8120 Eight core 3,10GHZ Unlocked16GB Ram64 Bit Windows 7AMD Radeon HD 7970 GHZ edition1* I still need to say that a cap at 60fps is bad. YES everyone with a monitor at 60hz WONT really notice a difference. BUT We are Pc player, we can reach the limit of 120+ So why not allow it?http://steamcommunity.com/id/Himichan/screenshot/53245498760014528

Posted: December 10, 2014
												Personally, this is one of the top racing games available at the moment it doesn't win in every aspect but it definately holds its own against some of the best racing titles to date, that being said..Most of the people who are voting the video game down are lying through their teeth about the negatives of this game,For instance i will use One Simple Example,MEATMONSTER1,898 products in accountSaid  "- No Offline Mode- Rather small Fleet of Cars- Unrealistic Engine Sounds- Missing Animations for Cockpit Mirrors. Gear switching and Steering Wheel Speedometer, non funtional Indicators- No possibility to add your own Music- Boring and monotonous Storymode, Races are too short.- Not many Customization Options- The Crew was announced as a "Car MMO", but there are only up to 8 People in one Session.- No changing weather conditions (Except of Snow in the Mountains.)- Microtransactions- The Cars look great, but there is no dynamic lightining, also some of the textures of trees,bushes,... and the water look rather bad."There are about 8 points in here where he is BLATANTLY lying to the public, reviews like this should be taken down.-You can easily make your own music lists,-The car sounds in this game are almost identical to the real versions, take the time to youtube some videos.-Complains about lack of MMO,  because a race has a limit of how many contestants even though you see people driving past you that you could easily group with almost every minute, Because Raids are max 40 people, is World of warcraft not an MMO either?Honestly i could go on, but you get the point these kids don't like the game so they are slandering and lying about it,Just move past ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ reviews like that.

												 First part is for the people who are afraid of the crew because of ubisoft glitches, well...the online servers are functioning, and stable. When you’re driving, you don’t fall through the world or you don’t see cars convulsing under the will of a borked physics model.And the game is a unique racing MMORPG like none other,the whole of North America is in the game, gorgous, and varied open world to explore.A lot of players everywhere.Every story mission can be played co-op,nice PvP. Lots of different and varied missions/quests all over. Since it is a mmo and a racing game surprisingly it has a decent story. Tons of things to level up and customzie.There are specs for everyone as well(Street,Dirt(rally),Perf,Raid(off-road),Circuit).
